[THE SPORT OF THE GODS]31-the sport of the gods

by

[PAUL LAURENCE DUNBAR]32-paul laurence dunbar

[I]0-de deepo

[THE HAMILTONS

Fiction]33-the hamiltons has said so much in regret of the old days when there were plantations and [overseers]128-overseers and [masters]129-masters and [slaves]130-slaves , that it was good to come upon [such a household as [Berry Hamilton]34-berry 's]131-such a household as berry hamilton 's , if for no other reason than that it afforded a relief from the monotony of tiresome iteration .

[The little cottage in which [he]34-berry lived]132-the little cottage in which he lived with [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife , [Fannie]35-fannie , who was [housekeeper to [the Oakleys]36-the oakleys]134-housekeeper to the oakleys , and [[his]34-berry son]135-his son and daughter , [Joe]37-joe and [Kit]38-kitty , sat back in [the yard]136-the yard some hundred paces from [the mansion of [[his]34-berry employer]138-his employer]137-the mansion of his employer . [It]139-it was somewhat in the manner of [the old cabin in [the quarters]141-the quarters]140-the old cabin in the quarters , with which usage as well as tradition had made both [master]142-master and [servant]143-servant familiar . But , unlike [the cabin of the elder day]144-the cabin of the elder day , [it]139-it was [a neatly furnished , modern house]145-a neatly furnished , modern house , [the home of [a typical , good - living negro]147-a typical , good - living negro]146-the home of a typical , good - living negro . For twenty years [Berry Hamilton]34-berry had been [butler for [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice]148-butler for maurice oakley . [He]39-maurice was [one of [the many slaves who upon [their]150-the many slaves who upon their accession to freedom accession to freedom]150-the many slaves who upon their accession to freedom had not left [the South]1-the south , but had wandered from place to place in [[their]150-the many slaves who upon their accession to freedom own beloved section]151-their own beloved section , waiting , working , and struggling to rise with [its]151-their own beloved section rehabilitated fortunes]149-one of the many slaves who upon their accession to freedom had not left the south , but had wandered from place to place in their own beloved section , waiting , working , and struggling to rise with its rehabilitated fortunes .

The first faint signs of recovery were being seen when [he]39-maurice came to [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice as [a servant]152-a servant . Through thick and thin [he]39-maurice remained with [him]39-maurice , and when the final upward tendency of [[his]39-maurice employer]138-his employer began [his]39-maurice fortunes had increased in like manner . When , having married , [Oakley]39-maurice bought [the great house in which [he]39-maurice now lived]154-the great house in which he now lived , [he]39-maurice left [[the little servant]155-the little servant 's cottage]156-the little servant 's cottage in [the yard]136-the yard , for , as [he]39-maurice said laughingly , " There is no telling when [Berry]34-berry will be following [my]39-maurice example and be taking [a wife]1557-a wife unto [himself]34-berry . "[39-maurice]

[His]39-maurice joking prophecy came true very soon . [Berry]34-berry had long had a tenderness for [Fannie]35-fannie , [the housekeeper]158-the housekeeper . As [she]35-fannie retained [her]35-fannie post under [the new Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley , and as there was [a cottage ready to]159-a cottage ready to [his]34-berry hand , [it]159-a cottage ready to promised to be cheaper and more convenient all around to get married . [Fannie]35-fannie was willing , and so the matter was settled .

[Fannie]35-fannie had never regretted [her]35-fannie choice , nor had [Berry]34-berry ever had cause to curse [his]34-berry utilitarian ideas . The stream of years had flowed pleasantly and peacefully with [them]160-their . [Their]160-their little sorrows had come , but [their]160-their joys had been many .

As time went on , [the little cottage]161-the little cottage grew in comfort . [It]161-the little cottage was replenished with things handed down from " [the house]1558-the house "[162-the pair] from time to time and with others bought from [the pair]162-the pair 's earnings .

[Berry]34-berry had time for [[his]34-berry lodge]163-his lodge , and [Fannie]35-fannie time to spare for [[her]35-fannie own house and [garden]165-garden]164-her own house and garden . Flowers bloomed in [the little plot]166-the little plot in front and behind [it]161-the little cottage ; vegetables and greens testified to [the housewife]167-the housewife 's industry .

Over the door of [the little house]168-the little house a fine Virginia creeper bent and fell in graceful curves , and a cluster of insistent morning - glories clung in summer about [its]161-the little cottage stalwart stock .

It was into this bower of peace and comfort that [Joe]37-joe and [Kitty]38-kitty were born . [They]160-their brought a new sunlight into [the house]1558-the house and a new joy to [the father]170-the father 's and [mother]171-mother 's hearts . [Their]160-their early lives were pleasant and carefully guarded . [They]160-their got what schooling [the town]172-the town afforded , but [both]173-both went to work early , [Kitty]38-kitty helping [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother and [Joe]37-joe learning the trade of [barber]175-barber .

[Kit]38-kitty was the delight of [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother 's life . [She]38-kitty was a pretty , cheery little thing , and could sing like [a lark]177-a lark . [Joe]37-joe too was of a cheerful disposition , but from scraping the chins of [aristocrats]178-aristocrats came to imbibe some of [their]178-aristocrats ideas , and rather too early in life bid fair to be [a dandy]179-a dandy . But [[his]37-joe father]180-his father encouraged [him]37-joe , for , said [he]37-joe , " It 's de p'opah thing fu ' [a man what waits on quality to have quality mannahs an ' to waih quality clothes]1559-a man what waits on quality to have quality mannahs an ' to waih quality clothes . "[37-joe]

" ' T ai n't no use to be a - humo'in ' [dat boy]1560-dat boy too much , [Be'y]1560-dat boy , "[35-fannie] [Fannie]35-fannie had replied , although [she]35-fannie did fully as much " humo'in ' "[35-fannie] as [[her]35-fannie husband]181-her husband ; " hit [sho]1561-sho ' do mek ' [him]182-the boy biggety , an ' a biggety po ' niggah is a ' bomination befo ' de face of [de Lawd]41-de lawd ; but [I]35-fannie know ' t ai n't no use a - talkin ' to [you]182-the boy , fu ' [you]182-the boy plum boun ' up in [dat Joe]1562-dat joe . "[35-fannie]

[Her]35-fannie own eyes would follow [the boy]182-the boy lovingly and proudly even as [she]35-fannie chided . [She]35-fannie could not say very much , either , for [Berry]34-berry always had the reply that [she]35-fannie was spoiling [Kit]38-kitty out of all reason . [The girl]183-the girl did have the prettiest clothes of any of [her]183-the girl race in [the town]172-the town , and when [she]183-the girl was to sing for the benefit of [the A. M. E. church]185-the a. m. e. church or for the benefit of [[[her]183-the girl father]186-her father 's society]187-her father 's society , [the Tribe of [Benjamin]42-benjamin]188-the tribe of benjamin , there was nothing too good for [her]183-the girl to wear . In this too [they]189-they were aided and abetted by [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley , who also took a lively interest in [the girl]183-the girl .

So [the two doting parents]191-the two doting parents had [their]191-the two doting parents chats and [their]191-the two doting parents jokes at [each other]192-each other 's expense and went bravely on , doing [their]191-the two doting parents duties and spoiling [[their]191-the two doting parents children]193-their children much as [white fathers]194-white fathers and [mothers]195-mothers are wo nt to do .

What [the less fortunate negroes of [the community]197-the community]196-the less fortunate negroes of the community said of [them]196-the less fortunate negroes of the community and [[their]196-the less fortunate negroes of the community offspring]198-their offspring is really not worth while . [Envy]43-envy has a sharp tongue , and when has not [the aristocrat]199-the aristocrat been the target for [the plebeian]200-the plebeian 's sneers ?

[Joe]37-joe and [Kit]38-kitty were respectively eighteen and sixteen at the time when the preparations for [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice 's farewell dinner to [[his]39-maurice brother]201-his brother [Francis]44-frank were agitating [the whole Hamilton household]202-the whole hamilton household . [All of [them]203-all of them]203-all of them had a hand in the work : [Joe]37-joe had shaved [the two men]204-the two men ; [Kit]38-kitty had helped [[Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley 's maid]205-mrs. oakley 's maid ; [the mother]206-the mother had fretted [herself]206-the mother weak over the shortcomings of [a cook that had been in [the family]208-the family]207-a cook that had been in the family nearly as long as [herself]206-the mother , while [Berry]34-berry was stern and dignified in anticipation of the glorious figure [he]39-maurice was to make in serving .

When all was ready , peace again settled upon [the Hamiltons]33-the hamiltons . [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton , in the whitest of white aprons , prepared to be on hand to annoy [the cook]209-the cook still more ; [Kit]38-kitty was ready to station [herself]38-kitty where [she]38-kitty could view the finery ; [Joe]37-joe had condescended to promise to be [home]210-home in time to eat some of the good things , and [Berry]34-berry -- [Berry]34-berry was gorgeous in [his]34-berry evening suit with the white waistcoat , as [he]34-berry directed [the nimble waiters hither and thither]211-the nimble waiters hither and thither .

II

A FAREWELL DINNER

[Maurice Oakley]39-maurice was not [a man of sudden or violent enthusiasms]212-a man of sudden or violent enthusiasms . Conservatism was the quality that had been the foundation of [his]34-berry fortunes at a time when the disruption of [the country]213-the country had involved [most of [the men of [his]34-berry region]215-the men of his region in ruin]214-most of the men of his region in ruin .

Without giving any one ground to charge [him]34-berry with being lukewarm or renegade to [his]34-berry cause , [he]34-berry had yet so adroitly managed [his]34-berry affairs that when peace came [he]34-berry was able quickly to recover much of the ground lost during the war . With a rare genius for adapting [himself]34-berry to new conditions , [he]34-berry accepted the changed order of things with a passive resignation , but with a stern determination to make the most out of any good that might be in it .

It was a favourite remark of [his]34-berry that there must be some good in every system , and it was the duty of [the citizen]216-the citizen to find out that good and make it pay . [He]34-berry had done this . [[His]34-berry house]217-his house , [his]34-berry reputation , [his]34-berry satisfaction , were all evidences that [he]34-berry had succeeded .

[A childless man]218-a childless man , [he]34-berry bestowed upon [[his]34-berry younger brother]219-his younger brother , [Francis]44-frank , the enthusiasm [he]34-berry would have given to [a son]220-a son . [[His]34-berry wife]133-his wife shared with [[her]133-his wife husband]181-her husband this feeling for [[her]133-his wife brother - in - law]223-her brother - in - law , and with [him]223-her brother - in - law played the role of [parent]224-parent , which had otherwise been denied [her]133-his wife .

It was true that [Francis Oakley]44-frank was only [a half - brother to [Maurice]39-maurice]225-a half - brother to maurice , [the son of a second and not too fortunate marriage]226-the son of a second and not too fortunate marriage , but there was no halving of the love which [the elder man]227-the elder man had given to [him]44-frank from childhood up .

At the first intimation that [Francis]44-frank had artistic ability , [[his]44-frank brother]201-his brother had placed [him]44-frank under [the best masters in [America]2-america]229-the best masters in america , and later , when the promise of [his]44-frank youth had begun to blossom , [he]201-his brother sent [him]44-frank to [Paris]3-paris , although the expenditure just at that time demanded a sacrifice which might have been the ruin of [Maurice]39-maurice 's own career . [Francis]44-frank 's promise had never come to entire fulfilment . [He]44-frank was always trembling on the verge of a great success without quite plunging into it . Despite the joy which [his]44-frank presence gave [[his]44-frank brother]201-his brother and [sister - in - law]231-sister - in - law , most of [his]44-frank time was spent abroad , where [he]44-frank could find just the atmosphere that suited [his]44-frank delicate , artistic nature . After a visit of two months [he]44-frank was about returning to [Paris]3-paris for a stay of five years . At last [he]44-frank was going to apply [himself]44-frank steadily and try to be less [the dilettante]232-the dilettante .

[The company which [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice brought together to say good - bye to [[his]39-maurice brother]201-his brother on this occasion]233-the company which maurice oakley brought together to say good - bye to his brother on this occasion was drawn from the best that [this fine old [Southern town]236-southern town afforded]235-this fine old southern town afforded . There were [colonels there at whose titles and the owners]237-colonels there at whose titles and the owners ' rights to [them]237-colonels there at whose titles and the owners [no one]238-no one could laugh ; there were [brilliant women there who had queened it in [Richmond]4-richmond , [Baltimore]5-baltimore , [Louisville]6-louisville , and [New Orleans]7-new orleans]239-brilliant women there who had queened it in richmond , baltimore , louisville , and new orleans , and [every Southern capital under the old regime]240-every southern capital under the old regime , and there were [younger ones there of wit and beauty]241-younger ones there of wit and beauty who were just beginning to hold [their]241-younger ones there of wit and beauty court . For [Francis]44-frank was a great favourite both with [men]242-men and [women]243-women . [He]44-frank was [a handsome man]244-a handsome man , tall , slender , and graceful . [He]44-frank had the face and brow of [a poet , a pallid face framed in a mass of dark hair]245-a poet , a pallid face framed in a mass of dark hair . There was a touch of weakness in [his]44-frank mouth , but this was shaded and half hidden by a full mustache that made much forgivable to beauty - loving eyes .

It was generally conceded that [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley was [a hostess whose guests]246-a hostess whose guests had no awkward half - hour before dinner . No praise could be higher than this , and to - night [she]40-mrs. oakley had no need to exert [herself]40-mrs. oakley to maintain this reputation . [[Her]40-mrs. oakley brother - in - law]223-her brother - in - law was the life of [the assembly]248-the assembly ; [he]223-her brother - in - law had wit and daring , and about [him]223-her brother - in - law there was just that hint of charming danger that made [him]223-her brother - in - law irresistible to [women]243-women . [The guests]250-the guests heard the dinner announced with surprise,--an unusual thing , except in [this house]251-this house .

Both [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice and [[his]39-maurice wife]133-his wife looked fondly at [the artist]253-the artist as [he]39-maurice went in with [Claire Lessing]46-claire . [He]39-maurice was talking animatedly to [the girl]183-the girl , having changed the general trend of the conversation to a manner and tone directed more particularly to [her]183-the girl . While [she]183-the girl listened to [him]39-maurice , [her]183-the girl face glowed and [her]183-the girl eyes shone with a light that [every man]255-every man could not bring into [them]256-them .

As [Maurice]39-maurice and [[his]39-maurice wife]133-his wife followed [him]39-maurice with [their]258-they gaze , the same thought was in [their]258-they minds , and it had not just come to [them]258-they , Why could not [Francis]44-frank marry [Claire Lessing]46-claire and settle in [America]2-america , instead of going back ever and again to that life in [the Latin Quarter]259-the latin quarter ? [They]258-they did not believe that it was a bad life or a dissipated one , but from the little that [they]258-they had seen of it when [they]258-they were in [Paris]3-paris , it was at least a bit too free and unconventional for [their]258-they traditions . There were , too , temptations which must assail [any man of [Francis]44-frank]260-any man of francis 's looks and talents . [They]258-they had perfect faith in the strength of [his]44-frank manhood , of course ; but could [they]258-they have had [their]258-they way , it would have been [their]258-they will to hedge [him]44-frank about so that no breath of evil invitation could have come nigh to [him]44-frank .

But [this younger brother]261-this younger brother , [this half ward of [theirs]258-they]262-this half ward of theirs , was [an unruly member]263-an unruly member . [He]261-this younger brother talked and laughed , rode and walked , with [Claire]46-claire Lessing with the same free abandon , the same show of uninterested good comradeship , that [he]261-this younger brother had used towards [her]46-claire when [they]258-they were [boy]264-boy and [girl]265-girl together . There was not a shade more of warmth or self - consciousness in [his]261-this younger brother manner towards [her]46-claire than there had been fifteen years before . In fact , there was less , for there had been a time , when [he]261-this younger brother was six and [Claire]46-claire three , that [Francis]44-frank , with a boldness that [the lover of maturer years]266-the lover of maturer years tries vainly to attain , had announced to [Claire]46-claire that [he]44-frank was going to marry [her]46-claire . But [he]44-frank had never renewed this declaration when it came time that it would carry weight with it .

[They]258-they made a fine picture as [they]258-they sat together to - night . One seeing [them]258-they could hardly help thinking on the instant that [they]258-they were made for [each other]192-each other . Something in [the woman]268-the woman 's face , in [her]268-the woman expression perhaps , supplied a palpable lack in [the man]269-the man . The strength of [her]268-the woman mouth and chin helped the weakness of [his]269-the man . [She]268-the woman was [the sort of woman who , if ever [he]269-the man came to a great moral crisis in [his]269-the man life]270-the sort of woman who , if ever he came to a great moral crisis in his life , would be able to save [him]269-the man if [she]268-the woman were near . And yet [he]269-the man was going away from [her]268-the woman , giving up the pearl that [he]269-the man had only to put out [his]269-the man hand to take .

Some of these thoughts were in the minds of [the brother and sister]271-the brother and sister now .

" Five years does seem a long while , "[44-frank] [Francis]44-frank was saying , " but if [a man]1563-a man accomplishes anything , after all , it seems only a short time to look back upon . "[44-frank]

" All time is short to look back upon . It is the looking forward to it that counts . It does n't , though , with [a man]1563-a man , [I]268-the woman suppose . [He]1563-a man 's doing something all the while . "[268-the woman]

" Yes , [a man]1563-a man is always doing something , even if only waiting ; but waiting is such unheroic business . "[44-frank]

" That is the part that usually falls to [a woman]1566-a woman 's lot . [I]268-the woman have no doubt that [some dark - eyed mademoiselle]1567-some dark - eyed mademoiselle is waiting for [you]44-frank now . "[268-the woman]

[Francis]44-frank laughed and flushed hotly . [Claire]46-claire noted the flush and wondered at it . Had [she]46-claire indeed hit upon the real point ? Was that the reason that [he]269-the man was so anxious to get back to [Paris]3-paris ? The thought struck a chill through [her]46-claire gaiety . [She]46-claire did not want to be suspicious , but what was the cause of that tell - tale flush ? [He]269-the man was not a man easily disconcerted ; then why so to - night ? But [[her]46-claire companion]272-her companion talked on with such innocent composure that [she]46-claire believed [herself]46-claire mistaken as to the reason for [his]269-the man momentary confusion .

[Someone]273-someone cried gayly across the table to [her]46-claire : " Oh , [Miss Claire]47-miss claire , [you]46-claire will not dare to talk with such little awe to [[our]1568-our friend]1569-our friend when [he]1569-our friend comes back with [his]1569-our friend ribbons and [his]1569-our friend medals . Why , [we]1568-our shall all have to bow to [you]46-claire , [Frank]44-frank ! "[273-someone]

" [You]44-frank 're wronging [me]44-frank , [Esterton]48-esterton , "[44-frank] said [Francis]44-frank . " No foreign decoration could ever be to [me]44-frank as much as the flower of approval from [the fair women of [[my]44-frank own State]1571-my own state]1570-the fair women of my own state . "[44-frank]

" Hear ! "[274-the ladies] cried [the ladies]274-the ladies .

" Trust [artists]1572-artists and [poets]1573-poets to pay pretty compliments , and [this wily friend of [mine]44-frank]1574-this wily friend of mine pays [his]272-her companion at [my]273-someone expense . "[273-someone]

" A good bit of generalship , that , [Frank]44-frank , "[275-an old military man] [an old military man]275-an old military man broke in . " [Esterton]48-esterton opened the breach and [you]44-frank at once galloped in . That 's the highest art of war . "[275-an old military man]

[Claire]47-miss claire was looking at [[her]47-miss claire companion]272-her companion . Had [he]272-her companion meant the approval of [the women]277-the women , or was it [one woman that [he]272-her companion cared for]278-one woman that he cared for ? Had the speech had a hidden meaning for [her]47-miss claire ? [She]47-miss claire could never tell . [She]47-miss claire could not understand [this man who had been so much to [her]47-miss claire]279-this man who had been so much to her for so long , and yet did not seem to know it ; [who was full of romance and fire and passion]280-who was full of romance and fire and passion , and yet looked at [her]47-miss claire beauty with the eyes of [a mere comrade]281-a mere comrade . [She]47-miss claire sighed as [she]47-miss claire rose with [the rest of [the women]277-the women]282-the rest of the women to leave the table .

[The men]284-the men lingered over [their]284-the men cigars . The wine was old and the stories new . What more could [they]284-the men ask ? There was a strong glow in [Francis Oakley]44-frank 's face , and [his]272-her companion laugh was frequent and ringing . Some discussion came up which sent [him]272-her companion running up to [[his]272-her companion room]285-his room for a bit of evidence . When [he]272-her companion came down it was not to come directly to [the dining - room]286-the dining - room . [He]272-her companion paused in [the hall]287-the hall and despatched [a servant]152-a servant to bring [[his]272-her companion brother]201-his brother to [him]272-her companion .

[Maurice]39-maurice found [him]272-her companion standing weakly against the railing of the stairs . Something in [his]272-her companion air impressed [[his]272-her companion brother]201-his brother strangely .

" What is it , [Francis]44-frank ? "[39-maurice] [he]39-maurice questioned , hurrying to [him]201-his brother .

" [I]201-his brother have just discovered a considerable loss , "[201-his brother] was the reply in a grieved voice .

" If it is no worse than loss , [I]201-his brother am glad ; but what is it ? "[201-his brother]

" Every cent of money that [I]201-his brother had to secure [my]201-his brother letter of credit is gone from [[my]201-his brother bureau]1575-my bureau . "[201-his brother]

" What ? When did it disappear ? "[201-his brother]

" [I]201-his brother went to [[my]201-his brother bureau]1575-my bureau to - night for something and found the money gone ; then [I]201-his brother remembered that when [I]201-his brother opened it two days ago [I]201-his brother must have left the key in the lock , as [I]201-his brother found it to - night . "[201-his brother]

" It 's a bad business , but do n't let 's talk of it now . Come , let 's go back to [[our]1577-our guests]1578-our guests . Do n't look so cut up about it , [Frank]44-frank , [old man]1579-old man . It is n't as bad as it might be , and [you]44-frank must n't show a gloomy face to - night . "[201-his brother]

[The younger man]291-the younger man pulled [himself]291-the younger man together , and re - entered [the room]292-the room with [[his]291-the younger man brother]201-his brother . In a few minutes [his]291-the younger man gaiety had apparently returned .

When [they]294-they rejoined [the ladies]274-the ladies , even [their]274-the ladies quick eyes could detect in [his]291-the younger man demeanour no trace of the annoying thing that had occurred . [His]291-the younger man face did not change until , with a wealth of fervent congratulations , [he]291-the younger man had bade [the last guest]296-the last guest good - bye .

Then [he]291-the younger man turned to [[his]291-the younger man brother]201-his brother . " When [Leslie]49-leslie is in bed , come into [the library]1580-the library . [I]291-the younger man will wait for [you]49-leslie there , "[291-the younger man] [he]291-the younger man said , and walked sadly away .

" Poor , foolish [Frank]44-frank , "[201-his brother] mused [[his]291-the younger man brother]201-his brother , " as if the loss could matter to [him]44-frank . "[201-his brother]

III

THE THEFT

[Frank]44-frank was very pale when [[his]44-frank brother]201-his brother finally came to [him]44-frank at [the appointed place]300-the appointed place . [He]291-the younger man sat limply in [his]291-the younger man chair , [his]291-the younger man eyes fixed upon the floor .

" Come , brace up now , [Frank]44-frank , and tell [me]291-the younger man about it . "[291-the younger man]

At the sound of [[his]44-frank brother]201-his brother 's voice [he]44-frank started and looked up as though [he]44-frank had been dreaming .

" [I]44-frank do n't know what [you]201-his brother 'll think of [me]44-frank , [Maurice]39-maurice , "[44-frank] [he]44-frank said ; " [I]44-frank have never before been guilty of such criminal carelessness . "[44-frank]

" Do n't stop to accuse [yourself]44-frank . [Our]1581-our only hope in this matter lies in prompt action . Where was the money ? "[291-the younger man]

" In the oak cabinet and lying in the bureau drawer . Such a thing as a theft seemed so foreign to [this place]1582-this place that [I]44-frank was never very particular about the box . But [I]44-frank did not know until [I]44-frank went to [it]1582-this place to - night that the last time [I]44-frank had opened it [I]44-frank had forgotten to take the key out . It all flashed over [me]44-frank in a second when [I]44-frank saw it shining there . Even then [I]44-frank did n't suspect anything . [You]201-his brother do n't know how [I]44-frank felt to open that cabinet and find all [my]44-frank money gone . It 's awful . "[44-frank]

" Do n't worry . How much was there in all ? "[291-the younger man]

" Nine hundred and eighty - six dollars , most of which , [I]44-frank am ashamed to say , [I]44-frank had accepted from [you]39-maurice . "[44-frank]

" [You]201-his brother have no right to talk that way , [Frank]44-frank ; [you]201-his brother know [I]291-the younger man do not begrudge a cent [you]201-his brother want . [I]291-the younger man have never felt that [[my]291-the younger man father]1583-my father did quite right in leaving [me]291-the younger man the bulk of the fortune ; but [we]1584-we wo n't discuss that now . What [I]291-the younger man want [you]201-his brother to understand , though , is that the money is [yours]201-his brother as well as [mine]291-the younger man , and [you]201-his brother are always welcome to it . "[291-the younger man]

[The artist]253-the artist shook [his]253-the artist head . " No , [Maurice]39-maurice , "[253-the artist] [he]253-the artist said , " [I]253-the artist can accept no more from [you]39-maurice . [I]253-the artist have already used up all [my]253-the artist own money and too much of yours in this hopeless fight . [I]253-the artist do n't suppose [I]253-the artist was ever cut out for [an artist]1585-an artist , or [I]253-the artist 'd have done something really notable in this time , and would not be a burden upon [those who care for [me]253-the artist]1586-those who care for me . No , [I]253-the artist 'll give up going to [Paris]3-paris and find some work to do . "[253-the artist]

" [Frank]44-frank , [Frank]44-frank , be silent . This is nonsense , Give up [your]201-his brother art ? [You]201-his brother shall not do it . [You]201-his brother shall go to [Paris]3-paris as usual . [Leslie]49-leslie and [I]291-the younger man have perfect faith in [you]201-his brother . [You]201-his brother shall not give up on account of this misfortune . What are the few paltry dollars to [me]291-the younger man or to [you]201-his brother ? "[291-the younger man]

" Nothing , nothing , [I]253-the artist know . It is n't the money , it 's the principle of the thing . "[253-the artist]

" [Principle]50-principle be hanged ! [You]201-his brother go back to [Paris]3-paris to - morrow , just as [you]201-his brother had planned . [I]291-the younger man do not ask it , [I]291-the younger man command it . "[291-the younger man]

[The younger man]291-the younger man looked up quickly .

" Pardon [me]291-the younger man , [Frank]44-frank , for using those words and at such a time . [You]44-frank know how near [my]291-the younger man heart [your]44-frank success lies , and to hear [you]44-frank talk of giving it all up makes [me]291-the younger man forget [myself]291-the younger man . Forgive [me]291-the younger man , but [you]44-frank 'll go back , wo n't [you]44-frank ? "[291-the younger man]

" [You]44-frank are too good , [Maurice]39-maurice , "[44-frank] said [Frank]44-frank impulsively , " and [I]44-frank will go back , and [I]44-frank 'll try to redeem [myself]44-frank . "[44-frank]

" There is no redeeming of [yourself]44-frank to do , [[my]291-the younger man dear boy]1587-my dear boy ; all [you]44-frank have to do is to mature [yourself]44-frank . [We]1588-we 'll have [a detective]1589-a detective down and see what [we]1588-we can do in this matter . "[291-the younger man]

[Frank]44-frank gave a scarcely perceptible start . " [I]44-frank do so hate such things , "[44-frank] [he]44-frank said ; " and , anyway , what 's the use ? [They]1590-they 'll never find out where the stuff went to . "[44-frank]

" Oh , [you]44-frank need not be troubled in this matter . [I]291-the younger man know that such things must jar on [your]44-frank delicate nature . But [I]291-the younger man am [a plain hard - headed business man]1591-a plain hard - headed business man , and [I]291-the younger man can attend to it without distaste . "[291-the younger man]

" But [I]44-frank hate to shove everything unpleasant off on [you]44-frank , It 's what [I]44-frank ' ve been doing all [my]44-frank life . "[44-frank]

" Never mind that . Now tell [me]291-the younger man , who was [the last person [you]44-frank remember in [[your]44-frank room]1593-your room]1592-the last person you remember in your room ? "[291-the younger man]

" Oh , [Esterton]48-esterton was up [there]1594-there awhile before dinner . But [he]48-esterton was not alone two minutes . "[44-frank]

" Why , [he]48-esterton would be out of the question anyway . Who else ? "[291-the younger man]

" [Hamilton]34-berry was up yesterday . "[44-frank]

" Alone ? "[291-the younger man]

" Yes , for a while . [[His]34-berry boy]1595-his boy , [Joe]37-joe , shaved [me]44-frank , and [Jack]51-jack was up for a while brushing [my]44-frank clothes . "[44-frank]

" Then it lies between [Jack]51-jack and [Joe]37-joe ? "[291-the younger man]

[Frank]44-frank hesitated .

" [Neither one]1596-neither one was left alone , though . "[44-frank]

" Then only [Hamilton]34-berry and [Esterton]48-esterton have been alone for any time in [[your]44-frank room]1593-your room since [you]44-frank left the key in [[your]44-frank cabinet]1598-your cabinet ? "[44-frank]

" [Those]1599-those are the only ones of whom [I]44-frank know anything . What [others]1600-others went in during the day , of course , [I]44-frank know nothing about . It could n't have been either [Esterton]48-esterton or [Hamilton]34-berry . "[44-frank]

" Not [Esterton]48-esterton , no . "[44-frank]

" And [Hamilton]34-berry is beyond suspicion . "[44-frank]

" [No servant]1601-no servant is beyond suspicion . "[44-frank]

" [I]44-frank would trust [Hamilton]34-berry anywhere , "[44-frank] said [Frank]44-frank stoutly , " and with anything . "[44-frank]

" That 's noble of [you]44-frank , [Frank]44-frank , and [I]44-frank would have done the same , but [we]1602-we must remember that [we]1602-we are not in the old days now . [The negroes]1603-the negroes are becoming less faithful and less contented , and more 's the pity , and a deal more ambitious , although [I]44-frank have never had any unfaithfulness on the part of [Hamilton]34-berry to complain of before . "[44-frank]

" Then do not condemn [him]34-berry now . "[44-frank]

" [I]44-frank shall not condemn [any one]1604-any one until [I]44-frank have proof positive of [his]34-berry guilt or such clear circumstantial evidence that [my]44-frank reason is satisfied . "[44-frank]

" [I]44-frank do not believe that [you]44-frank will ever have that against [old Hamilton]34-berry . "[44-frank]

" This spirit of trust does [you]44-frank credit , [Frank]44-frank , and [I]44-frank very much hope that [you]44-frank may be right . But as soon as [a negro]1605-a negro like [Hamilton]34-berry learns the value of money and begins to earn it , at the same time [he]1605-a negro begins to covet some easy and rapid way of securing it . [The old negro]1606-the old negro knew nothing of the value of money . When [he]1605-a negro stole , [he]1605-a negro stole hams and bacon and chickens . These were [his]1605-a negro immediate necessities and the things [he]1605-a negro valued . The present laughs at this tendency without knowing the cause . [The present negro]1607-the present negro resents the laugh , and [he]1607-the present negro has learned to value other things than those which satisfy [his]1607-the present negro belly . "[44-frank]

[Frank]44-frank looked bored .

" But pardon [me]39-maurice for boring [you]304-the young man . [I]39-maurice know [you]304-the young man want to go to bed . Go and leave everything to [me]39-maurice . "[39-maurice]

[The young man]304-the young man reluctantly withdrew , and [Maurice]39-maurice went to the telephone and rung up [the police station]305-the police station .

As [Maurice]39-maurice had said , [he]39-maurice was [a plain , hard - headed business man]306-a plain , hard - headed business man , and it took very few words for [him]39-maurice to put [the Chief of Police]307-the chief of police in possession of the principal facts of the case . [A detective]1589-a detective was detailed to take charge of the case , and was started immediately , so that [he]1589-a detective might be upon the ground as soon after the commission of the crime as possible .

When [he]1589-a detective came [he]1589-a detective insisted that if [he]1589-a detective was to do anything [he]1589-a detective must question [the robbed man]309-the robbed man and search [[his]309-the robbed man room]285-his room at once . [Oakley]39-maurice protested , but [the detective]311-the detective was adamant . Even now the presence in [the room of [a man uninitiated into the mysteries of criminal methods]313-a man uninitiated into the mysteries of criminal methods]312-the room of a man uninitiated into the mysteries of criminal methods might be destroying the last vestige of a really important clue . [The master of [the house]1558-the house]314-the master of the house had no alternative save to yield . Together [they]316-they went to [[the artist]253-the artist 's room]318-the artist 's room . A light shone out through the crack under the door .

" [I]319-the young fellow am sorry to disturb [you]319-the young fellow again , [Frank]44-frank , but may [we]316-they come in ? "[319-the young fellow]

" Who is with [you]319-the young fellow ? "[319-the young fellow]

" [The detective]311-the detective . "[319-the young fellow]

" [I]319-the young fellow did not know [he]311-the detective was to come to - night . "[319-the young fellow]

" [The chief]1609-the chief thought it better . "[319-the young fellow]

" All right in a moment . "[319-the young fellow]

There was a sound of moving around , and in a short time [the young fellow]319-the young fellow , partly undressed , opened the door .

To [the detective]311-the detective 's questions [he]319-the young fellow answered in substance what [he]319-the young fellow had told before . [He]319-the young fellow also brought out the cabinet . It was a strong oak box , uncarven , but bound at the edges with brass . The key was still in the lock , where [Frank]44-frank had left it on discovering [his]44-frank loss . [They]316-they raised the lid . The cabinet contained two compartments , one for letters and a smaller one for jewels and trinkets .

" When [you]319-the young fellow opened this cabinet , [your]319-the young fellow money was gone ? "[291-the younger man]

" Yes . "[291-the younger man]

" Were any of [your]319-the young fellow papers touched ? "[291-the younger man]

" No . "[291-the younger man]

" How about [your]319-the young fellow jewels ? "[291-the younger man]

" [I]291-the younger man have but few and they were elsewhere . "[291-the younger man]

[The detective]311-the detective examined [the room]292-the room carefully , [its]292-the room approaches , and [the hall]287-the hall - ways without . [He]311-the detective paused knowingly at a window that overlooked the flat top of [a porch]324-a porch .

" Do [you]319-the young fellow ever leave this window open ? "[291-the younger man]

" It is almost always so . "[291-the younger man]

" Is [this porch on the front of [the house]1558-the house]1610-this porch on the front of the house ? "[291-the younger man]

" No , on the side . "[291-the younger man]

" What else is out that way ? "[291-the younger man]

[Frank]44-frank and [Maurice]39-maurice looked at [each other]192-each other . [The younger man]291-the younger man hesitated and put [his]291-the younger man hand to [his]291-the younger man head . [Maurice]39-maurice answered grimly , " [[[My]39-maurice butler]1612-my butler 's cottage]1613-my butler 's cottage is on that side and a little way back . "[39-maurice]

" Uh huh ! and [[your]44-frank butler]1614-your butler is , [I]291-the younger man believe , [the Hamilton whom [the young gentleman]1616-the young gentleman mentioned some time ago]1615-the hamilton whom the young gentleman mentioned some time ago . "[291-the younger man]

" Yes . "[39-maurice]

[Frank]44-frank 's face was really very white now . [The detective]311-the detective nodded again .

" [I]311-the detective think [I]311-the detective have a clue , "[311-the detective] [he]311-the detective said simply . " [I]311-the detective will be [here]1617-here again to - morrow morning . "[311-the detective]

" But [I]44-frank shall be gone , "[44-frank] said [Frank]44-frank .

" [You]44-frank will hardly be needed , anyway . "[311-the detective]

[The artist]253-the artist gave a sigh of relief . [He]253-the artist hated to be involved in unpleasant things . [He]253-the artist went as far as the outer door with [[his]253-the artist brother]201-his brother and [the detective]311-the detective . As [he]253-the artist bade [the officer]331-the officer good - night and hurried up [the hall]287-the hall , [Frank]44-frank put [his]44-frank hand to [his]44-frank head again with a convulsive gesture , as if struck by a sudden pain .

" Come , come , [Frank]44-frank , [you]44-frank must take a drink now and go to bed , "[44-frank] said [Oakley]44-frank .

" [I]44-frank am completely unnerved . "[44-frank]

" [I]44-frank know it , and [I]44-frank am no less shocked than [you]44-frank . But [we]333-we ' ve got to face it like [men]242-men . "[44-frank]

[They]333-we passed into [the dining - room]286-the dining - room , where [Maurice]39-maurice poured out some brandy for [[his]39-maurice brother]201-his brother and [himself]39-maurice . " Who would have thought it ? "[39-maurice] [he]39-maurice asked , as [he]39-maurice tossed [his]39-maurice own down .

" Not I. [I]44-frank had hoped against hope up until the last that it would turn out to be a mistake . "[44-frank]

" Nothing angers [me]39-maurice so much as being deceived by [the man]269-the man [I]39-maurice have helped and trusted . [I]39-maurice should feel the sting of all this much less if [the thief]1620-the thief had come from the outside , broken in , and robbed [me]39-maurice , but this , after all these years , is too low . "[39-maurice]

" Do n't be hard on [a man]1563-a man , [Maurice]39-maurice ; [one]1622-one never knows what prompts [him]1563-a man to a deed . And this evidence is all circumstantial . "[44-frank]

" It is plain enough for [me]39-maurice . [You]44-frank are entirely too kind - hearted , [Frank]44-frank . But [I]39-maurice see that this thing has worn [you]44-frank out . [You]44-frank must not stand here talking . Go to bed , for [you]44-frank must be fresh for to - morrow morning 's journey to [New York]8-new york . "[39-maurice]

[Frank Oakley]44-frank turned away towards [[his]44-frank room]285-his room . [His]44-frank face was haggard , and [he]44-frank staggered as [he]44-frank walked . [[His]44-frank brother]201-his brother looked after [him]44-frank with a pitying and affectionate gaze .

" [Poor fellow]1623-poor fellow , "[201-his brother] [he]201-his brother said , " [he]1623-poor fellow is so delicately constructed that [he]1623-poor fellow can not stand such shocks as these ; "[201-his brother] and then [he]201-his brother added : " To think of [that black hound]1624-that black hound 's treachery ! [I]201-his brother 'll give [him]1623-poor fellow all that the law sets down for [him]1623-poor fellow . "[201-his brother]

[He]201-his brother found [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley asleep when [he]201-his brother reached [the room]292-the room , but [he]201-his brother awakened [her]40-mrs. oakley to tell [her]40-mrs. oakley the story . [She]40-mrs. oakley was horror - struck . It was hard to have to believe this awful thing of [an old servant]339-an old servant , but [she]40-mrs. oakley agreed with [him]201-his brother that [Hamilton]34-berry must be made an example of when the time came . Before that , however , [he]201-his brother must not know that [he]201-his brother was suspected .

[They]340-they fell asleep , [he]201-his brother with thoughts of anger and revenge , and [she]40-mrs. oakley grieved and disappointed .

IV

FROM A CLEAR SKY

[The inmates of [the Oakley house]342-the oakley house]341-the inmates of the oakley house had not been long in [their]341-the inmates of the oakley house beds before [Hamilton]34-berry was out of [his]34-berry and rousing [[his]34-berry own little household]343-his own little household .

" [You]135-his son , [Joe]37-joe , "[201-his brother] [he]201-his brother called to [[his]201-his brother son]135-his son , " git up f'om daih an ' come right hyeah . [You]135-his son got to he'p [me]201-his brother befo ' [you]135-his son go to any shop dis mo'nin ' . [You]135-his son , [Kitty]38-kitty , stir [yo]135-his son ' stumps , [miss]1625-miss . [I]201-his brother know [yo]135-his son ' ma 's a - dressin ' now . Ef [she]1625-miss ai n't , [I]201-his brother bet [I]201-his brother 'll be aftah huh in a minute , too . [You]135-his son all layin ' ' roun ' , snoozin ' w'en [you]135-his son all des ' pint'ly know dis is de mo'nin ' [Mistah Frank]52-frank go ' way f'om hyeah . "[201-his brother]

It was a cool Autumn morning , fresh and dew - washed . The sun was just rising , and a cool clear breeze was blowing across [the land]345-the land . The blue smoke from [the " house]1626-the " house , "[201-his brother] where the fire was already going , whirled fantastically over the roofs like a belated ghost . It was just the morning to doze in comfort , and so thought [all of [[Berry]34-berry 's household]347-berry 's household]346-all of berry 's household except [himself]34-berry . Loud was the complaining as [they]347-berry 's household threw [themselves]347-berry 's household out of bed . [They]347-berry 's household maintained that it was an altogether unearthly hour to get up . Even [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton added [her]45-mrs. hamilton protest , until [she]45-mrs. hamilton suddenly remembered what morning it was , when [she]45-mrs. hamilton hurried into [her]45-mrs. hamilton clothes and set about getting [the family]208-the family 's breakfast .

The good - humour of [all of [them]203-all of them]203-all of them returned when [they]347-berry 's household were seated about [their]347-berry 's household table with some of the good things of the night before set out , and the talk ran cheerily around .

" [I]45-mrs. hamilton do declaih , "[45-mrs. hamilton] said [Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton , " [you]203-all of them all 's as bad as [dem white people]1627-dem white people was las ' night . De way [dey]1627-dem white people waded into dat food was a caution . "[45-mrs. hamilton] [He]350-he chuckled with delight at the recollection .

" [I]37-joe reckon dat 's what [dey]1627-dem white people come fu ' . [I]37-joe was n't payin ' so much ' tention to what [dey]1627-dem white people eat as to de way [dem women]1628-dem women was dressed . Why , [Mis ' Jedge Hill]53-mis ' jedge hill was des ' mo'n go'geous . "[37-joe]

" Oh , yes , [ma]1629-ma , an ' [Miss Lessing]54-miss lessing was n't no ways behin ' [her]54-miss lessing , "[38-kitty] put in [Kitty]38-kitty .

[Joe]37-joe did not condescend to join in the conversation , but contented [himself]37-joe with devouring the good things and aping the manners of [the young men whom [he]37-joe knew had been among [last night 's guests]352-last night 's guests]351-the young men whom he knew had been among last night 's guests .

" Well , [I]34-berry got to be goin' , "[34-berry] said [Berry]34-berry , rising . " There 'll be early breakfas ' at [de ' house]1630-de ' house ' dis mo'nin ' , so 's [Mistah Frank]52-frank kin ketch de fus ' train . "[34-berry]

[He]34-berry went out cheerily to [his]34-berry work . No shadow of impending disaster depressed [his]34-berry spirits . No cloud obscured [his]34-berry sky . [He]34-berry was [a simple , easy man]353-a simple , easy man , and [he]34-berry saw nothing in the manner of [the people whom [he]34-berry served that morning at breakfast save a natural grief at parting from [each other]192-each other]354-the people whom he served that morning at breakfast save a natural grief at parting from each other . [He]34-berry did not even take the trouble to inquire who [the strange white man]356-the strange white man was who hung about [the place]357-the place .

When it came time for [the young man]304-the young man to leave , with the privilege of [an old servitor]359-an old servitor [Berry]34-berry went up to [him]34-berry to bid [him]34-berry good - bye . [He]34-berry held out [his]34-berry hand to [him]34-berry , and with a glance at [[his]34-berry brother]201-his brother , [Frank]52-frank took it and shook it cordially . " Good - bye , [Berry]34-berry , "[34-berry] [he]34-berry said . [Maurice]39-maurice could hardly restrain [his]39-maurice anger at the sight , but [[his]39-maurice wife]133-his wife was moved to tears at [[her]133-his wife brother - in - law]223-her brother - in - law 's generosity .

The last sight [they]363-they saw as [the carriage]364-the carriage rolled away towards [the station]365-the station was [Berry]34-berry standing upon the steps waving a hearty farewell and god - speed .

" How could [you]52-frank do it , [Frank]52-frank ? "[201-his brother] gasped [[his]34-berry brother]201-his brother , as soon as [they]363-they had driven well out of hearing .

" Hush , [Maurice]39-maurice , "[40-mrs. oakley] said [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley gently ; " [I]40-mrs. oakley think it was very noble of [him]34-berry . "[40-mrs. oakley]

" Oh , [I]52-frank felt sorry for [the poor fellow]1631-the poor fellow , "[52-frank] was [Frank]52-frank 's reply . " Promise [me]52-frank [you]39-maurice wo n't be too hard on [him]1631-the poor fellow , [Maurice]39-maurice . Give [him]1631-the poor fellow a little scare and let [him]1631-the poor fellow go . " [I]304-the young man shall deal with [him]1631-the poor fellow as [he]1631-the poor fellow deserves . "[304-the young man]

[The young man]304-the young man sighed and was silent the rest of the way .

[[His]304-the young man brother]201-his brother wrung [his]201-his brother hand . [The young fellow]319-the young fellow bade [them]370-our a hearty good - bye , and [they]370-our , knowing what [his]319-the young fellow feelings must be , spared [him]319-the young fellow the prolonging of the strain . " [He]1631-the poor fellow seems to be sad at going , "[40-mrs. oakley] said [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley .

" [Poor fellow]1623-poor fellow , the affair of last night has broken [him]1631-the poor fellow up considerably , but [I]319-the young fellow 'll make [Berry]34-berry pay for every pang of anxiety that [[my]319-the young fellow brother]1635-my brother has suffered . "[319-the young fellow]

" Do n't be revengeful , [Maurice]39-maurice ; [you]39-maurice know what [brother Frank]52-frank asked of [you]39-maurice . "[378-a man who is both exasperated and determined]

" [He]1631-the poor fellow is gone and will never know what happens , so [I]319-the young fellow may be as revengeful as [I]319-the young fellow wish . "[319-the young fellow]

[The detective]311-the detective was waiting on [the lawn]375-the lawn when [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice returned . [They]376-they went immediately to [the library]1580-the library , [Oakley]39-maurice walking with the firm , hard tread of [a man who is both exasperated and determined]378-a man who is both exasperated and determined , and [the officer]331-the officer gliding along with the cat - like step which is one of the attributes of [his]39-maurice profession .

" Well ? "[380-the impatient man] was [the impatient man]380-the impatient man 's question as soon as the door closed upon [them]376-they .

" [I]380-the impatient man have some more information that may or may not be of importance . "[380-the impatient man]

" Out with it ; maybe [I]331-the officer can tell . "[331-the officer]

" First , let [me]380-the impatient man ask if [you]380-the impatient man had any reason to believe that [[your]380-the impatient man butler]1614-your butler had any resources of [his]1614-your butler own , say to the amount of three or four hundred dollars ? "[380-the impatient man]

" Certainly not . [I]331-the officer pay [him]1614-your butler thirty dollars a month , and [[his]1614-your butler wife]133-his wife fifteen dollars , and with keeping up [his]1614-your butler lodges and the way [he]1614-your butler dresses [that girl]1638-that girl , [he]1614-your butler ca n't save very much . "[331-the officer]

" [You]380-the impatient man know that [he]1614-your butler has money in the bank ? "[380-the impatient man]

" No . "[331-the officer]

" Well , [he]1614-your butler has . Over eight hundred dollars . "[380-the impatient man]

" What ? [Berry]1639-berry ? It must be the pickings of years . "[331-the officer]

" And yesterday it was increased by five hundred more . "[380-the impatient man]

" [The scoundrel]1640-the scoundrel ! "[331-the officer]

" How was [[your]380-the impatient man brother]1641-your brother 's money , in bills ? "[380-the impatient man]

" It was in large bills and gold , with some silver . "[331-the officer]

" [Berry]34-berry 's money was almost all in bills of a small denomination and silver . "[380-the impatient man]

" A poor trick ; it could easily have been changed . "[331-the officer]

" Not such a sum without exciting comment . "[380-the impatient man]

" [He]34-berry may have gone to several places . "[331-the officer]

" But [he]34-berry had only a day to do it in . "[380-the impatient man]

" Then [some one]1642-some one must have been [[his]34-berry accomplice]1643-his accomplice . "[331-the officer]

" That remains to be proven . "[380-the impatient man]

" That must be made clear to the law . "[380-the impatient man]

" It shall be . "[331-the officer]

" [I]380-the impatient man should advise , though , no open proceedings against [this servant]1644-this servant until further evidence to establish [his]34-berry guilt is found . "[380-the impatient man]

[Oakley]39-maurice struck the bell , and [Berry]34-berry [himself]34-berry answered it .

" Well , [suh]1650-suh , [Mistah Oakley]55-mr. oakley , "[331-the officer] was the grinning reply , " ef [you]34-berry ai n't [de beatenes ' man]1651-de beatenes ' man to fin ' out things [I]331-the officer evah seen . "[331-the officer]

[The employer]382-the employer half rose from [his]382-the employer chair . [His]382-the employer face was livid with anger . But at a sign from [the detective]311-the detective [he]382-the employer strove to calm [himself]382-the employer .

" [You]55-mr. oakley had better let [me]331-the officer talk to [Berry]34-berry , [Mr. Oakley]55-mr. oakley , "[331-the officer] said [the officer]331-the officer .

[Oakley]55-mr. oakley nodded . [Berry]34-berry was looking distressed and excited . [He]34-berry seemed not to understand it at all .

" [Berry]34-berry , "[331-the officer] [the officer]331-the officer pursued , " [you]34-berry admit having deposited five hundred dollars in [the bank]1649-the bank yesterday ? "[331-the officer]

" Uh huh ! well , now , where did [you]34-berry get this money ? "[331-the officer]

" [You]34-berry worked for it ? [You]34-berry must have done a pretty big job to have got so much money all in a lump ? "[331-the officer]

" But [I]331-the officer did n't git it in a lump . Why , [man]1656-man , [I]331-the officer ' ve been savin ' dat money fu mo'n fo ' yeahs . "[331-the officer]

" More than four years ? Why did n't [you]34-berry put it in [the bank]1649-the bank as [you]34-berry got it ? "[331-the officer]

" Why , mos'ly it was too small , an ' so [I]331-the officer des ' kep ' it in a ol' sock . [She]35-fannie was allus sayin ' it was too much to have layin ' ' roun ' [de house]1659-de house . " [You]34-berry 're [a liar]1664-a liar ! [you]34-berry 're [a liar]1664-a liar , [[you]34-berry black thief]1666-you black thief ! "[55-mr. oakley] [Oakley]55-mr. oakley broke in impetuously . " [You]34-berry have learned [your]34-berry lesson well , but [you]34-berry ca n't cheat [me]55-mr. oakley . [I]55-mr. oakley know where that money came from . "[55-mr. oakley]

[Berry]34-berry had suddenly turned ashen .

" [You]34-berry say [you]34-berry know [whaih]1668-whaih dat money come f'om ? [Whaih]1668-whaih ? "[331-the officer]
