" Why , yes , what 's the matter with to - morrer night ? There 's a good coon show in [town]1851-town . Out o ' sight . Let 's all go . "[80-thomas]

" [I]45-mrs. hamilton ai n't nevah been to nothin' lak dat , an ' [I]45-mrs. hamilton do n't know , "[45-mrs. hamilton] said [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton .

" Aw , come , [I]80-thomas 'll git the tickets an ' [we]1852-we 'll all go . Great singin ' , [you]38-kitty know . What d ' [you]38-kitty say ? "[80-thomas]

[The mother]206-the mother hesitated , and [Joe]37-joe filled the breach .

" [We]1852-we 'd all like to go , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said . " [Ma]1629-ma , [we]1852-we ' ll go if [you]1629-ma ai n't too tired . "[37-joe]

" Tired ? [Pshaw]83-pshaw , [you]83-pshaw 'll furgit all about [your]83-pshaw tiredness when [Smithkins]84-smithkins gits on the stage . [Y]83-pshaw ' ought to hear [him]84-smithkins sing , ' [I]80-thomas bin huntin ' fu ' wo'k ' ! [You]83-pshaw 'd die laughing . "[80-thomas]

[Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton made no further demur , and the matter was closed .

Awhile later [the " Rag - time "[705-the " rag - time " man] man]705-the " rag - time " man came down and gave [them]706-they a sample of what [they]706-they were to hear the next night . [Mr. Thomas]80-thomas and [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones two - stepped , and [they]706-they sent [a boy]707-a boy after some more beer . [Joe]37-joe found it a very jolly evening , but [Kit]38-kitty 's and [the mother]206-the mother 's hearts were heavy as [they]706-they went up to bed .

" Say , "[80-thomas] said [Mr. Thomas]80-thomas when [they]706-they had gone , " [that little girl]1854-that little girl 's a peach , [you]35-fannie bet ; a little green , [I]80-thomas guess , but [she]1854-that little girl 'll ripen in the sun . "[80-thomas]

VIII

AN EVENING OUT

[Fannie Hamilton]35-fannie , tired as [she]35-fannie was , sat long into the night with [[her]35-fannie little family]709-her little family discussing [New York,--its]19-new york,--its advantages and disadvantages , [its]19-new york,--its beauty and its ugliness , its morality and immorality . [She]35-fannie had somewhat receded from [her]35-fannie first position , that it was better being here in [the great strange city]710-the great strange city than being at [home where the very streets]711-home where the very streets shamed [them]709-her little family . [She]35-fannie had not liked the way that [[their]706-they fellow lodger]712-their fellow lodger looked at [Kitty]38-kitty . It was bold , to say the least . [She]35-fannie was not pleased , either , with [[their]706-they new acquaintance]697-their new acquaintance 's familiarity . And yet , [he]712-their fellow lodger had said no more than [some stranger]714-some stranger , if there could be such [a stranger]715-a stranger , would have said down [home]210-home . There was a difference , however , which [she]35-fannie recognised . [Thomas]80-thomas was not [the provincial who puts every one on a par with [himself]80-thomas]717-the provincial who puts every one on a par with himself , nor was [he]80-thomas [the metropolitan who complacently patronises [the whole world]719-the whole world]718-the metropolitan who complacently patronises the whole world . [He]80-thomas was trained out of the one and not up to the other . [The intermediate]720-the intermediate only succeeded in being offensive . [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones ' assurance as to [[her]79-mrs. jones guest]721-her guest 's fine qualities did not do all that might have been expected to reassure [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton in the face of the difficulties of [the gentleman]722-the gentleman 's manner .

[She]79-mrs. jones could not , however , lay [her]79-mrs. jones finger on any particular point that would give [her]79-mrs. jones the reason for rejecting [his]80-thomas friendly advances . [She]79-mrs. jones got ready the next evening to go to [the theatre]723-the theatre with [the rest]456-the rest . [Mr. Thomas]80-thomas at once possessed [himself]80-thomas of [Kitty]38-kitty and walked on ahead , leaving [Joe]37-joe to accompany [[his]37-joe mother]478-his mother and [Mrs. Jones,--an]85-mrs. jones,--an arrangement , by the way , not altogether to [that young gentleman]726-that young gentleman 's taste . [A good many men]727-a good many men bowed to [Thomas]80-thomas in [the street]537-the street , and [they]727-a good many men turned to look enviously after [him]80-thomas . At the door of [the theatre]723-the theatre [they]727-a good many men had to run the gantlet of a dozen pairs of eyes . Here , too , [the party 's guide]730-the party 's guide seemed to be well known , for [some one]1642-some one said , before [they]727-a good many men passed out of hearing , " [I]1642-some one wonder who [that little light girl]1855-that little light girl is that [Thomas]80-thomas is with to - night ? [He]80-thomas 's a hot one for [you]45-mrs. hamilton . "[1642-some one]

[Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton had been in [a theatre]732-a theatre but once before in [her]45-mrs. hamilton life , and [Joe]37-joe and [Kit]38-kitty but a few times oftener . On those occasions [they]727-a good many men had sat far up in [the peanut gallery in [the place reserved for [people of colour]449-people of colour]734-the place reserved for people of colour]733-the peanut gallery in the place reserved for people of colour . This was not [a pleasant , cleanly , nor beautiful locality]736-a pleasant , cleanly , nor beautiful locality , and by contrast with it , even the garishness of [the cheap New York theatre]737-the cheap new york theatre seemed fine and glorious .

[They]727-a good many men had good seats in the first balcony , and here [[their]727-a good many men guide]738-their guide had shown [his]738-their guide managerial ability again , for [he]738-their guide had found it impossible , or said so , to get all the seats together , so that [he]738-their guide and [the girl]183-the girl were in the row in front and to one side of where [the rest]456-the rest sat . [Kitty]38-kitty did not like the arrangement , and innocently suggested that [[her]38-kitty brother]561-her brother take [her]38-kitty seat while [she]38-kitty went back to [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother . But [[her]38-kitty escort]743-her escort overruled [her]38-kitty objections easily , and laughed at [her]38-kitty so frankly that from very shame [she]38-kitty could not urge [them]727-a good many men again , and [they]727-a good many men were soon forgotten in [her]38-kitty wonder at the mystery and glamour that envelops the home of the drama . There was something weird to [her]38-kitty in the alternate spaces of light and shade . Without any feeling of its ugliness , [she]38-kitty looked at the curtain as at a door that should presently open between [her]38-kitty and [a house of wonders]744-a house of wonders . [She]38-kitty looked at it with the fascination that [one]1622-one always experiences for what either brings near or withholds the unknown .

As for [Joe]37-joe , [he]37-joe was not bothered by the mystery or the glamour of things . But [he]37-joe had suddenly raised [himself]37-joe in [his]37-joe own estimation . [He]37-joe had gazed steadily at [a girl across the aisle]746-a girl across the aisle until [she]746-a girl across the aisle had smiled in response . Of course , [he]37-joe went hot and cold by turns , and the sweat broke out on [his]37-joe brow , but instantly [he]37-joe began to swell . [He]37-joe had made a decided advance in knowledge , and [he]37-joe swelled with the consciousness that already [he]37-joe was coming to be [a man of [the world]1706-the world]747-a man of the world . [He]37-joe looked with a new feeling at [the swaggering , sporty young negroes]749-the swaggering , sporty young negroes . [His]37-joe attitude towards [them]749-the swaggering , sporty young negroes was not one of humble self - depreciation any more . Since last night [he]37-joe had grown , and felt that [he]37-joe might , that [he]37-joe would , be like [them]749-the swaggering , sporty young negroes , and it put a sort of chuckling glee into [his]37-joe heart .

[One]1622-one might find it in [him]37-joe to feel sorry for this small - souled , warped being , for [he]37-joe was so evidently the jest of [Fate]86-fate , if it were not that [he]37-joe was so blissfully , so conceitedly , unconscious of [his]37-joe own nastiness . Down [home]210-home [he]37-joe had shaved [the wild young bucks of [the town]172-the town]752-the wild young bucks of the town , and while doing it drunk in eagerly [their]752-the wild young bucks of the town unguarded narrations of [their]752-the wild young bucks of the town gay exploits . So [he]37-joe had started out with false ideals as to what was fine and manly . [He]37-joe was afflicted by a sort of moral and mental astigmatism that made [him]37-joe see everything wrong . As [he]37-joe sat there to - night , [he]37-joe gave to all [he]37-joe saw a wrong value and upon it based [his]37-joe ignorant desires .

When [the men of the orchestra]754-the men of the orchestra filed in and began tuning [their]754-the men of the orchestra instruments , it was the signal for an influx of [loiterers]755-loiterers from the door . There were [a large number of [coloured people in the audience]757-coloured people in the audience]756-a large number of coloured people in the audience , and because [members of [their]756-a large number of coloured people in the audience own race]758-members of their own race were giving the performance , [they]756-a large number of coloured people in the audience seemed to take a proprietary interest in it all . [They]756-a large number of coloured people in the audience discussed its merits and demerits as [they]756-a large number of coloured people in the audience walked down the aisle in much the same tone that [the owners]759-the owners would have used had [they]759-the owners been wondering whether the entertainment was going to please [the people]617-the people or not .

Finally the music struck up one of the numerous negro marches . It was accompanied by the rhythmic patting of feet from all parts of [the house]1558-the house . Then the curtain went up on a scene of beauty . It purported to be a grove to which [a party of [picnickers]763-picnickers]762-a party of picnickers , [the ladies and gentlemen of the chorus]764-the ladies and gentlemen of the chorus , had come for a holiday , and [they]762-a party of picnickers were telling [the audience]765-the audience all about it in crescendos . With the exception of [one , who looked like a faded kid glove]766-one , who looked like a faded kid glove , [the men]284-the men discarded the grease paint , but [the women]277-the women under [their]284-the men make - ups ranged from pure white , pale yellow , and sickly greens to brick reds and slate grays . [They]277-the women were dressed in costumes that were not primarily intended for picnic going . But [they]277-the women could sing , and [they]277-the women did sing , with [their]277-the women voices , [their]277-the women bodies , [their]277-the women souls . [They]277-the women threw [themselves]277-the women into it because [they]277-the women enjoyed and felt what [they]277-the women were doing , and [they]277-the women gave almost a semblance of dignity to the tawdry music and inane words .

[Kitty]38-kitty was enchanted . [The airily dressed women]769-the airily dressed women seemed to [her]38-kitty like creatures from [fairy - land]770-fairy - land . It is strange how the glare of the footlights succeeds in deceiving [so many people who are able to see through other delusions]771-so many people who are able to see through other delusions . The cheap dresses on [the street]537-the street had not fooled [Kitty]38-kitty for an instant , but take the same cheese - cloth , put a little water starch into it , and put it on the stage , and [she]38-kitty could see only chiffon .

[She]38-kitty turned around and nodded delightedly at [[her]38-kitty brother]561-her brother , but [he]561-her brother did not see [her]38-kitty . [He]561-her brother was lost , transfixed . [His]561-her brother soul was floating on a sea of sense . [He]561-her brother had eyes and ears and thoughts only for the stage . [His]561-her brother nerves tingled and [his]561-her brother hands twitched . Only to know one of [those radiant creatures]774-those radiant creatures , to have [her]38-kitty speak to [him]561-her brother , smile at [him]561-her brother ! If ever [a man]1563-a man was intoxicated , [Joe]37-joe was . [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton was divided between shame at the clothes of [some of [the women]277-the women]776-some of the women and delight with the music . [[Her]45-mrs. hamilton companion]272-her companion was busy pointing out who this and [that actress]779-that actress was , and giving jelly - like appreciation to the doings on the stage .

[Mr. Thomas]80-thomas was [the only cool one in the party]780-the only cool one in the party . [He]80-thomas was quietly taking stock of [his]80-thomas young companion,--of [her]272-her companion innocence and charm . [She]272-her companion was [a pretty girl]781-a pretty girl , little and dainty , but well developed for [her]272-her companion age . [Her]272-her companion hair was very black and wavy , and some strain of [the South]1-the south 's chivalric blood , which is so curiously mingled with the African in the veins of [most coloured people]782-most coloured people , had tinged [her]272-her companion skin to an olive hue .

" Are [you]272-her companion enjoying [yourself]272-her companion ? "[80-thomas] [he]80-thomas leaned over and whispered to [her]272-her companion . [His]80-thomas voice was very confidential and [his]80-thomas lips near [her]272-her companion ear , but [she]272-her companion did not notice .

" [We]783-a number of thomas 's friends 'll see , "[80-thomas] [he]80-thomas said wisely ; " [I]80-thomas know a thing or two . "[80-thomas]

Between the first and second acts [a number of [[Thomas]80-thomas 's friends]784-thomas 's friends]783-a number of thomas 's friends strolled up to where [he]80-thomas sat and began talking , and again [Kitty]38-kitty 's embarrassment took possession of [her]38-kitty as [they]783-a number of thomas 's friends were introduced one by one . [They]783-a number of thomas 's friends treated [her]38-kitty with a half - courteous familiarity that made [her]38-kitty blush . [[Her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother was not pleased with the many acquaintances that [[her]174-her mother daughter]569-her daughter was making , and would have interfered had not [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones assured [her]174-her mother that [the men clustered about [[their]787-the men clustered about their host 's seat host]788-their host 's seat]787-the men clustered about their host 's seat were [some of [the " best people in [town]1851-town]1858-the " best people in town]1857-some of the " best people in town . One brief bit of conversation which [the mother]206-the mother overheard especially troubled [her]206-the mother .

" Not going out for a minute or two ? "[284-the men] asked one of [the men]284-the men , as [he]789-the man in front was turning away from [Thomas]80-thomas .

[The fellow]795-the fellow gave a horse laugh and replied , " Well , [you]183-the girl 're doing a great piece of work , [Miss Hamilton]38-kitty , whenever [you]183-the girl can keep [old Bill]88-old bill from goin' out an ' lushin ' between acts . Say , [you]183-the girl got a good thing ; push it along . "[795-the fellow]

[[The girl]183-the girl 's mother]797-the girl 's mother half rose , but [she]206-the mother resumed [her]206-the mother seat , for [the man]269-the man was going away . [Her]206-the mother mind was not quiet again , however , until [the people]617-the people were all in [their]617-the people seats and the curtain had gone up on the second act . At first [she]206-the mother was surprised at the enthusiasm over just such dancing as [she]206-the mother could see any day from the loafers on [the street corners down [home]210-home]800-the street corners down home , and then , like [a good , sensible , humble woman]802-a good , sensible , humble woman , [she]206-the mother came around to the idea that it was [she]206-the mother who had always been wrong in putting too low a value on really worthy things . So [she]206-the mother laughed and applauded with the rest , all the while trying to quiet something that was tugging at [her]206-the mother away down in [her]206-the mother heart .

When the performance was over [she]206-the mother forced [her]206-the mother way to [Kitty]38-kitty 's side , where [she]206-the mother remained in spite of all [Thomas]80-thomas 's palpable efforts to get [her]206-the mother away . Finally [he]80-thomas proposed that [they]803-ust all go to supper at [one of [the coloured cafes]805-the coloured cafes]804-one of the coloured cafes .

[Joe]37-joe told [himself]37-joe that [Kitty]38-kitty was [the biggest fool that it had ever been [his]37-joe lot to meet]809-the biggest fool that it had ever been his lot to meet , and [the disappointed suitor]810-the disappointed suitor satisfied [himself]810-the disappointed suitor with the reflection that [the girl]183-the girl was green yet , but would get bravely over that .

[He]37-joe attempted to hold [her]183-the girl hand as [they]812-they parted at the parlour door , but [she]183-the girl drew [her]183-the girl fingers out of [his]37-joe clasp and said , " Good - night ; thank [you]37-joe , "[183-the girl] as if [he]37-joe had been [one of [[her]183-the girl mother 's old friends]814-her mother 's old friends]813-one of her mother 's old friends .

" So long . "[182-the boy]

Some time . Was it true ? Would [he]37-joe really take [him]37-joe out and let [him]37-joe meet [stage people]817-stage people ? [Joe]37-joe went to bed with [his]37-joe head in a whirl . [He]37-joe slept little that night for thinking of [his]37-joe heart 's desire .

IX

[HIS]37-joe HEART 'S DESIRE

Whatever else [his]37-joe visit to [the theatre]723-the theatre may have done for [Joe]37-joe , it inspired [him]37-joe with a desire to go to work and earn money of [his]37-joe own , to be independent both of parental help and control , and so be able to spend as [he]37-joe pleased . With this end in view [he]37-joe set out to hunt for work . It was a pleasant contrast to [his]37-joe last similar quest , and [he]37-joe felt it with joy . [He]37-joe was treated everywhere [he]37-joe went with courtesy , even when no situation was forthcoming . Finally [he]37-joe came upon [a man who was willing to try [him]37-joe for an afternoon]819-a man who was willing to try him for an afternoon . From the moment [the boy]182-the boy rightly considered [himself]182-the boy engaged , for [he]182-the boy was master of [his]182-the boy trade . [He]37-joe began [his]37-joe work with heart elate . Now [he]37-joe had within [his]37-joe grasp the possibility of being all that [he]37-joe wanted to be . Now [Thomas]80-thomas might take [him]37-joe out at any time and not be ashamed of [him]37-joe .

With [Thomas]80-thomas , the fact that [Joe]37-joe was working put [the boy]182-the boy in an entirely new light . [He]37-joe decided that now [he]37-joe might be worth cultivating . For a week or two [he]80-thomas had ignored [him]80-thomas , and , proceeding upon the principle that if [you]822-you give corn to [the old hen]823-the old hen [she]823-the old hen will cluck to [her]823-the old hen chicks , had treated [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton with marked deference and kindness . This had been without success , as both [the girl]183-the girl and [[her]183-the girl mother]174-her mother held [themselves]826-themselves politely aloof from [him]37-joe . [He]37-joe began to see that [his]37-joe hope of winning [Kitty]38-kitty 's affections lay , not in courting [the older woman]827-the older woman but in making [a friend of [the boy]182-the boy]828-a friend of the boy . So on a certain Saturday night when [the Banner Club]20-the banner club was to give [one of [[its]20-the banner club smokers]831-its smokers]830-one of its smokers , [he]37-joe asked [Joe]37-joe to go with [him]37-joe . [Joe]37-joe was glad to , and [they]832-they set out together . [Arrived]833-arrived , [Thomas]80-thomas left [[his]80-thomas companion]834-his companion for a few moments while [he]80-thomas attended , as [he]80-thomas said , to a little business . What [he]80-thomas really did was to seek out [the proprietor of [the club]836-the club]835-the proprietor of the club and [some of [its hangers on]838-its hangers on]837-some of its hangers on .

" [I]80-thomas say , "[80-thomas] [he]80-thomas said , " [I]80-thomas ' ve got a friend with [me]80-thomas to - night . [He]840-a young man who , on account of his usual expression of innocent gloom , was called sadness 's got some dough on [him]840-a young man who , on account of his usual expression of innocent gloom , was called sadness . " Whew ! "[531-the proprietor] exclaimed [the proprietor]531-the proprietor .

"[840-a young man who , on account of his usual expression of innocent gloom , was called sadness]

" Oh , [I]840-a young man who , on account of his usual expression of innocent gloom , was called sadness 'll act ; [we]1865-our 'll all act . "[840-a young man who , on account of his usual expression of innocent gloom , was called sadness]

" No , no , this is on [me]37-joe , "[37-joe] cried [Joe]37-joe , trembling with joy .

" [Pshaw]83-pshaw , [your]37-joe money 's counterfeit , "[834-his companion] said [[his]37-joe companion]834-his companion with fine generosity . " This is on [me]834-his companion , [I]834-his companion say . [Jack]51-jack , what 'll [you]37-joe have [yourself]37-joe ? "[834-his companion]

As [they]843-they stood at [the bar]845-the bar , [the men]284-the men began strolling up one by one . [Each]847-each in [his]847-each turn was introduced to [Joe]37-joe . [They]284-the men were very polite . [They]284-the men treated [him]37-joe with a pale , dignified , high - minded respect that menaced [his]37-joe pocket - book and possessions . [The proprietor]531-the proprietor , [Mr. Turner]92-mr. turner , asked [him]37-joe why [he]37-joe had never been in before . [He]37-joe really seemed much hurt about it , and on being told that [Joe]37-joe had only been in [the city]609-the city for a couple of weeks expressed emphatic surprise , even disbelief , and assured the rest that [any one]1604-any one would have taken [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton for [an old New Yorker]851-an old new yorker .

[Sadness]90-sadness was introduced last . [He]90-sadness bowed to [Joe]37-joe 's " Happy to know [you]37-joe , [Mr. Williams]94-mr. williams . "[90-sadness]

" Better known as [Sadness]90-sadness , "[90-sadness] [he]90-sadness said , with an expression of deep gloom . " [A distant relative of [mine]90-sadness]1869-a distant relative of mine once had a great grief . [I]90-sadness have never recovered from it . "[90-sadness]

[Joe]37-joe was not quite sure how to take this ; but [the others]852-the others laughed and [he]37-joe joined [them]852-the others , and then , to cover [his]37-joe own embarrassment , [he]37-joe did what [he]37-joe thought the only correct and manly thing to do,--he ordered a drink .

" [I]90-sadness do n't know as [I]90-sadness ought to , "[90-sadness] said [Sadness]90-sadness .

" Aw , shut up , [Sadness]90-sadness , "[80-thomas] said [Thomas]80-thomas . " [[My]80-thomas friend]1873-my friend [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton 'll feel hurt if [you]37-joe do n't drink with [him]1873-my friend . "[80-thomas]

" [I]37-joe cert'n'y will , "[37-joe] was [Joe]37-joe 's opportune remark , and [he]37-joe was pleased to see that it caused [the reluctant one]854-the reluctant one to yield .

[They]855-they took a drink . There was quite a line of [them]855-they . [Joe]37-joe asked [the bartender]856-the bartender what [he]37-joe would have . [The men]284-the men warmed towards [him]37-joe . [They]284-the men took several more drinks with [him]37-joe and [he]37-joe was happy . [Sadness]90-sadness put [his]90-sadness arm about [his]37-joe shoulder and told [him]37-joe , with tears in [his]90-sadness eyes , that [he]37-joe looked like [a cousin of [his]37-joe that had died]858-a cousin of his that had died .

" Aw , shut up , [Sadness]90-sadness ! "[859-some one else] said [some one else]859-some one else . " Be respectable . "[859-some one else]

" Being respectable is very nice as a diversion , but it 's tedious if done steadily . "[37-joe] [Joe]37-joe did not quite take this , so [he]37-joe ordered another drink .

[A group of young fellows]861-a group of young fellows came in and passed up the stairs . " Shearing another lamb ? "[862-one of them] said [one of [them]861-a group of young fellows]862-one of them significantly .

" Well , with that gang it will be well done . "[861-a group of young fellows]

[Thomas]80-thomas and [Joe]37-joe left [the crowd]863-the crowd after a while , and went to [the upper floor]864-the upper floor , where , in [a long , brilliantly lighted room]865-a long , brilliantly lighted room , tables were set out for drinking - parties . At one end of [the room]292-the room was a piano , and [a man]1563-a man sat at [it]292-the room listlessly strumming some popular air . [The proprietor]531-the proprietor joined [them]861-a group of young fellows pretty soon , and steered [them]861-a group of young fellows to a table opposite the door .

" Just sit down here , [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton , "[531-the proprietor] [he]531-the proprietor said , " and [you]93-mr. hamilton can see [everybody that comes in]1874-everybody that comes in . [We]1875-we have lots of [nice people]1876-nice people [here]1617-here on smoker nights , especially after the shows are out and [the girls]679-the girls come in . "[531-the proprietor]

[Joe]37-joe 's heart gave a great leap , and then settled as cold as lead . Of course , [those girls]869-those girls would n't speak to [him]37-joe . But [his]37-joe hopes rose as [the proprietor]531-the proprietor went on talking to [him]37-joe and to [no one else]871-no one else . [Mr. Turner]92-mr. turner always made [a man]1563-a man feel as if [he]1563-a man were of some consequence in [the world]1706-the world , and [[men]242-men a good deal older than [Joe]37-joe]875-men a good deal older than joe had been fooled by [his]37-joe manner . [He]37-joe talked to [one]1622-one in a soft , ingratiating way , giving [his]37-joe whole attention apparently . [He]37-joe tapped [one]1622-one confidentially on the shoulder , as who should say , " [[My]37-joe dear boy]1587-my dear boy , [I]37-joe have but [two friends in [the world]1706-the world]1880-two friends in the world , and [you]1587-my dear boy are [both of [them]1880-two friends in the world]1882-both of them . "[37-joe]

[Joe]37-joe , charmed and pleased , kept [his]37-joe head well . There is a great deal in heredity , and [[his]37-joe father]180-his father had not been [[Maurice Oakley]39-maurice 's butler]879-maurice oakley 's butler for so many years for nothing .

[The Banner Club]880-the banner club was [an institution for the lower education of [negro youth]882-negro youth]881-an institution for the lower education of negro youth . [It]880-the banner club drew [[its]880-the banner club pupils]883-its pupils from [every class of people]884-every class of people and from [every part of [the country]213-the country]885-every part of the country . [It]880-the banner club was composed of all sorts and conditions of [men]242-men , educated and uneducated , dishonest and less so , of the good , the bad , and the -- unexposed . [Parasites]888-parasites came [there]1594-there to find [victims]890-victims , [politicians]891-politicians for votes , [reporters for news]892-reporters for news , and [artists of all kinds for colour and inspiration]893-artists of all kinds for colour and inspiration . [It]1594-there was the place of assembly for [a number of really bright men , who after days of hard and often unrewarded work]894-a number of really bright men , who after days of hard and often unrewarded work came [there]1594-there and drunk [themselves]894-a number of really bright men , who after days of hard and often unrewarded work drunk in [each other]192-each other 's company , and when [they]894-a number of really bright men , who after days of hard and often unrewarded work were drunk talked of the eternal verities .

[The Banner]21-the banner was only one of a kind . [It]21-the banner stood to [the stranger]624-the stranger and [the man]269-the man and [woman without connections for the whole social life]899-woman without connections for the whole social life . It was a substitute -- poor , it must be confessed -- to [many youths for the home life which is so lacking among [certain classes in [New York]8-new york]901-certain classes in new york]900-many youths for the home life which is so lacking among certain classes in new york .

[Here]1617-here [the rounders]903-the rounders congregated , or came and spent the hours until it was time to go forth to bout or assignation . Here too came sometimes [the curious who wanted to see something of the other side of life]904-the curious who wanted to see something of the other side of life . Among these , [white visitors]905-white visitors were not infrequent,--those who were young enough to be fascinated by the bizarre , and [those who were old enough to know that it was all in the game]906-those who were old enough to know that it was all in the game . [Mr. Skaggs]95-skaggs , of [the [New York _ Universe]22-new york _ universe _]907-the new york _ universe _ , was one of [the former class]908-the former class and [a constant visitor,--he and a " lady friend "[911-them] called " [Maudie]96-maudie , "[911-them] who had a penchant for dancing to " Rag - time "[911-them] melodies as only [the " puffessor "[911-them] of such a club]910-the " puffessor " of such a club can play [them]911-them]909-a constant visitor,--he and a " lady friend " called " maudie , " who had a penchant for dancing to " rag - time " melodies as only the " puffessor " of such a club can play them . Of course , [the place]357-the place was a social cesspool , generating a poisonous miasma and reeking with the stench of decayed and rotten moralities . There is no defence to be made for it . But what do [you]913-you expect when false idealism and fevered ambition come face to face with catering cupidity ?

It was into this atmosphere that [Thomas]80-thomas had introduced [the boy Joe]914-the boy joe , and [he]914-the boy joe sat there now by [his]914-the boy joe side , firing [his]914-the boy joe mind by pointing out [the different celebrities who came in and telling highly flavoured stories of [their]916-their lives or doings]915-the different celebrities who came in and telling highly flavoured stories of their lives or doings . [Joe]37-joe heard things that had never come within the range of [his]37-joe mind before .

[The boy]182-the boy was distinctly shocked . About eleven o'clock , when [the people]617-the people began to drop in from the plays , [the master of ceremonies]944-the master of ceremonies opened proceedings by saying that " The free concert would now begin , and [he]944-the master of ceremonies hoped that [all present]1919-all present , [ladies]1920-ladies included , would act like [gentlemen]1710-gentlemen , and not forget [the waiter]1922-the waiter . ' "[944-the master of ceremonies]

There was a patter of applause , and [a young negro]945-a young negro came forward , and in a strident , music - hall voice , sung or rather recited with many gestures the ditty . [He]182-the boy could n't have been much older than [Joe]37-joe , but already [his]182-the boy face was hard with dissipation and foul knowledge . [He]182-the boy gave the song with all the rank suggestiveness that could be put into it . [Joe]37-joe looked upon [him]182-the boy as [a hero]946-a hero . [He]182-the boy was followed by [a little , brown - skinned fellow with an immature Vandyke beard and a lisp]947-a little , brown - skinned fellow with an immature vandyke beard and a lisp . [He]182-the boy sung [his]182-the boy own composition and was funny ; how much funnier than [he]182-the boy [himself]182-the boy knew or intended , may not even be hinted at . Then , while [an instrumentalist , who seemed to have a grudge against the piano]948-an instrumentalist , who seemed to have a grudge against the piano , was hammering out the opening bars of a march , [Joe]37-joe 's attention was attracted by [a woman]1566-a woman entering [the room]292-the room , and from that moment [he]37-joe heard no more of the concert . Even when [the master of ceremonies]944-the master of ceremonies announced with an air that , by special request , [he]944-the master of ceremonies [himself]944-the master of ceremonies would sing " Answer,"--the[944-the master of ceremonies] request was [his]944-the master of ceremonies own,--he did not draw the attention of [the boy]182-the boy away from [the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table , drinking whiskey straight .

[She]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table was [a small girl , with fluffy dark hair and good features]954-a small girl , with fluffy dark hair and good features . A tiny foot peeped out from beneath [her]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table rattling silk skirts . [She]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table was [a good - looking young woman]955-a good - looking young woman and daintily made , though [her]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table face was no longer youthful , and [one]1622-one might have wished that with [her]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table complexion [she]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table had not run to silk waists in magenta .

[Joe]37-joe , however , saw no fault in [her]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table . [She]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table was altogether lovely to [him]37-joe , and [his]37-joe delight was the more poignant as [he]37-joe recognised in [her]953-the yellow - skinned divinity who sat at a near table one of [the girls [he]37-joe had seen on the stage a couple of weeks ago]957-the girls he had seen on the stage a couple of weeks ago . * * * * *

It was late the next morning when [Joe]37-joe got [home]210-home . [He]37-joe had a headache and a sense of triumph that not even [his]37-joe illness and [[his]37-joe mother]478-his mother 's reproof could subdue .

[He]37-joe had promised [Hattie]100-hattie to come often to [the club]836-the club .

X

A VISITOR FROM [HOME]210-home

[Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton began to question very seriously whether [she]45-mrs. hamilton had done the best thing in coming to [New York]8-new york as [she]45-mrs. hamilton saw [[her]45-mrs. hamilton son]968-her son staying away more and more and growing always farther away from [her]45-mrs. hamilton and [[his]968-her son sister]479-his sister . Had [she]45-mrs. hamilton known how and where [he]37-joe spent [his]37-joe evenings , [she]45-mrs. hamilton would have had even greater cause to question the wisdom of [their]970-their trip . [She]45-mrs. hamilton knew that although [he]37-joe worked [he]37-joe never had any money for [the house]1558-the house , and [she]45-mrs. hamilton foresaw the time when the little [they]970-their had would no longer suffice for [Kitty]38-kitty and [her]38-kitty . Realising this , [she]45-mrs. hamilton [herself]45-mrs. hamilton set out to find something to do .

It was a hard matter , for wherever [she]45-mrs. hamilton went seeking employment , it was always for [her]45-mrs. hamilton and [[her]45-mrs. hamilton daughter]569-her daughter , for the more [she]45-mrs. hamilton saw of [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones , the less [she]45-mrs. hamilton thought it well to leave [the girl]183-the girl under [her]45-mrs. hamilton influence . [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton was not [a keen woman]974-a keen woman , but [she]45-mrs. hamilton had [a mother]975-a mother 's intuitions , and [she]45-mrs. hamilton saw a subtle change in [[her]45-mrs. hamilton daughter]569-her daughter . At first [the girl]183-the girl grew wistful and then impatient and rebellious . [She]45-mrs. hamilton complained that [Joe]37-joe was away from [them]978-them so much enjoying [himself]37-joe , while [she]45-mrs. hamilton had to be housed up like [a prisoner]979-a prisoner . [She]45-mrs. hamilton had receded from [her]45-mrs. hamilton dignified position , and twice of an evening had gone out for a car - ride with [Thomas]80-thomas ; but as [that gentleman]980-that gentleman never included [the mother]206-the mother in [his]980-that gentleman invitation , [she]45-mrs. hamilton decided that [[her]45-mrs. hamilton daughter]569-her daughter should go no more , and [she]45-mrs. hamilton begged [Joe]37-joe to take [[his]37-joe sister]479-his sister out sometimes instead . [He]37-joe demurred at first , for [he]37-joe now numbered among [his]37-joe city acquirements a fine contempt for [[his]37-joe woman relatives]984-his woman relatives . Finally , however , [he]37-joe consented , and took [Kit]38-kitty once to [the theatre]723-the theatre and once for a ride . Each time [he]37-joe left [her]38-kitty in the care of [Thomas]80-thomas as soon as [they]986-they were out of [the house]1558-the house , while [he]37-joe went to find or to wait for [[his]37-joe dear [Hattie]100-hattie]988-his dear hattie . But [[his]37-joe mother]478-his mother did not know all this , and [Kit]38-kitty did not tell [her]478-his mother . The quick poison of the unreal life about [her]38-kitty had already begun to affect [her]38-kitty character . [She]38-kitty had grown secretive and sly . The innocent longing which in a burst of enthusiasm [she]38-kitty had expressed that first night at [the theatre]723-the theatre was growing into a real ambition with [her]38-kitty , and [she]38-kitty dropped the simple old songs [she]38-kitty knew to practise the detestable coon ditties which the stage demanded .

[She]38-kitty showed no particular pleasure when [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother found the sort of place [they]992-they wanted , but went to work with [her]38-kitty in sullen silence . [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton could not understand it all , and many a night [she]45-mrs. hamilton wept and prayed over the change in [this child]993-this child of [her]45-mrs. hamilton heart . There were times when [she]45-mrs. hamilton felt that there was nothing left to work or fight for . The letters from [Berry]34-berry in [prison]466-prison became fewer and fewer . [He]34-berry was sinking into the dull , dead routine of [his]34-berry life . [Her]45-mrs. hamilton own letters to [him]34-berry fell off . It was hard getting [the children]995-the children to write . [They]995-the children did not want to be bothered , and [she]45-mrs. hamilton could not write for [herself]45-mrs. hamilton . So in the weeks and months that followed [she]45-mrs. hamilton drifted farther away from [[her]45-mrs. hamilton children]594-her children and [husband]997-husband and all the traditions of [her]45-mrs. hamilton life .

After [Joe]37-joe 's first night at [the Banner Club]880-the banner club [he]37-joe had kept [his]37-joe promise to [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie and had gone often to meet [her]100-hattie . [She]100-hattie had taught [him]37-joe much , because it was to [her]100-hattie advantage to do so . [His]37-joe greenness had dropped from [him]37-joe like a garment , but no amount of sophistication could make [him]37-joe deem [the woman]268-the woman less perfect . [He]37-joe knew that [she]100-hattie was much older than [he]37-joe , but [he]37-joe only took this fact as an additional sign of [his]37-joe prowess in having won [her]100-hattie . [He]37-joe was proud of [himself]37-joe when [he]37-joe went behind the scenes at [the theatre]723-the theatre or waited for [her]100-hattie at the stage door and bore [her]100-hattie off under the admiring eyes of [a crowd of [gapers]1002-gapers]1001-a crowd of gapers . And [Hattie]100-hattie ? [She]100-hattie liked [him]37-joe in a half - contemptuous , half - amused way . [He]37-joe was [a good - looking boy]1003-a good - looking boy and made money enough , as [she]100-hattie expressed it , to show [her]100-hattie a good time , so [she]100-hattie was willing to overlook [his]37-joe weakness and [his]37-joe callow vanity .

" Look here , "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie said to [him]37-joe one day , " [I]100-hattie guess [you]37-joe 'll have to be moving . There 's [a young lady]1932-a young lady been inquiring for [you]37-joe to - day , and [I]100-hattie wo n't stand for that . "[100-hattie]

[He]37-joe looked at [her]100-hattie , startled for a moment , until [he]37-joe saw the laughter in [her]100-hattie eyes . Then [he]37-joe caught [her]100-hattie and kissed [her]100-hattie . " What 're [you]100-hattie givin ' [me]37-joe ? "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said .

" It 's a straight tip , that 's what . "[100-hattie]

" Who is it ? "[100-hattie]

" [It]1932-a young lady 's [a girl named [Minty Brown]63-minty from [[your]37-joe home]1934-your home]1933-a girl named minty brown from your home . "[100-hattie]

[His]37-joe face turned brick - red with fear and shame . " [Minty Brown]63-minty ! "[37-joe] [he]37-joe stammered .

Had [that girl]1638-that girl told all and undone [him]37-joe ? But [Hattie]100-hattie was going on about [her]100-hattie work and evidently knew nothing .

" Oh , [you]37-joe need n't pretend [you]37-joe do n't know [her]1638-that girl , "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie went on banteringly . " [She]1638-that girl says [you]37-joe were [great friends down [South]1936-south]1935-great friends down south , so [I]100-hattie ' ve invited [her]1638-that girl to supper . [She]1638-that girl wants to see [you]37-joe . "[100-hattie]

" To supper ! "[37-joe] [he]37-joe thought . Was [she]100-hattie mocking [him]37-joe ? Was [she]100-hattie restraining [her]100-hattie scorn of [him]37-joe only to make [his]37-joe humiliation the greater after a while ? [He]37-joe looked at [her]100-hattie , but there was no suspicion of malice in [her]100-hattie face , and [he]37-joe took hope .

" Well , [I]37-joe 'd like to see [old Minty]63-minty , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said . " It 's been many a long day since [I]37-joe ' ve seen [her]63-minty . "[37-joe]

All that afternoon , after going to [the barber - shop]482-the barber - shop , [Joe]37-joe was driven by a tempest of conflicting emotions . If [Minty Brown]63-minty had not told [his]37-joe story , why not ? Would [she]100-hattie yet tell , and if [she]100-hattie did , what would happen ? [He]37-joe tortured [himself]37-joe by questioning if [Hattie]100-hattie would cast [him]37-joe off . At the very thought [his]37-joe hand trembled , and [the man in the chair]1006-the man in the chair asked [him]37-joe if [he]37-joe had n't been drinking .

When [he]37-joe met [Minty]63-minty in the evening , however , the first glance at [her]63-minty reassured [him]37-joe . [Her]63-minty face was wreathed in smiles as [she]63-minty came forward and held out [her]63-minty hand .

" Well , well , [Joe Hamilton]37-joe , "[63-minty] [she]63-minty exclaimed , " if [I]63-minty ai n't right - down glad to see [you]37-joe ! How are [you]37-joe ? "[63-minty]

" [I]37-joe ' m middlin ' , [Minty]63-minty . How 's [yourself]63-minty ? "[37-joe] [He]37-joe was so happy that [he]37-joe could n't let go [her]63-minty hand .

" An ' jes ' look at [the boy]182-the boy ! Ef [he]182-the boy ai n't got the impidence to be waihin ' a mustache too . [You]63-minty must ' a ' been lettin ' the cats lick [yo]63-minty ' upper lip . Did n't expect to see [me]63-minty in [New York]8-new york , did [you]63-minty ? "[63-minty]

" No , indeed . What [you]63-minty doin' here ? "[63-minty]

" Oh , [I]63-minty got [a gent'man friend]1938-a gent'man friend what 's [a porter]1939-a porter , an ' [his]1938-a gent'man friend run 's been changed so that [he]1938-a gent'man friend comes hyeah , an ' [he]1938-a gent'man friend told [me]63-minty , if [I]63-minty wanted to come [he]1938-a gent'man friend 'd bring [me]63-minty thoo fur a visit , so , [you]63-minty see , hyeah [I]63-minty am . [I]63-minty allus was mighty anxious to see [this hyeah town]1940-this hyeah town . But tell [me]63-minty , how 's [Kit]38-kitty an ' [yo]1941-yo ' ma ? "[63-minty]

" [They]1008-they 're both right well . "[1007-he] [He]1007-he had forgotten [them]1008-they and [their]1008-they scorn of [Minty]63-minty .

" [Whaih]1942-whaih do [you]63-minty live ? [I]1007-he ' m comin ' roun ' to see ['em]63-minty . "[1007-he]

[He]1007-he hesitated for a moment . [He]1007-he knew how [[his]1007-he mother]478-his mother , if not [Kit]38-kitty , would receive [her]478-his mother , and yet [he]1007-he dared not anger [this woman]1010-this woman , who had [his]1007-he fate in the hollow of [her]1010-this woman hand .

[She]1010-this woman saw [his]1007-he hesitation and spoke up . " Oh , that 's all right . Let [by - gones]1943-by - gones be by - gones . " That 's right , [Minty]63-minty , that 's right , "[1007-he] [he]1007-he said , and gave [her]1010-this woman [[his]1007-he mother]478-his mother 's address . Then [he]1007-he hastened [home]210-home to prepare the way for [Minty]63-minty 's coming . [Joe]37-joe had no doubt but that [[his]1007-he mother]478-his mother would see the matter quite as [he]1007-he saw it , and be willing to temporise with [Minty]63-minty ; but [he]1007-he had reckoned without [[his]1007-he host]1014-his host . [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton might make certain concessions to [strangers]653-strangers on the score of expediency , but [she]45-mrs. hamilton absolutely refused to yield one iota of [her]45-mrs. hamilton dignity to one whom [she]45-mrs. hamilton had known so long as [an inferior]1016-an inferior .

" But do n't [you]1007-he see what [she]45-mrs. hamilton can do for [us]1945-we , [ma]1629-ma ? [She]45-mrs. hamilton knows people that [I]45-mrs. hamilton know , and [she]45-mrs. hamilton can ruin [me]45-mrs. hamilton with [them]1947-them . "[45-mrs. hamilton]

" [I]478-his mother ai n't never bowed [my]478-his mother haid to [Minty Brown]63-minty an ' [I]478-his mother ai n't a - goin' to do it now , "[478-his mother] was [[his]1017-i mother]478-his mother 's only reply .

[The girl]183-the girl began to cry , while [[her]183-the girl brother]561-her brother walked the floor angrily .

" [You]38-kitty 'll see what 'll happen , "[561-her brother] [he]561-her brother cried ; " [you]38-kitty 'll see . "[561-her brother]

[Fannie]35-fannie looked at [[her]35-fannie son]968-her son , and [she]35-fannie seemed to see [him]968-her son more clearly than [she]35-fannie had ever seen [him]968-her son before,--his foppery , [his]968-her son meanness , [his]968-her son cowardice .

" Well , "[35-fannie] [she]35-fannie answered with a sigh , " it ca n't be no wuss den what 's already happened . "[35-fannie]

" [You]38-kitty 'll see , [you]38-kitty 'll see , "[182-the boy] [the boy]182-the boy reiterated .

[Minty Brown]63-minty allowed no wind of thought to cool the fire of [her]63-minty determination . [She]63-minty left [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie 's soon after [Joe]37-joe , and [he]968-her son was still walking the floor and uttering dire forebodings when [she]63-minty rang the bell below and asked for [the Hamiltons]33-the hamiltons .

[Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones ushered [her]63-minty into [[her]63-minty fearfully upholstered parlour]1023-her fearfully upholstered parlour , and then puffed up [stairs]1024-stairs to tell [[her]63-minty lodgers]1025-her lodgers that there was [a friend there from [the South]1027-the south who wanted to see [them]33-the hamiltons]1026-a friend there from the south who wanted to see them .

" No , no , "[38-kitty] [Kitty]38-kitty broke in .

" [She]63-minty 's [a nice - lookin ' lady]1952-a nice - lookin ' lady , an ' [she]63-minty said [she]63-minty knowed [you]38-kitty at [home]210-home . "[79-mrs. jones]

" All [you]38-kitty got to do is to tell dat ooman jes ' what [I]174-her mother say . "[174-her mother]

[Minty Brown]63-minty [downstairs]1029-downstairs had heard the little colloquy , and , perceiving that something was amiss , had come to the stairs to listen . Now [her]63-minty voice , striving hard to be condescending and sweet , but growing harsh with anger , floated up from below :

" Oh , nevah min ' , [lady]1954-lady , [I]63-minty ai n't anxious to see ['em]102-mis ' hamilton . "[63-minty]

[Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones gasped , and then turned and went hastily [downstairs]1029-downstairs .

[Kit]38-kitty burst out crying afresh , and [Joe]37-joe walked the floor muttering beneath [his]37-joe breath , while [the mother]206-the mother sat grimly watching the outcome . Finally [they]1032-they heard [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones ' step once more on the stairs . [She]79-mrs. jones came in without knocking , and [her]79-mrs. jones manner was distinctly unpleasant .

" [Mis ' Hamilton]102-mis ' hamilton , "[79-mrs. jones] [she]79-mrs. jones said , " [I]79-mrs. jones ' ve had a talk with [the lady]1957-the lady [downstairs]1029-downstairs , an ' [she]1957-the lady 's tol ' [me]79-mrs. jones everything . " So [you]102-mis ' hamilton goin' to put [me]79-mrs. jones out on de wo'd of [a stranger]715-a stranger ? "[79-mrs. jones]

" [I]79-mrs. jones ' m kin ' o ' sorry , but [everybody in [the house]1558-the house]1961-everybody in the house heard what [Mis ' Brown]103-mis ' brown said , an ' it 'll soon be all over [town]1851-town , an ' that ' ud ruin the reputation of [[my]79-mrs. jones house]1820-my house . "[79-mrs. jones]

" [I]79-mrs. jones reckon all dat kin be ' splained . "[79-mrs. jones]

" Yes , but [I]1033-i do n't know that [anybody]1833-anybody kin ' splain [[your]102-mis ' hamilton daughter]1966-your daughter allus being with [Mr. Thomas]80-thomas , who ai n't even divo'ced from [[his]80-thomas wife]133-his wife . "[1033-i] [She]1033-i flashed a vindictive glance at [the girl]183-the girl , who turned deadly pale and dropped [her]183-the girl head in [her]183-the girl hands .

" [You]102-mis ' hamilton daih to say dat , [Mis ' Jones]82-mis ' jones , [you]102-mis ' hamilton dat fust interduced [[my]183-the girl gal]1691-my gal to [dat man]1969-dat man and got [huh]1970-huh to go out wid [him]1969-dat man ? [I]183-the girl reckon [you]102-mis ' hamilton 'd bettah go now . "[183-the girl]

And [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones looked at [Fannie]35-fannie 's face and obeyed .

As soon as [the woman]268-the woman 's back was turned , [Joe]37-joe burst out , " There , there ! see what [you]268-the woman ' ve done with [your]268-the woman damned foolishness . "[37-joe]

[Fannie]35-fannie turned on [him]37-joe like [a tigress]1036-a tigress . " Do n't [you]102-mis ' hamilton cuss hyeah befo ' [me]35-fannie ; [I]35-fannie ai n't nevah brung [you]102-mis ' hamilton up to it , an ' [I]35-fannie wo n't stan ' it . Go to [dem]1971-dem whaih [you]102-mis ' hamilton larned it , an whaih de wo'ds soun ' sweet . "[35-fannie] [The boy]182-the boy started to speak , but [she]35-fannie checked [him]182-the boy . " Do n't [you]37-joe daih to cuss ag'in or befo ' Gawd dey 'll be somep'n fu ' one o ' dis fambly to be rottin ' in jail fu ' ! "[35-fannie]

[The boy]182-the boy was cowed by [[his]182-the boy mother]478-his mother 's manner . [He]182-the boy was gathering [his]182-the boy few belongings in a bundle .

" [I]182-the boy ai n't goin' to cuss , "[182-the boy] [he]182-the boy said sullenly , " [I]182-the boy ' m goin' out o ' [your]35-fannie way . "[182-the boy]

" Oh , go on , "[35-fannie] [she]35-fannie said , " go on . It 's been a long time sence [you]182-the boy been [[my]35-fannie son]1751-my son . [You]182-the boy on [yo]182-the boy ' way to hell , an ' [you]182-the boy is been fu ' lo dese many days . "[35-fannie]

[Joe]37-joe got out of [the house]1558-the house as soon as possible . [He]37-joe did not speak to [Kit]38-kitty nor look at [[his]182-the boy mother]478-his mother . [He]37-joe felt like [a cur]1042-a cur , because [he]37-joe knew deep down in [his]37-joe heart that [he]37-joe had only been waiting for some excuse to take this step .

As [he]37-joe slammed the door behind [him]37-joe , [[his]182-the boy mother]478-his mother flung [herself]478-his mother down by [Kit]38-kitty 's side and mingled [her]478-his mother tears with [[her]478-his mother daughter]569-her daughter 's . But [Kit]38-kitty did not raise [her]38-kitty head .

" [Dey]38-kitty ai n't nothin' lef ' but [you]183-the girl now , [Kit]38-kitty ; "[183-the girl] but [the girl]183-the girl did not speak , [she]183-the girl only shook with hard sobs .

Then [[her]183-the girl mother]174-her mother raised [her]174-her mother head and almost screamed , " [[My]174-her mother Gawd]1680-my gawd , not [you]183-the girl , [Kit]38-kitty ! "[174-her mother] [The girl]183-the girl rose , and then dropped unconscious in [[her]183-the girl mother]174-her mother 's arms .

[Joe]37-joe took [his]37-joe clothes to [a lodging - house]1049-a lodging - house that [he]37-joe knew of , and then went to [the club]836-the club to drink [himself]37-joe up to the point of going to see [Hattie]100-hattie after the show .

XI

BROKEN HOPES

What [Joe Hamilton]37-joe lacked more than anything else in [the world]1706-the world was some one to kick [him]37-joe . [Many a man who might have lived decently and become [a fairly respectable citizen]1053-a fairly respectable citizen]1052-many a man who might have lived decently and become a fairly respectable citizen has gone to the dogs for the want of [some one to administer a good resounding kick]1054-some one to administer a good resounding kick at the right time . It is corrective and clarifying .

[Joe]37-joe needed especially [[its]836-the club clarifying property]1055-its clarifying property , for though [he]37-joe knew [himself]37-joe [a cur]1042-a cur , [he]37-joe went away from [[[his]37-joe mother]478-his mother 's house]1058-his mother 's house feeling [himself]37-joe somehow aggrieved , and the feeling grew upon [him]37-joe the more [he]37-joe thought of it . [[His]37-joe mother]478-his mother had ruined [his]37-joe chance in life , and [he]37-joe could never hold up [his]37-joe head again . Yes , [he]37-joe had heard that [several of [the fellows at [the club]836-the club]1061-the fellows at the club]1060-several of the fellows at the club had shady reputations , but surely to be [the son of [a thief]1064-a thief or [a supposed thief]1065-a supposed thief]1063-the son of a thief or a supposed thief was not like being [the criminal]432-the criminal [himself]37-joe .

At [the Banner]1067-the banner [he]37-joe took a seat by [himself]37-joe , and , ordering a cocktail , sat glowering at [the few other lonely members who had happened to drop in]1068-the few other lonely members who had happened to drop in . There were [not many of [them]1068-the few other lonely members who had happened to drop in]1069-not many of them , and the contagion of unsociability had taken possession of [the house]1558-the house . [The people]617-the people sat scattered around at different tables , perfectly unmindful of [the bartender]856-the bartender , who cursed [them]617-the people under [his]856-the bartender breath for not " getting together . "[856-the bartender]

[Joe]37-joe 's mind was filled with bitter thoughts . How long had [he]37-joe been away from [home]210-home ? [he]37-joe asked [himself]37-joe . Nearly a year . Nearly a year passed in [New York]8-new york , and [he]37-joe had come to be what [he]37-joe so much desired,--a part of its fast life,--and now in a moment [an old woman]1074-an old woman 's stubbornness had destroyed all that [he]37-joe had builded .

What would [Thomas]80-thomas say when [he]80-thomas heard it ? What would [the other fellows]1075-the other fellows think ? And [Hattie]100-hattie ? It was plain that [she]100-hattie would never notice [him]37-joe again . [He]37-joe had no doubt but that the malice of [Minty Brown]63-minty would prompt [her]100-hattie to seek out [all of [[his]37-joe friends]425-his friends]1076-all of his friends and make the story known . Why had [he]37-joe not tried to placate [her]100-hattie by disavowing sympathy with [[his]37-joe mother]478-his mother ? [He]37-joe would have had no compunction about doing so , but [he]37-joe had thought of it too late . [He]37-joe sat brooding over [his]37-joe trouble until [the bartender]856-the bartender called with respectful sarcasm to ask if [he]37-joe wanted to lease the glass [he]37-joe had .

[He]37-joe gave back a silly laugh , gulped the rest of the liquor down , and was ordering another when [Sadness]90-sadness came in . [He]37-joe came up directly to [Joe]37-joe and sat down beside [him]37-joe . " [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton says ' Make it two , [Jack]51-jack , ' "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said with easy familiarity . " Well , what 's the matter , [old man]1579-old man ? [You]1579-old man 're looking glum . "[37-joe]

" [I]37-joe feel glum . "[37-joe]

" [The divine Hattie]100-hattie has n't been cutting any capers , has [she]100-hattie ? [The dear old girl]1975-the dear old girl has n't been getting hysterical at [her]100-hattie age ? Let [us]1976-us hope not . "[37-joe]

[Joe]37-joe glared at [him]37-joe . Why in the devil should [this fellow]1080-this fellow be so sadly gay when [he]1080-this fellow was weighted down with sorrow and shame and disgust ?

" Come , come now , [Hamilton]37-joe , if [you]37-joe 're sore because [I]1709-this man invited [myself]1709-this man to take a drink with [you]37-joe , [I]1709-this man 'll withdraw the order . [I]1709-this man know the heroic thing to say is that [I]1709-this man 'll pay for the drinks [myself]1709-this man , but [I]1709-this man ca n't screw [my]1709-this man courage up to the point of doing so unnatural a thing . "[1709-this man]

[Young Hamilton]78-young hamilton hastened to protest . " Oh , [I]78-young hamilton know [[you]37-joe fellows]1904-you fellows now well enough to know how many drinks to pay for . It ai n't that . "[78-young hamilton]

" Well , then , out with it . What is it ? Have n't been up to anything , have [you]37-joe ? "[1709-this man]

The desire came to [Joe]37-joe to tell [this man]1709-this man the whole truth , just what was the matter , and so to relieve [his]37-joe heart . On the impulse [he]37-joe did . If [he]37-joe had expected much from [Sadness]90-sadness [he]37-joe was disappointed , for not a muscle of [the man]269-the man 's face changed during the entire recital .

When it was over , [he]37-joe looked at [[his]37-joe companion]834-his companion critically through a wreath of smoke . Then [he]37-joe said : " For [a fellow who has had for a full year the advantage of the education of the [New York]8-new york clubs]1978-a fellow who has had for a full year the advantage of the education of the new york clubs , [you]1978-a fellow who has had for a full year the advantage of the education of the new york clubs are strangely young . Let [me]37-joe see , [you]1978-a fellow who has had for a full year the advantage of the education of the new york clubs are nineteen or twenty now -- yes . Well , that perhaps accounts for it . It 's a pity [you]1978-a fellow who has had for a full year the advantage of the education of the new york clubs were n't born older . It 's a pity [most men]1979-most men are n't . [They]1979-most men would n't have to take so much time and lose so many good things learning . Now , [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton , let [me]37-joe tell [you]93-mr. hamilton , and [you]93-mr. hamilton will pardon [me]37-joe for it , that [you]93-mr. hamilton are [a fool]539-a fool . [Your]93-mr. hamilton case is n't half as bad as that of [nine - tenths of [the fellows that hang around here]1982-the fellows that hang around here]1981-nine - tenths of the fellows that hang around here . Now , for instance , [[my]37-joe father]1583-my father was hung . "[37-joe]

[Joe]37-joe started and gave a gasp of horror .

" Oh , yes , but it was done with a very good rope and by [the best citizens of [Texas]23-texas]1984-the best citizens of texas , so it seems that [I]37-joe really ought to be very grateful to [them]1984-the best citizens of texas for the distinction [they]1984-the best citizens of texas conferred upon [[my]37-joe family]1985-my family , but [I]37-joe am not . [I]37-joe am ungratefully sad . [A man]1563-a man must be very high or very low to take the sensible view of life that keeps [him]1563-a man from being sad . [I]37-joe must confess that [I]37-joe have aspired to the depths without ever being fully able to reach them . "[37-joe]

" Now look around a bit . See [that little girl over there]1987-that little girl over there ? That 's [Viola]76-viola . Two years ago [she]76-viola wrenched up an iron stool from the floor of [a lunch - room]1988-a lunch - room , and killed [another woman with it]1989-another woman with it . [She]76-viola 's nineteen,--just about [your]1990-you age , by the way . Well , [she]76-viola had [friends]1991-friends with a certain amount of pull . [She]76-viola got out of it , and [no one]238-no one thinks the worse of [Viola]76-viola . [You]1990-you see , [Hamilton]37-joe , in this life [we]1993-we are all suffering from fever , and [no one]238-no one edges away from the other because [he]238-no one finds [him]238-no one a little warm . It 's dangerous when [you]1990-you 're not used to it ; but once [you]1990-you go through the parching process , [you]1990-you become inoculated against further contagion . Now , there 's [Barney]104-barney over there , as decent [a fellow]534-a fellow as [I]269-the man know ; but [he]104-barney has been indicted twice for pocket - picking . [A half - dozen fellows whom [you]1990-you meet [here]1617-here]1996-a half - dozen fellows whom you meet here every night have killed [[their]1996-a half - dozen fellows whom you meet here man]1998-their man . [Others]1600-others have done worse things for which [you]1990-you respect [them]1600-others less . [Poor [Wallace]105-wallace , who is just coming in , and who looks like [a jaunty ragpicker]2001-a jaunty ragpicker]2000-poor wallace , who is just coming in , and who looks like a jaunty ragpicker , came [here]1617-here about six months ago with about two thousand dollars , the proceeds from the sale of [a house [[his]105-wallace father]180-his father had left [him]105-wallace]2003-a house his father had left him . [He]105-wallace 'll sleep in one of [the club]836-the club chairs to - night , and not from choice . [He]105-wallace spent [his]105-wallace two thousand learning . But , after all , it was a good investment . It was like buying an annuity . [He]105-wallace begins to know already how to live on [others]1600-others as [they]1600-others have lived on [him]105-wallace . The plucked bird 's beak is sharpened for other 's feathers . From now on [Wallace]105-wallace will live , eat , drink , and sleep at the expense of [others]1600-others , and will forget to mourn [his]105-wallace lost money . [He]105-wallace will go on this way until , broken and useless , [the poor - house]2008-the poor - house or [the potter 's field]2009-the potter 's field gets [him]105-wallace . Oh , it 's a fine , rich life , [[my]269-the man lad]2010-my lad . [I]269-the man know [you]2010-my lad 'll like it . [I]269-the man said [you]2010-my lad would the first time [I]269-the man saw [you]2010-my lad . It has plenty of stir in it , and [a man]1563-a man never gets lonesome . [Only the rich]2012-only the rich are lonesome . It 's only [the independent who depend upon [others]1600-others]2013-the independent who depend upon others . "[269-the man]

[Sadness]90-sadness laughed a peculiar laugh , and there was a look in [his]90-sadness terribly bright eyes that made [Joe]37-joe creep . If [he]37-joe could only have understood all that [the man]269-the man was saying to [him]37-joe , [he]37-joe might even yet have turned back . But [he]37-joe did n't . [He]37-joe ordered another drink . The only effect that the talk of [Sadness]90-sadness had upon [him]37-joe was to make [him]37-joe feel wonderfully " in it . "[37-joe] It gave [him]37-joe a false bravery , and [he]37-joe mentally told [himself]37-joe that now [he]37-joe would not be afraid to face [Hattie]100-hattie .

[He]37-joe put out [his]37-joe hand to [Sadness]90-sadness with a knowing look . " Thanks , [Sadness]90-sadness , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said , " [you]90-sadness ' ve helped [me]37-joe lots . "[37-joe]

[Sadness]90-sadness brushed the proffered hand away and sprung up . " [You]90-sadness lie , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe cried , " [I]37-joe have n't ; [I]37-joe was only fool enough to try ; "[37-joe] and [he]37-joe turned hastily away from the table .

[Joe]37-joe looked surprised at first , and then laughed at [[his]37-joe friend]1085-his friend 's retreating form . " [Poor old fellow]2015-poor old fellow , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said , " drunk again . Must have had something before [he]90-sadness came in . "[37-joe]

There was not a lie in all that [Sadness]90-sadness had said either as to [their]1086-their crime or [their]1086-their condition . [He]90-sadness belonged to [a peculiar class,--one that grows larger and larger each year in [New York]8-new york and which has imitators]1087-a peculiar class,--one that grows larger and larger each year in new york and which has imitators [in [every large city]1089-every large city in [this country]1090-this country]1088-in every large city in this country . It is a set which lives , like the leech , upon the blood of others,--that draws its life from the veins of [foolish men]1091-foolish men and [immoral women]1092-immoral women , that prides itself upon its well - dressed idleness and has no shame in its voluntary pauperism . [Each member of the class]1093-each member of the class knows [every other]1094-every other , [his]1094-every other methods and [his]1094-every other limitations , and [their]1086-their loyalty one to another makes of [them]1086-their [a great hulking , fashionably uniformed fraternity of indolence]1095-a great hulking , fashionably uniformed fraternity of indolence . [Some]492-some play the races a few months of the year ; [others]1600-others , quite as intermittently , gamble at " shoestring "[1086-their] politics , and waver from party to party as time or [their]1086-their interests seem to dictate . But mostly [they]1086-their are like the lilies of [the field]1098-the field .

It was into this set that [Sadness]90-sadness had sarcastically invited [Joe]37-joe , and [Joe]37-joe felt honoured . [He]37-joe found that all of [his]37-joe former feelings had been silly and quite out of place ; that all [he]37-joe had learned in [his]37-joe earlier years was false . It was very plain to [him]37-joe now that to want a good reputation was the sign of unpardonable immaturity , and that dishonour was the only real thing worth while . It made [him]37-joe feel better .

[He]37-joe was just rising bravely to swagger out to [the theatre]723-the theatre when [Minty Brown]63-minty came in with [one of [the club - men [he]37-joe knew]1101-the club - men he knew]1100-one of the club - men he knew . [He]37-joe bowed and smiled , but [she]63-minty appeared not to notice [him]37-joe at first , and when [she]63-minty did [she]63-minty nudged [[her]63-minty companion]272-her companion and laughed .

Suddenly [his]37-joe little courage began to ooze out , and [he]37-joe knew what [she]63-minty must be saying to [the fellow at [her]63-minty side]1103-the fellow at her side , for [he]37-joe looked over at [him]37-joe and grinned . Where now was the philosophy of [Sadness]90-sadness ? Evidently [Minty]63-minty had not been brought under its educating influences , and thought about the whole matter in the old , ignorant way . [He]37-joe began to think of it too . Somehow old teachings and old traditions have an annoying way of coming back upon [us]1104-us in the critical moments of life , although [one]1622-one has long ago recognised how much truer and better some newer ways of thinking are . But [Joe]37-joe would not allow [Minty]63-minty to shatter [his]37-joe dreams by bringing up these old notions . [She]63-minty must be instructed .

[He]37-joe rose and went over to [her]63-minty table .

" Oh , [I]38-kitty would n't want to push [anybody]1833-anybody out , "[38-kitty] [Kit]38-kitty expostulated .

[We]2055-us do n't last long in this life : it soon wears [us]2055-us out , and when [we]2055-us 're worn out and sung out , danced out and played out , [the manager]2056-the manager has no further use for [us]2055-us ; so [he]2056-the manager reduces [us]2055-us to the ranks or kicks [us]2055-us out entirely . "[37-joe]

[Joe]37-joe here thought it time for [him]37-joe to put in a word . " Get out , [Hat]106-hat sterling , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said contemptuously ; " [you]106-hat sterling 're good for a dozen years yet . "[37-joe]

[She]38-kitty did n't deign to notice [him]37-joe , save so far as a sniff goes .

" Do n't [you]1770-child let what [I]37-joe say scare [you]1770-child , though , [Kitty]38-kitty . [You]1770-child ' ve got a good chance , and maybe [you]1770-child 'll have more sense than [I]37-joe ' ve got , and at least save money -- while [you]1770-child 're in it . But let 's get off that . It makes [me]37-joe sick . All [you]1770-child ' ve got to do is to come to [the opera - house]2057-the opera - house to - morrow and [I]37-joe 'll introduce [you]1770-child to [the manager]2056-the manager . [He]2056-the manager 's [a fool]539-a fool , but [I]37-joe think [we]2060-we can make [him]2056-the manager do something for [you]1770-child . "[37-joe]

" Oh , thank [you]37-joe , [I]38-kitty 'll be around to - morrow , sure . "[38-kitty]

" Better come about ten o'clock . There 's a rehearsal to - morrow , and [you]1770-child 'll find [him]2056-the manager [there]1594-there . Of course , [he]2056-the manager 'll be pretty rough , [he]2056-the manager always is at rehearsals , but [he]2056-the manager 'll take to [you]1770-child if [he]2056-the manager thinks there 's anything in [you]1770-child and [he]2056-the manager can get it out . "[37-joe]

[Kitty]38-kitty felt [herself]38-kitty dismissed and rose to go . [Joe]37-joe did not rise .

" [I]37-joe 'll see [you]1770-child later , [Kit]38-kitty , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said ; " [I]37-joe ai n't goin' just yet . Say , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe added , when [[his]37-joe sister]479-his sister was gone , " [you]1770-child 're [a hot one]2062-a hot one . What do [you]1770-child want to give [her]479-his sister all that con for ? [She]479-his sister 'll never get in . "[37-joe]

" [Joe]37-joe , "[100-hattie] said [Hattie]100-hattie , " do n't [you]37-joe get awful tired of being [a jackass]2063-a jackass ? Sometimes [I]100-hattie want to kiss [you]37-joe , and sometimes [I]100-hattie feel as if [I]100-hattie had to kick [you]37-joe . [I]100-hattie 'll compromise with [you]37-joe now by letting [you]37-joe bring [me]100-hattie some more beer . This got all stale while [[your]37-joe sister]2038-your sister was [here]1617-here . [I]100-hattie saw [she]479-his sister did n't like it , and so [I]100-hattie would n't drink any more for fear [she]479-his sister 'd try to keep up with [me]100-hattie . "[100-hattie]

" [Kit]38-kitty is a good deal of a jay yet , "[37-joe] [Joe]37-joe remarked wisely .

" Oh , yes , [this world]2066-this world is full of [jays]2067-jays . Lots of ['em]2067-jays have seen enough to make ['em]2067-jays wise , but [they]2067-jays 're still jays , and do n't know it . That 's the worst of it . [They]2067-jays go around thinking [they]2067-jays 're it , when [they]2067-jays ai n't even in the game . Go on and get the beer . "[100-hattie]

And [Joe]37-joe went , feeling vaguely that [he]37-joe had been sat upon .

[Kit]38-kitty flew [home]210-home with joyous heart to tell [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother of [her]38-kitty good prospects . [She]38-kitty burst into [the room]292-the room , crying , " Oh , [ma]1629-ma , [ma]1629-ma , [Miss Hattie]109-miss hattie thinks [I]38-kitty 'll do to go on the stage . Ai n't it grand ? "[38-kitty]

[She]38-kitty did not meet with the expected warmth of response from [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother .

" [I]174-her mother do ' know as it 'll be so gran ' . F'om what [I]174-her mother see of [dem stage people]2070-dem stage people [dey]2070-dem stage people do n't seem to ' mount to much . [De]2071-de way [dem gals]2072-dem gals shows demse'ves is right down bad to [me]174-her mother . Is [you]174-her mother goin' to dress lak [dem]2070-dem stage people [we]2070-dem stage people seen dat night ? "[174-her mother]

[Kit]38-kitty hung [her]38-kitty head .

" [I]174-her mother guess [I]174-her mother 'll have to . "[174-her mother]

" Well , ef [you]174-her mother have to , [I]38-kitty 'd ruther see [you]174-her mother daid any day . Oh , [Kit]38-kitty , [[my]38-kitty little gal]2073-my little gal , do n't do it , do n't do it . Do n't [you]174-her mother go down lak [yo]174-her mother ' brothah [Joe]37-joe . [Joe]37-joe 's gone . "[38-kitty]

" Why , [ma]1629-ma , [you]174-her mother do n't understand . [Joe]37-joe 's [somebody]2054-somebody now . [You]174-her mother ought to ' ve heard how [Miss Hattie]109-miss hattie talked about [him]37-joe . [She]109-miss hattie said [he]37-joe 's been [[her]109-miss hattie friend]2076-her friend for a long while . "[174-her mother]

" [Her]109-miss hattie frien ' , yes , an ' [his]37-joe own inimy . [You]174-her mother need n ' pattern aftah [dat gal]2077-dat gal , [Kit]38-kitty . [She]109-miss hattie ruint [Joe]37-joe , an ' [she]109-miss hattie 's aftah [you]174-her mother now . "[38-kitty]

" But nowadays [everybody]1914-everybody thinks [stage people]817-stage people respectable up [here]1617-here . "[174-her mother]

" Maybe [I]38-kitty ' m ol'-fashioned , but [I]38-kitty ca n't believe in [any ooman]2081-any ooman 's ladyship when [she]109-miss hattie shows [herse'f]2082-herse'f lak [dem gals]2072-dem gals does . Oh , [Kit]38-kitty , do n't do it . [Ai]38-kitty n't [you]38-kitty seen enough ? Do n't [you]38-kitty know enough already to stay away f'om [dese hyeah people]2084-dese hyeah people ? [Dey]38-kitty do n't want nothin' but to pull [you]38-kitty down an ' den laugh at [you]38-kitty w'en [you]38-kitty 's dragged in de dust . "[38-kitty]

" [You]38-kitty must n't feel that away , [ma]1629-ma . [I]174-her mother ' m doin' it to help [you]38-kitty . "[174-her mother]

" [I]38-kitty do ' want no sich help . [I]38-kitty 'd ruther starve . "[38-kitty]

[Kit]38-kitty did not reply , but there was no yielding in [her]38-kitty manner .

" [Kit]38-kitty , "[174-her mother] [[her]38-kitty mother]174-her mother went on , " [dey]38-kitty 's somep'n [I]174-her mother ai n't nevah tol ' [you]38-kitty dat [I]174-her mother ' m goin' to tell [you]38-kitty now . "[174-her mother] [She]174-her mother hesitated . " [He]110-mistah gibson say dat [I]174-her mother ai n't noways ma'ied to [my]174-her mother po ' husban ' , dat a pen'tentiary sentence is de same as a divo'ce , an ' if [Be'y]110-mistah gibson should live to git out , [we]2086-we 'd have to [ma'y]110-mistah gibson ag'in . [I]174-her mother would n't min ' dat , [Kit]38-kitty , but [he]110-mistah gibson say dat at [Be'y]110-mistah gibson 's age [dey]174-her mother ai n't much chanst of [his]110-mistah gibson livin ' to git out , an ' hyeah [I]174-her mother 'll live all dis time alone , an ' den have [no one]238-no one to tek keer o ' [me]174-her mother w'en [I]174-her mother git ol' . [He]110-mistah gibson wants [me]174-her mother to ma'y [him]110-mistah gibson , [Kit]38-kitty . [The mother]206-the mother looked up to see just what effect [her]206-the mother plea would have on [[her]206-the mother daughter]569-her daughter . [She]206-the mother hoped that what [she]206-the mother said would have the desired result . But [the girl]183-the girl turned around from fixing [her]183-the girl neck - ribbon before the glass , [her]183-the girl face radiant . " Why , it 'll be splendid . [He]110-mistah gibson 's such [a nice man]2089-a nice man , [an ' race - horse men]2090-an ' race - horse men ' most always have money . Then [I]183-the girl 'd feel that [you]38-kitty was safe an ' settled , an ' that [you]38-kitty would n't be lonesome when the show was out of [town]1851-town . "[183-the girl]

" [You]206-the mother want [me]206-the mother to ma'y [him]110-mistah gibson an ' desert [yo]2093-yo ' po ' pa ? "[206-the mother]

" [I]183-the girl guess what [he]110-mistah gibson says is right , [ma]1629-ma . [I]183-the girl do n't reckon [we]2095-we 'll ever see [pa]1790-pa again an ' [you]38-kitty got to do something . [You]38-kitty got to live for [yourself]38-kitty now . "[183-the girl]

[[Her]1157-her mother]174-her mother dropped [her]174-her mother head in [her]174-her mother hands . " All right , "[174-her mother] [she]174-her mother said , " [I]174-her mother 'll do it ; [I]174-her mother 'll ma'y [him]110-mistah gibson . [I]174-her mother might as well go de way both [my]174-her mother chillen 's gone . Po ' Be'y , po ' Be'y .
