"[174-her mother] And [Mrs. Hamilton]45-mrs. hamilton rose and tottered from [the room]292-the room , as if the old age [she]45-mrs. hamilton anticipated had already come upon [her]45-mrs. hamilton .

[Kit]38-kitty stood looking after [her]45-mrs. hamilton , fear and grief in [her]38-kitty eyes . " [Poor ma]2098-poor ma , "[38-kitty] [she]38-kitty said , " an ' [poor pa]2099-poor pa . But [I]38-kitty know , an ' [I]38-kitty know it 's for the best . "[38-kitty]

On the next morning [she]45-mrs. hamilton was up early and practising hard for [her]45-mrs. hamilton interview with [the managing star of " [Martin]111-martin 's Blackbirds]2100-the managing star of " martin 's blackbirds . "[45-mrs. hamilton]

When [she]45-mrs. hamilton arrived at [the theatre]723-the theatre , [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie met [her]45-mrs. hamilton with frank friendliness .

" [I]100-hattie ' m glad [you]45-mrs. hamilton came early , [Kitty]38-kitty , "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie remarked , " for maybe [you]45-mrs. hamilton can get a chance to talk with [Martin]111-martin before [he]111-martin begins rehearsal and gets all worked up . [He]111-martin 'll be a little less like a bear then . But even if [you]45-mrs. hamilton do n't see [him]111-martin before then , wait , and do n't get scared if [he]111-martin tries to bluff [you]45-mrs. hamilton . [His]111-martin bark is a good deal worse than [his]111-martin bite . "[100-hattie]

When [Mr. Martin]111-martin came in that morning , [he]111-martin had other ideas than that of seeing [applicants]1161-applicants for [places]1162-places . [His]111-martin show must begin in two weeks , and it was advertised to be larger and better than ever before , when really nothing at all had been done for it . The promise of this advertisement must be fulfilled . [Mr. Martin]111-martin was late , and was out of humour with [every one else]1163-every one else on account of it . [He]111-martin came in hurried , fierce , and important .

" Mornin ' , [Mr. Smith]112-mr. smith , mornin ' , [Mrs. Jones]79-mrs. jones . Ha , [ladies and gentlemen]2101-ladies and gentlemen , all here ? "[111-martin]

[He]111-martin shot every word out of [his]111-martin mouth as if the after - taste of it were unpleasant to [him]111-martin . [He]111-martin walked among [the chorus]1164-the chorus like [an angry king among [[his]111-martin vassals]1166-his vassals]1165-an angry king among his vassals , and [his]111-martin glance was a flash of insolent fire . From [his]111-martin head to [his]111-martin feet [he]111-martin was the very epitome of [self - sufficient , brutal conceit]1167-self - sufficient , brutal conceit .

[Kitty]38-kitty trembled as [she]38-kitty noted the hush that fell on [the people]617-the people at [his]111-martin entrance . [She]38-kitty felt like rushing out of [the room]292-the room . [She]38-kitty could never face [this terrible man]1170-this terrible man . [She]38-kitty trembled more as [she]38-kitty found [his]111-martin eyes fixed upon [her]38-kitty .

" Who 's that ? "[111-martin] [he]111-martin asked , disregarding [her]38-kitty , as if [she]38-kitty had been a stick or a stone .

" Well , do n't snap [her]38-kitty head off . It 's [a girl friend of [mine]100-hattie]2102-a girl friend of mine that wants a place , "[100-hattie] said [Hattie]100-hattie . [She]100-hattie was [the only one who would brave [Martin]111-martin]1171-the only one who would brave martin .

" [Humph]113-humph . Let [her]38-kitty wait . [I]1171-the only one who would brave martin ai n't got no time to hear [any one]1604-any one now . Get [yourselves]2104-you in line , [[you]2104-you all who are on to that first chorus]2105-you all who are on to that first chorus , while [I]1171-the only one who would brave martin ' m getting into [my]1171-the only one who would brave martin sweat - shirt . "[1171-the only one who would brave martin]

[He]111-martin disappeared behind a screen , whence [he]111-martin emerged arrayed , or only half arrayed , in a thick absorbing shirt and a thin pair of woollen trousers . Then the work began . [The man]269-the man was indefatigable . [He]269-the man was like the spirit of energy . [He]269-the man was in every place about [the stage]1173-the stage at once , leading [the chorus]1164-the chorus , showing [them]1164-the chorus steps , twisting [some awkward girl]1175-some awkward girl into shape , shouting , gesticulating , abusing [the pianist]1176-the pianist .

" Now , now , "[269-the man] [he]269-the man would shout , " [the left foot on that beat]2106-the left foot on that beat . Bah , bah , stop ! [You]2104-you walk like a lot of [tin soldiers]2107-tin soldiers . Are [your]2104-you joints rusty ? Do [you]2104-you want oil ? Look here , [Taylor]114-taylor , if [I]269-the man did n't know [you]2104-you , [I]269-the man 'd take [you]2104-you for [a truck]2108-a truck . Pick up [your]2104-you feet , open [your]2104-you mouths , and move , move , move ! Oh ! "[269-the man] and [he]269-the man would drop [his]269-the man head in despair . " And to think that [I]269-the man ' ve got to do something with these things in two weeks -- two weeks ! "[269-the man] Then [he]269-the man would turn to [them]1177-them again with a sudden reaccession of eagerness . " Now , at it again , at it again ! Hold that note , hold it ! Now whirl , and on the left foot . Stop that music , stop it ! [Miss Coster]115-miss coster , [you]2104-you 'll learn that step in about a thousand years , and [I]269-the man ' ve got nine hundred and ninety - nine years and fifty weeks less time than that to spare . Come here and try that step with [me]269-the man . Do n't be afraid to move . Step like a chicken on a hot griddle ! "[269-the man] And [some blushing girl]1178-some blushing girl would come forward and go through the step alone before all the rest .

[Kitty]38-kitty contemplated the scene with a mind equally divided between fear and anger . What should [she]38-kitty do if [he]269-the man should so speak to [her]38-kitty ? Like the others , no doubt , smile sheepishly and obey [him]269-the man . But [she]38-kitty did not like to believe it . [She]38-kitty felt that the independence which [she]38-kitty had known from babyhood would assert itself , and that [she]38-kitty would talk back to [him]269-the man , even as [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie did . [She]38-kitty felt scared and discouraged , but every now and then [[her]38-kitty friend]2076-her friend smiled encouragingly upon [her]38-kitty across [the ranks of moving singers]1180-the ranks of moving singers .

Finally , however , [her]38-kitty thoughts were broken in upon by hearing [Mr. Martin]111-martin cry : " Oh , quit , quit , and go rest [yourselves]38-kitty , [you]38-kitty ancient pieces of hickory , and let [me]111-martin forget [you]38-kitty for a minute before [I]111-martin go crazy . Where 's [that new girl]2109-that new girl now ? "[111-martin]

[Kitty]38-kitty rose and went toward [him]269-the man , trembling so that [she]38-kitty could hardly walk .

" What can [you]269-the man do ? "[111-martin]

" [I]111-martin can sing , "[111-martin] very faintly .

" Well , if that 's the voice [you]38-kitty 're going to sing in , there wo n't be many that 'll know whether it 's good or bad . Well , let 's hear something . Do [you]38-kitty know any of these ? "[111-martin]

And [he]269-the man ran over the titles of several songs . [She]38-kitty knew some of them , and [he]269-the man selected one . " Try this . Here , [Tom]80-thomas , play it for [her]38-kitty . "[269-the man]

It was an ordeal for [the girl]183-the girl to go through . [She]38-kitty had never sung before at anything more formidable than a church concert , where only [[her]38-kitty immediate acquaintances]1182-her immediate acquaintances and [townspeople]1183-townspeople were present . Now to sing before [all these strange people]1184-all these strange people , [themselves singers]1185-themselves singers , made [her]38-kitty feel faint and awkward . But the courage of desperation came to [her]38-kitty , and [she]38-kitty struck into the song . At the first [her]38-kitty voice wavered and threatened to fail [her]38-kitty . It must not . [She]38-kitty choked back [her]38-kitty fright and forced the music from [her]38-kitty lips .

When [she]38-kitty was done , [she]38-kitty was startled to hear [Martin]111-martin burst into a raucous laugh . Such humiliation ! [She]38-kitty had failed , and instead of telling [her]38-kitty , [he]111-martin was bringing [her]38-kitty to shame before [the whole company]1186-the whole company . The tears came into [her]38-kitty eyes , and [she]38-kitty was about giving way when [she]38-kitty caught a reassuring nod and smile from [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie , and seized on this as a last hope .

" Haw , haw , haw ! "[111-martin] laughed [Martin]111-martin , " haw , haw , haw ! [The little one]2110-the little one was scared , see ? [She]2110-the little one was scared , d ' [you]38-kitty understand ? But did [you]38-kitty see the grit [she]2110-the little one went at it with ? Just took the bit in [her]2110-the little one teeth and got away . Haw , haw , haw ! Now , that 's what [I]111-martin like . If [all [you]38-kitty girls]2111-all you girls had that spirit , [we]2112-we could do something in two weeks . Try another one , [girl]265-girl . "[111-martin]

[Kitty]38-kitty 's heart had suddenly grown light . [She]38-kitty sang the second one better because something within [her]38-kitty was singing .

" Good ! "[111-martin] said [Martin]111-martin , but [he]111-martin immediately returned to [his]111-martin cold manner . " [You]38-kitty watch [these girls]2114-these girls close and see what [they]2114-these girls do , and to - morrow be prepared to go into line and move as well as sing . "[111-martin]

[He]111-martin immediately turned [his]111-martin attention from [her]38-kitty to the chorus , but no slight that [he]111-martin could inflict upon [her]38-kitty now could take away the sweet truth that [she]38-kitty was engaged and to - morrow would begin work . [She]38-kitty wished [she]38-kitty could go over and embrace [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie . [She]38-kitty thought kindly of [Joe]37-joe , and promised [herself]38-kitty to give [him]37-joe a present out of [her]38-kitty first month 's earnings .

On the first night of the show [pretty little Kitty Hamilton]38-kitty was pointed out as [a girl who would n't be in the chorus]1187-a girl who would n't be in the chorus long . [The mother]206-the mother , who was soon to be [Mrs. Gibson]116-gibson , sat in [the balcony]1189-the balcony , a grieved , pained look on [her]206-the mother face . [Joe]37-joe was in a front row with some of [the rest of [the gang]1191-the gang]1190-the rest of the gang . [He]37-joe took many drinks between the acts , because [he]37-joe was proud .

[Mr. Thomas]80-thomas was [there]1594-there . [He]80-thomas also was proud , and after the performance [he]80-thomas waited for [Kitty]38-kitty at the stage door and went forward to meet [her]38-kitty as [she]38-kitty came out . The look [she]38-kitty gave [him]80-thomas stopped [him]80-thomas , and [he]80-thomas let [her]38-kitty pass without a word .

" Who 'd ' a ' thought , "[80-thomas] [he]80-thomas mused , " that [the kid]2115-the kid had that much nerve ? Well , if [they]2116-they do n't want to find out things , what do [they]2116-they come to [N]2117-n ' Yawk for ? It ai n't [nobody]1788-nobody 's old Sunday - school picnic . Guess [I]80-thomas got out easy , anyhow . "[80-thomas]

[Hattie Sterling]100-hattie took [Joe]37-joe [home]210-home in a hansom .

" Say , "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie said , " if [you]37-joe come this way for [me]100-hattie again , it 's all over , see ? [[Your]37-joe little sister]2119-your little sister 's [a comer]2120-a comer , and [I]100-hattie ' ve got to hustle to keep up with [her]2119-your little sister . "[100-hattie]

[Joe]37-joe growled and fell asleep in [his]37-joe chair . [One]1622-one must needs have a strong head or a strong will when [one]1622-one is [the brother of [a celebrity]1197-a celebrity]1196-the brother of a celebrity and would celebrate [the distinguished one]1198-the distinguished one 's success .

[XIII

THE OAKLEYS]36-the oakleys

A year after the arrest of [Berry Hamilton]34-berry , and at a time when [New York]8-new york had shown to the eyes of [[his]34-berry family]1199-his family so many strange new sights , there were few changes to be noted in the condition of affairs at [the Oakley place]1200-the oakley place . [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice was perhaps a shade more distrustful of [[his]39-maurice servants]1201-his servants , and consequently more testy with [them]1201-his servants . [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley was [the same acquiescent woman]1202-the same acquiescent woman , with unbounded faith in [[her]40-mrs. oakley husband]181-her husband 's wisdom and judgment . With complacent minds both went [their]1204-their ways , drank [their]1204-their wine , and said [their]1204-their prayers , and wished that [brother Frank]52-frank 's five years were past . [They]1204-their had letters from [him]34-berry now and then , never very cheerful in tone , but always breathing the deepest love and gratitude to [them]1204-their .

[[His]34-berry brother]201-his brother found deep cause for congratulation in the tone of these epistles .

" [Frank]52-frank is getting down to work , "[34-berry] [he]34-berry would cry exultantly . " [He]52-frank is past the first buoyant enthusiasm of youth . Ah , [Leslie]49-leslie , when [a man]1563-a man begins to be serious , then [he]52-frank begins to be something . "[40-mrs. oakley] And [her]40-mrs. oakley only answer would be , " [I]40-mrs. oakley wonder , [Maurice]39-maurice , if [Claire Lessing]46-claire will wait for [him]34-berry ? "[40-mrs. oakley]

[The two]1206-the two had frequent questions to answer as to [Frank]52-frank 's doing and prospects , and [they]1206-the two had always bright things to say of [him]34-berry , even when [his]34-berry letters gave [them]1206-the two no such warrant . [Their]1206-the two love for [him]34-berry made [them]1206-the two read large between the lines , and all [they]1206-the two read was good .

Between [Maurice]39-maurice and [[his]39-maurice brother]201-his brother no word of [the guilty servant]1208-the guilty servant ever passed . [They]1206-the two each avoided it as an unpleasant subject . [Frank]52-frank had never asked and [[his]52-frank brother]201-his brother had never proffered aught of the outcome of the case .

[Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley had once suggested it . " [Brother]117-dear brother ought to know , "[40-mrs. oakley] [she]40-mrs. oakley said , " that [Berry]34-berry is being properly punished . "[40-mrs. oakley]

" By no means , "[181-her husband] replied [[her]40-mrs. oakley husband]181-her husband . " [You]181-her husband know that it would only hurt [him]34-berry . [He]34-berry shall never know if [I]181-her husband have to tell [him]34-berry . "[181-her husband]

" [You]181-her husband are right , [Maurice]39-maurice , [you]181-her husband are always right . [We]1211-they must shield [Frank]52-frank from the pain it would cause [him]34-berry . [Poor fellow]1623-poor fellow ! [he]34-berry is so sensitive . "[40-mrs. oakley]

[Their]1211-they hearts were still steadfastly fixed upon the union of [this younger brother]261-this younger brother with [Claire Lessing]46-claire . [She]46-claire had lately come into a fortune , and there was nothing now to prevent it . [They]1211-they would have written [Frank]52-frank to urge it , but [they]1211-they both believed that to try to woo [him]52-frank away from [his]52-frank art was but to make [him]52-frank more wayward . That [any woman]1213-any woman could have power enough to take [him]52-frank away from [this jealous mistress]1214-this jealous mistress [they]1211-they very much doubted . But [they]1211-they could hope , and hope made [them]1211-they eager to open every letter that bore the French postmark . Always it might contain news that [he]52-frank was coming [home]210-home , or that [he]52-frank had made a great success , or , better , some inquiry after [Claire]46-claire . A long time [they]1211-they had waited , but found no such tidings in the letters from [Paris]3-paris .

At last , as [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice sat in [[his]39-maurice library]1216-his library one day , [the servant]386-the servant brought [him]39-maurice a letter more bulky in weight and appearance than any [he]39-maurice had yet received . [His]39-maurice eyes glistened with pleasure as [he]39-maurice read the postmark . " A letter from [Frank]52-frank , "[39-maurice] [he]39-maurice said joyfully , " and an important one , [I]39-maurice 'll wager . "[39-maurice]

[He]39-maurice smiled as [he]39-maurice weighed it in [his]39-maurice hand and caressed it . [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley was out shopping , and as [he]39-maurice knew how deep [her]40-mrs. oakley interest was , [he]39-maurice hesitated to break the seal before [she]40-mrs. oakley returned . [He]39-maurice curbed [his]39-maurice natural desire and laid the heavy envelope down on the desk . But [he]39-maurice could not deny [himself]39-maurice the pleasure of speculating as to its contents .

It was such a large , interesting - looking package . What might it not contain ? It simply reeked of possibilities . Had [any one]1604-any one banteringly told [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice that [he]39-maurice had such a deep vein of sentiment , [he]39-maurice would have denied it with scorn and laughter . But here [he]39-maurice found [himself]39-maurice sitting with the letter in [his]39-maurice hand and weaving stories as to its contents .

First , now , it might be a notice that [Frank]52-frank had received the badge of [the Legion of Honour]1219-the legion of honour . No , no , that was too big , and [he]39-maurice laughed aloud at [his]39-maurice own folly , wondering the next minute , with half shame , why [he]39-maurice laughed , for did [he]39-maurice , after all , believe anything was too big for [that brother of [his]39-maurice]1220-that brother of his ? Well , let [him]39-maurice begin , anyway , away down . Let [him]39-maurice say , for instance , that the letter told of the completion and sale of a great picture . [Frank]52-frank had sold small ones . [He]39-maurice would be glad of this , for [[his]39-maurice brother]201-his brother had written [him]39-maurice several times of things that were a - doing , but not yet of anything that was done . Or , better yet , let the letter say that some picture , long finished , but of which [the artist]253-the artist 's pride and anxiety had forbidden [him]39-maurice to speak , had made a glowing success , the success it deserved . This sounded well , and seemed not at all beyond the bounds of possibility . It was an alluring vision . [He]39-maurice saw the picture already . It was a scene from life , true in detail to the point of very minuteness , and yet with something spiritual in it that lifted it above the mere copy of the commonplace . At [the Salon]1223-the salon it would be hung on the line , and [people]1781-people would stand before it admiring its workmanship and asking who [the artist]253-the artist was . [He]39-maurice drew on [his]39-maurice memory of old reading . In [his]39-maurice mind 's eye [he]39-maurice saw [Frank]52-frank , unconscious of [his]52-frank own power or too modest to admit it , stand unknown among the crowds around [his]52-frank picture waiting for and dreading [their]1781-people criticisms . [He]39-maurice saw the light leap to [his]39-maurice eyes as [he]39-maurice heard [their]1781-people words of praise . [He]39-maurice saw the straightening of [his]39-maurice narrow shoulders when [he]39-maurice was forced to admit that [he]39-maurice was [the painter of the work]1226-the painter of the work . Then the windows of [Paris]3-paris were filled with [his]39-maurice portraits . The papers were full of [his]39-maurice praise , and [brave men]1227-brave men and [fair women]1228-fair women met together to do [him]39-maurice homage . [Fair women]1228-fair women , yes , and [Frank]52-frank would look upon [them]1228-fair women all and see reflected in [them]1228-fair women but a tithe of the glory of [one woman]1230-one woman , and [that woman]1231-that woman [Claire Lessing]46-claire . [He]39-maurice roused [himself]39-maurice and laughed again as [he]39-maurice tapped the magic envelope .

" [My]39-maurice fancies go on and conquer [the world]1706-the world for [[my]39-maurice brother]1635-my brother , "[39-maurice] [he]39-maurice muttered . " [He]1635-my brother will follow [their]1228-fair women flight one day and do it [himself]1635-my brother . "[39-maurice]

The letter drew [his]39-maurice eyes back to it . It seemed to invite [him]39-maurice , to beg [him]39-maurice even . " No , [I]39-maurice will not do it ; [I]39-maurice will wait until [Leslie]49-leslie comes . [She]49-leslie will be as glad to hear the good news as [I]39-maurice am . "[39-maurice]

[His]39-maurice dreams were taking the shape of reality in [his]39-maurice mind , and [he]39-maurice was believing all that [he]39-maurice wanted to believe .

[He]39-maurice turned to look at a picture painted by [Frank]52-frank which hung over the mantel . [He]39-maurice dwelt lovingly upon it , seeing in it the touch of [a genius]1232-a genius .

" Surely , "[39-maurice] [he]39-maurice said , " this new picture can not be greater than that , though it shall hang where [kings]2125-kings can see it and this only graces [the library of [[my]39-maurice poor house]2127-my poor house]2126-the library of my poor house . It has the feeling of [a woman]1566-a woman 's soul with the strength of [a man]1563-a man 's heart . Heigho , why will [women]243-women be so long a - shopping ? "[39-maurice]

[He]39-maurice glanced again at the letter , and [his]39-maurice hand went out involuntarily towards it . [He]39-maurice fondled it , smiling .

" Ah , [Lady Leslie]118-leslie , [I]39-maurice ' ve a mind to open it to punish [you]118-leslie for staying so long . "[39-maurice]

[He]39-maurice essayed to be playful , but [he]39-maurice knew that [he]39-maurice was trying to make a compromise with [himself]39-maurice because [his]39-maurice eagerness grew stronger than [his]39-maurice gallantry . [He]39-maurice laid the letter down and picked it up again . [He]39-maurice studied the postmark over and over . [He]39-maurice got up and walked to the window and back again , and then began fumbling in [his]39-maurice pockets for [his]39-maurice knife . No , [he]39-maurice did not want it ; yes , [he]39-maurice did . [He]39-maurice would just cut the envelope and make believe [he]39-maurice had read it to pique [[his]39-maurice wife]133-his wife ; but [he]39-maurice would not read it . Yes , that was it . [He]39-maurice found the knife and slit the paper . [His]39-maurice fingers trembled as [he]39-maurice touched the sheets that protruded . Why would not [Leslie]118-leslie come ? Did [she]118-leslie not know that [he]39-maurice was waiting for [her]118-leslie ? [She]118-leslie ought to have known that there was a letter from [Paris]3-paris to - day , for it had been a month since [they]1234-they had had one .

There was a sound of footsteps without . [He]39-maurice sprang up , crying , " [I]39-maurice ' ve been waiting so long for [you]118-leslie ! "[39-maurice] [A servant]152-a servant opened the door to bring [him]39-maurice a message . [Oakley]39-maurice dismissed [him]39-maurice angrily . What did [he]39-maurice want to go down to [the Continental]1236-the continental for to drink and talk politics to [a lot of muddle - pated fools]1237-a lot of muddle - pated fools when [he]39-maurice had [a brother in [Paris]3-paris]1238-a brother in paris who was [an artist]1585-an artist and a letter from [him]39-maurice lay unread in [his]39-maurice hand ? [His]39-maurice patience and [his]39-maurice temper were going . [Leslie]118-leslie was careless and unfeeling . [She]118-leslie ought to come ; [he]39-maurice was tired of waiting .

[A carriage]1240-a carriage rolled up [the driveway]1241-the driveway and [he]39-maurice dropped the letter guiltily , as if it were not [his]39-maurice own . [He]39-maurice would only say that [he]39-maurice had grown tired of waiting and started to read it . But it was only [[Mrs. Davis]119-mrs. davis 's footman]1242-mrs. davis 's footman leaving a note for [Leslie]118-leslie about some charity .

[He]39-maurice went back to the letter . Well , it was [his]39-maurice . [Leslie]118-leslie had forfeited [her]118-leslie right to see it as soon as [he]39-maurice . It might be mean , but it was not dishonest . No , [he]39-maurice would not read it now , but [he]39-maurice would take it out and show [her]118-leslie that [he]39-maurice had exercised [his]39-maurice self - control in spite of [her]118-leslie shortcomings . [He]39-maurice laid it on the desk once more . It leered at [him]39-maurice . [He]39-maurice might just open the sheets enough to see the lines that began it , and read no further . Yes , [he]39-maurice would do that . [Leslie]118-leslie could not feel hurt at such a little thing .

The first line had only " [Dear Brother]117-dear brother . "[39-maurice] " [Dear Brother]117-dear brother "[39-maurice] ! Why not the second ? That could not hold much more . The second line held [him]39-maurice , and the third , and the fourth , and as [he]39-maurice read on , unmindful now of what [Leslie]118-leslie might think or feel , [his]39-maurice face turned from the ruddy glow of pleasant anxiety to the pallor of grief and terror . [He]39-maurice was not half - way through it when [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley 's voice in [the hall]287-the hall announced [her]118-leslie coming . [He]39-maurice did not hear [her]118-leslie . [He]39-maurice sat staring at the page before [him]39-maurice , [his]39-maurice lips apart and [his]39-maurice eyes staring . " What is it ? "[133-his wife] [she]133-his wife cried . " [Maurice]39-maurice ! [Maurice]39-maurice ! "[133-his wife]

[He]39-maurice lay on the floor staring up at the ceiling , the letter clutched in [his]39-maurice hands . [She]133-his wife ran to [him]39-maurice and lifted up [his]39-maurice head , but [he]39-maurice gave no sign of life . Already [the servants]405-the servants were crowding to the door . [She]133-his wife bade one of [them]405-the servants to hasten for [a doctor]1248-a doctor , [others]1600-others to bring water and brandy , and the rest to be gone . Without a thought of wrong , for [they]405-the servants had no secrets from [each other]192-each other , [she]133-his wife glanced at the opening lines . Then [she]133-his wife forgot [the unconscious man at [her]133-his wife feet]1252-the unconscious man at her feet and read the letter through to the end .

The letter was in [Frank]52-frank 's neat hand , a little shaken , perhaps , by nervousness .

" [DEAR BROTHER]117-dear brother , "[1252-the unconscious man at her feet] it ran , " [I]1252-the unconscious man at her feet know [you]117-dear brother will grieve at receiving this , and [I]1252-the unconscious man at her feet wish that [I]1252-the unconscious man at her feet might bear [your]117-dear brother grief for [you]117-dear brother , but [I]1252-the unconscious man at her feet can not , though [I]1252-the unconscious man at her feet have as heavy a burden as this can bring to [you]117-dear brother . [He]1260-the medical man feared too for [his]1260-the medical man heart , for [the patient]1261-the patient constantly held [his]1260-the medical man hands pressed against [his]1260-the medical man bosom . In vain [the doctor]1255-the doctor pleaded ; [he]1260-the medical man would not take [them]1263-them down , and when [the wife]1264-the wife added [her]1264-the wife word , [the physician]1265-the physician gave up , and after prescribing , left , much puzzled in mind .

" It 's a strange case , "[1260-the medical man] [he]1260-the medical man said ; " there 's something more than the nervous shock that makes [him]1260-the medical man clutch [his]1260-the medical man chest like that , and yet [I]1260-the medical man have never noticed signs of heart trouble in [Oakley]39-maurice . Oh , well , business worry will produce anything in [anybody]1833-anybody . "[1260-the medical man]

It was soon common talk about [the town]172-the town about [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice 's attack . In the seclusion of [[his]1260-the medical man chamber]1267-his chamber [he]1260-the medical man was saying to [[his]1260-the medical man wife]133-his wife :

" Ah , [Leslie]118-leslie , [you]118-leslie and [I]1260-the medical man will keep the secret . [No one]238-no one shall ever know . "[1260-the medical man]

" Yes , [dear]2147-dear , but -- but -- what of [Berry]34-berry ? "[1260-the medical man]

" What of [Berry]34-berry ? "[1260-the medical man] [he]1260-the medical man cried , starting up excitedly . " What is [Berry]34-berry to [Frank]52-frank ? What is [that nigger]1719-that nigger to [[my]1260-the medical man brother]1635-my brother ? What are [his]1719-that nigger sufferings to the honour of [[my]1260-the medical man family]1985-my family and name ? "[1260-the medical man]

" Never mind , [Maurice]39-maurice , never mind , [you]39-maurice are right . "[1260-the medical man]

" It must never be known , [I]1260-the medical man say , if [Berry]34-berry has to rot in [jail]2163-jail . "[1260-the medical man]

So [they]1269-they wrote a lie to [Frank]52-frank , and buried the secret in [their]1269-they breasts , and [Oakley]39-maurice wore its visible form upon [his]39-maurice heart .

XIV

FRANKENSTEIN

Five years is but a short time in the life of [a man]1563-a man , and yet many things may happen therein . For instance , the whole way of [a family]667-a family 's life may be changed . Good natures may be made into bad ones and out of a soul of faith grow a spirit of unbelief . The independence of respectability may harden into the insolence of defiance , and the sensitive cheek of modesty into the brazen face of shamelessness . It may be true that the habits of years are hard to change , but this is not true of the first sixteen or seventeen years of [a young person]1272-a young person 's life , else [Kitty Hamilton]38-kitty and [Joe]37-joe could not so easily have become what [they]1269-they were . It had taken barely five years to accomplish an entire metamorphosis of [[their]1269-they characters]1273-their characters . In [Joe]37-joe 's case even a shorter time was needed . [He]39-maurice was so ready to go down that it needed but a gentle push to start [him]39-maurice , and once started , there was nothing within [him]39-maurice to hold [him]39-maurice back from the depths . For [his]39-maurice will was as flabby as [his]39-maurice conscience , and [his]39-maurice pride , which stands to [some men for conscience]1274-some men for conscience , had no definite aim or direction .

[Hattie Sterling]100-hattie had given [him]39-maurice both [his]39-maurice greatest impulse for evil and for good . [She]100-hattie had at first given [him]39-maurice [his]39-maurice gentle push , but when [she]100-hattie saw that [his]39-maurice collapse would lose [her]100-hattie [a faithful and useful slave]1275-a faithful and useful slave [she]100-hattie had sought to check [his]39-maurice course . [Her]100-hattie threat of the severance of [[their]1276-their relations]1277-their relations had held [him]39-maurice up for a little time , and [she]100-hattie began to believe that [he]39-maurice was safe again . [He]39-maurice went back to the work [he]39-maurice had neglected , drank moderately , and acted in most things as a sound , sensible being . Then , all of a sudden , [he]39-maurice went down again , and went down badly . [She]100-hattie kept [her]100-hattie promise and threw [him]39-maurice over . Then [he]39-maurice became [a hanger - on]1278-a hanger - on at [the clubs]1279-the clubs , [a genteel loafer]1280-a genteel loafer . [He]39-maurice used to say in [his]39-maurice sober moments that at last [he]39-maurice was [one of [the boys that [Sadness]90-sadness had spoken of]1282-the boys that sadness had spoken of]1281-one of the boys that sadness had spoken of . [He]39-maurice did not work , and yet [he]39-maurice lived and ate and was proud of [his]39-maurice degradation . But [he]39-maurice soon tired of being separated from [Hattie]100-hattie , and straightened up again . After some demur [she]100-hattie received [him]39-maurice upon [his]39-maurice former footing . It was only for a few months . [He]39-maurice fell again . For almost four years this had happened intermittently . Finally [he]39-maurice took a turn for the better that endured so long that [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie again gave [him]39-maurice [her]100-hattie faith . Then [the woman]268-the woman made [her]268-the woman mistake . [She]268-the woman warmed to [him]39-maurice . [She]268-the woman showed [him]39-maurice that [she]268-the woman was proud of [him]39-maurice . [He]39-maurice went forth at once to celebrate [his]39-maurice victory . [He]39-maurice did not return to [her]100-hattie for three days . Then [he]39-maurice was battered , unkempt , and thick of speech .

[She]100-hattie looked at [him]39-maurice in silent contempt for a while as [he]39-maurice sat nursing [his]39-maurice aching head .

" Well , [you]39-maurice 're [a beauty]2164-a beauty , "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie said finally with cutting scorn . " [You]39-maurice ought to be put under a glass case and placed on exhibition . "[100-hattie]

[He]39-maurice groaned and [his]39-maurice head sunk lower . [A drunken man]1284-a drunken man is always disarmed .

[His]39-maurice helplessness , instead of inspiring [her]100-hattie with pity , inflamed [her]100-hattie with an unfeeling anger that burst forth in a volume of taunts .

" [You]39-maurice 're the thing [I]39-maurice ' ve given up all [my]39-maurice chances for -- [you]39-maurice , [a miserable , drunken jay]2165-a miserable , drunken jay , without [a jay]2166-a jay 's decency . [No one]238-no one had ever looked at [you]39-maurice until [I]39-maurice picked [you]39-maurice up and [you]39-maurice ' ve been strutting around ever since , showing off because [I]39-maurice was kind to [you]39-maurice , and now this is the way [you]39-maurice pay [me]39-maurice back . [Drunk]2168-drunk half the time and half drunk the rest . Well , [you]39-maurice know what [I]39-maurice told [you]39-maurice the last time [you]39-maurice got ' loaded ' ? [I]39-maurice mean it too . [You]39-maurice 're not the only star in sight , see ? "[39-maurice]

[She]1285-she laughed meanly and began to sing , " [You]1286-he 'll have to find [another baby]2169-another baby now . "[1285-she]

For the first time [he]1286-he looked up , and [his]1286-he eyes were full of tears -- tears both of grief and intoxication . There was an expression of a whipped dog on [his]1286-he face .

" Do'--Ha'ie , do'-- "[1286-he] [he]1286-he pleaded , stretching out [his]1286-he hands to [her]1285-she .

[Her]1285-she eyes blazed back at [him]1286-he , but [she]1285-she sang on insolently , tauntingly .

The very inanity of [the man]269-the man disgusted [her]1285-she , and on a sudden impulse [she]1285-she sprang up and struck [him]1286-he full in the face with the flat of [her]1285-she hand . [He]1286-he was too weak to resist the blow , and , tumbling from the chair , fell limply to the floor , where [he]1286-he lay at [her]1285-she feet , alternately weeping aloud and quivering with drunken , hiccoughing sobs .

" Get up ! "[1285-she] [she]1285-she cried ; " get up and get out o ' [here]1617-here . [You]1286-he sha'n't lay around [[my]1285-she house]1820-my house . "[1285-she]

[He]1286-he had already begun to fall into a drunken sleep , but [she]1285-she shook [him]1286-he , got [him]1286-he to [his]1286-he feet , and pushed [him]1286-he outside the door . " Now , go , [you]1286-he drunken dog , and never put [your]1286-he foot inside [this house]251-this house again . "[1285-she]

[He]1286-he stood outside , swaying dizzily upon [his]1286-he feet and looking back with dazed eyes at the door , then [he]1286-he muttered : " Pu ' [me]1286-he out , wi ' [you]1285-she ? Pu ' [me]1286-he out , damn [you]1285-she ! Well , [I]1286-he ki ' [you]1285-she . See ' f [I]1286-he do n't ; "[1286-he] and [he]1286-he half walked , half fell down [the street]537-the street .

[Sadness]90-sadness and [Skaggsy]97-skaggsy were together at [the club]836-the club that night . Five years had not changed the latter as to wealth or position or inclination , and [he]1286-he was still [a frequent visitor at [the Banner]1067-the banner]1290-a frequent visitor at the banner . [He]1286-he always came in alone now , for [Maudie]96-maudie had gone the way of [all the half - world]1292-all the half - world , and reached depths to which [Mr. Skaggs]95-skaggs 's job prevented [him]1286-he from following [her]1293-her . However , [he]1286-he mourned truly for [[his]1286-he lost companion]1294-his lost companion , and to - night [he]1286-he was in a particularly pensive mood .

[Some one]1642-some one was playing rag - time on the piano , and [the dancers]1296-the dancers were wheeling in time to the music . [Skaggsy]97-skaggsy looked at [them]1296-the dancers regretfully as [he]1286-he sipped [his]1286-he liquor . It made [him]1286-he think of [Maudie]96-maudie . [He]1286-he sighed and turned away .

" [I]1286-he tell [you]90-sadness , [Sadness]90-sadness , "[1286-he] [he]1286-he said impulsively , " dancing is the poetry of motion . "[1286-he]

" Yes , "[90-sadness] replied [Sadness]90-sadness , " and dancing in rag - time is the dialect poetry . "[90-sadness]

[The reporter]939-the reporter did not like this . It savoured of flippancy , and [he]939-the reporter was about entering upon a discussion to prove that [Sadness]90-sadness had no soul , when [Joe]37-joe , with blood - shot eyes and dishevelled clothes , staggered in and reeled towards [them]1296-the dancers .

" Drunk again , "[90-sadness] said [Sadness]90-sadness . " Really , it 's a waste of time for [Joe]37-joe to sober up . Hullo there ! "[304-the young man] as [the young man]304-the young man brought up against [him]304-the young man ; " take a seat . "[304-the young man] [He]304-the young man put [him]304-the young man in a chair at the table . " Been lushin ' a bit , eh ? "[304-the young man]

" Gi ' [me]304-the young man some'n ' drink . "[304-the young man]

" Oh , a hair of the dog . [Some men]2173-some men shave [their]2173-some men dogs clean , and then have hydrophobia . Here , [Jack]51-jack ! "[304-the young man]

[They]1296-the dancers drank , and then , as if the whiskey had done [him]304-the young man good , [Joe]37-joe sat up in [his]37-joe chair .

" [Ha'ie]122-ha'ie 's throwed [me]304-the young man down . "[304-the young man]

" Lucky dog ! [You]37-joe might have known it would have happened sooner or later . Better sooner than never . "[304-the young man]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs smoked in silence and looked at [Joe]37-joe .

" [I]304-the young man ' m goin' to kill [her]2174-her . "[304-the young man]

" [I]304-the young man would n't if [I]304-the young man were [you]37-joe . Take [old Sadness]90-sadness 's advice and thank [your]37-joe stars that [you]37-joe 're rid of [her]2174-her . "[304-the young man]

" [I]304-the young man ' m goin' to kill [her]2174-her . "[304-the young man] [He]304-the young man paused and looked at [them]1299-them drowsily . Then , bracing [himself]304-the young man up again , [he]304-the young man broke out suddenly , " Say , d ' ever tell [y]1299-them ' 'bout [the ol' man]2175-the ol' man ? [He]2175-the ol' man never stole that money . Know [he]2175-the ol' man di ' n ' . "[304-the young man]

[He]304-the young man threatened to fall asleep now , but [the reporter]939-the reporter was all alert . [He]304-the young man scented a story .

" By [Jove]72-jove ! "[304-the young man] [he]304-the young man exclaimed , " did [you]939-the reporter hear that ? Bet [the chap]2176-the chap stole it [himself]2176-the chap and 's letting [the old man]2177-the old man suffer for it . Great story , ai n't it ? Come , come , wake up here . [Three more]2178-three more , [Jack]51-jack . What about [[your]51-jack father]1758-your father ? "[304-the young man]

" [Father]123-father ? [Who 's [father]2181-father]2180-who 's father . Oh , do ' bother [me]304-the young man . What ? "[304-the young man]

" Here , here , tell [us]2182-us about [[your]51-jack father]1758-your father and the money . If [he]1758-your father did n't steal it , [who]2180-who 's father did ? "[304-the young man]

" Who did ? Tha ' 's it , who did ? Ol' man di ' n ' steal it , know [he]1758-your father di ' n ' . "[304-the young man]

" Oh , let [him]1758-your father alone , [Skaggsy]97-skaggsy , [he]1758-your father do n't know what [he]1758-your father 's saying . "[304-the young man]

" Yes , [he]1758-your father does , [a drunken man]1284-a drunken man tells the truth . "[304-the young man]

" In some cases , "[90-sadness] said [Sadness]90-sadness .

" Oh , let [me]304-the young man alone , [man]1656-man . [I]304-the young man ' ve been trying for years to get a big sensation for [my]304-the young man paper , and if this story is one , [I]304-the young man ' m [a made man]2186-a made man . "[304-the young man]

The drink seemed to revive [the young man]304-the young man again , and by bits [Skaggs]95-skaggs was able to pick out of [him]304-the young man the story of [[his]304-the young man father]180-his father 's arrest and conviction . At its close [he]304-the young man relapsed into stupidity , murmuring , " [She]2187-she throwed [me]304-the young man down . "[304-the young man]

" Well , "[90-sadness] sneered [Sadness]90-sadness , " [you]304-the young man see [drunken men]2188-drunken men tell the truth , and [you]304-the young man do n't seem to get much guilt out of [[our]2189-our young friend]2031-our young friend . [You]304-the young man 're disappointed , are n't [you]304-the young man ? "[90-sadness]

" [I]304-the young man confess [I]304-the young man am disappointed , but [I]304-the young man ' ve got an idea , just the same . "[304-the young man]

" Oh , [you]304-the young man have ? Well , do n't handle it carelessly ; it might go off . "[90-sadness] And [Sadness]90-sadness rose . [The reporter]939-the reporter sat thinking for a time and then followed [him]304-the young man , leaving [Joe]37-joe in a drunken sleep at the table . There [he]37-joe lay for more than two hours . When [he]37-joe finally awoke , [he]37-joe started up as if some determination had come to [him]37-joe in [his]37-joe sleep . A part of the helplessness of [his]37-joe intoxication had gone , but [his]37-joe first act was to call for more whiskey . This [he]37-joe gulped down , and followed with another and another . For a while [he]37-joe stood still , brooding silently , [his]37-joe red eyes blinking at the light . Then [he]37-joe turned abruptly and left [the club]836-the club .

It was very late when [he]37-joe reached [Hattie]100-hattie 's door , but [he]37-joe opened it with [his]37-joe latch - key , as [he]37-joe had been used to do . [He]37-joe stopped to help [himself]37-joe to a glass of brandy , as [he]37-joe had so often done before . Then [he]37-joe went directly to [[her]100-hattie room]1305-her room . [She]100-hattie was a light sleeper , and [his]37-joe step awakened [her]100-hattie .

" Who is it ? "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie cried in affright .

" It 's [me]37-joe . "[37-joe] [His]37-joe voice was steadier now , but grim .

" What do [you]100-hattie want ? Did n't [I]37-joe tell [you]100-hattie never to come here again ? Get out or [I]37-joe 'll have [you]100-hattie taken out . "[37-joe]

[She]100-hattie sprang up in bed , glaring angrily at [him]37-joe .

[His]37-joe hands twitched nervously , as if [her]100-hattie will were conquering [him]37-joe and [he]37-joe were uneasy , but [he]37-joe held [her]100-hattie eye with [his]37-joe own .

" [You]100-hattie put [me]37-joe out to - night , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe said .

" Yes , and [I]37-joe ' m going to do it again . [You]100-hattie 're drunk . "[37-joe]

[She]100-hattie started to rise , but [he]37-joe took a step towards [her]100-hattie and [she]100-hattie paused . [He]37-joe looked as [she]100-hattie had never seen [him]37-joe look before . [His]37-joe face was ashen and [his]37-joe eyes like fire and blood . [She]100-hattie quailed beneath the look . [He]37-joe took another step towards [her]100-hattie .

" [You]100-hattie put [me]37-joe out to - night , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe repeated , " like a dog . "[37-joe]

[His]37-joe step was steady and [his]37-joe tone was clear , menacingly clear . [She]100-hattie shrank back from [him]37-joe , back to the wall . Still [his]37-joe hands twitched and [his]37-joe eye held [her]100-hattie . Still [he]37-joe crept slowly towards [her]100-hattie , [his]37-joe lips working and [his]37-joe hands moving convulsively .

" [Joe]37-joe , [Joe]37-joe ! "[100-hattie] [she]100-hattie said hoarsely , " what 's the matter ? Oh , do n't look at [me]100-hattie like that . "[100-hattie]

The gown had fallen away from [her]100-hattie breast and showed the convulsive fluttering of [her]100-hattie heart .

[He]37-joe broke into a laugh , a dry , murderous laugh , and [his]37-joe hands sought each other while the fingers twitched over one another like coiling serpents .

" [You]37-joe put [me]37-joe out -- [you]37-joe -- [you]37-joe , and [you]37-joe made [me]37-joe what [I]37-joe am . "[37-joe] The realisation of what [he]37-joe was , of [his]37-joe foulness and degradation , seemed just to have come to [him]37-joe fully . " [You]37-joe made [me]37-joe what [I]37-joe am , and then [you]37-joe sent [me]37-joe away . [You]37-joe let [me]37-joe come back , and now [you]37-joe put [me]37-joe out . "[37-joe]

[She]1306-her gazed at [him]37-joe fascinated . [She]1306-her tried to scream and [she]1306-her could not . This was not [Joe]37-joe . This was not [the boy that [she]1306-her had turned and twisted about [her]1306-her little finger]1307-the boy that she had turned and twisted about her little finger . This was [a terrible , terrible man]1308-a terrible , terrible man or [a monster]1309-a monster .

[He]37-joe moved a step nearer [her]1306-her . [His]37-joe eyes fell to [her]1306-her throat . For an instant [she]1306-her lost [their]1310-they steady glare and then [she]1306-her found [her]1306-her voice . The scream was checked as it began . [His]37-joe fingers had closed over [her]1306-her throat just where the gown had left it temptingly bare . [They]1310-they gave it the caress of death . [She]1306-her struggled . [They]1310-they held [her]1306-her . [Her]1306-her eyes prayed to [his]37-joe . But [his]37-joe were the fire of hell . [She]1306-her fell back upon [her]1306-her pillow in silence . [He]37-joe had not uttered a word . [He]37-joe held [her]1306-her . Finally [he]37-joe flung [her]1306-her from [him]37-joe like a rag , and sank into a chair . And there [the officers]1311-the officers found [him]37-joe when [Hattie Sterling]100-hattie 's disappearance had become a strange thing .

XV

" [DEAR , DAMNED , DELIGHTFUL TOWN]2191-dear , damned , delightful town "[1311-the officers]

When [Joe]37-joe was taken , there was no spirit or feeling left in [him]37-joe . [He]37-joe moved mechanically , as if without sense or volition . The first impression [he]37-joe gave was that of [a man]1563-a man over - acting insanity . But this was soon removed by the very indifference with which [he]37-joe met everything concerned with [his]37-joe crime . From the very first [he]37-joe made no effort to exonerate or to vindicate [himself]37-joe . [He]37-joe talked little and only in a dry , stupefied way . [He]37-joe was as [one whose soul is dead]1313-one whose soul is dead , and perhaps it was ; for all the little soul of [him]37-joe had been wrapped up in the body of [this one woman]1314-this one woman , and the stroke that took [her]1314-this one woman life had killed [him]37-joe too .

[The men who examined [him]37-joe]1315-the men who examined him were irritated beyond measure . There was nothing for [them]1315-the men who examined him to exercise [their]1315-the men who examined him ingenuity upon . [He]37-joe left [them]1315-the men who examined him nothing to search for . [Their]1315-the men who examined him most damning question [he]37-joe answered with an apathy that showed absolutely no interest in the matter . It was as if [some one whom [he]37-joe did not care about]1316-some one whom he did not care about had committed a crime and [he]37-joe had been called to testify . The only thing which [he]37-joe noticed or seemed to have any affection for was a little pet dog which had been [hers]1314-this one woman and which [they]1315-the men who examined him sometimes allowed to be with [him]37-joe after the life sentence had been passed upon [him]37-joe and when [he]37-joe was awaiting removal . [He]37-joe would sit for hours with the little animal in [his]37-joe lap , caressing it dumbly . There was a mute sorrow in the eyes of both [man]1656-man and dog , and [they]1318-they seemed to take comfort in [each other]192-each other 's presence . There was no need of any sign between [them]1318-they . [They]1318-they had both loved [her]1314-this one woman , had [they]1318-they not ? So [they]1318-they understood .

[Sadness]90-sadness saw [him]37-joe and came back to [the Banner]1067-the banner , torn and unnerved by the sight . " [I]90-sadness saw [him]37-joe , "[90-sadness] [he]90-sadness said with a shudder , " and it 'll take more whiskey than [Jack]51-jack can give [me]90-sadness in a year to wash the memory of [him]37-joe out of [me]90-sadness . Why , [man]1656-man , it shocked [me]90-sadness all through . It 's a pity [they]1321-all the club did n't send [him]37-joe to the chair . It could n't have done [him]37-joe much harm and would have been a real mercy . "[90-sadness]

And so [Sadness]90-sadness and [all the club]1321-all the club , with a muttered " [Poor devil]2193-poor devil ! "[37-joe] dismissed [him]37-joe . [He]37-joe was gone . Why should [they]1321-all the club worry ? [Only one more who had got into the whirlpool]1322-only one more who had got into the whirlpool , enjoyed the sensation for a moment , and then swept dizzily down . There were , indeed , [some who for an earnest hour]1323-some who for an earnest hour sermonised about it and said , " Here is another example of the pernicious influence of [the city]609-the city on [untrained negroes]2195-untrained negroes . Oh , is there no way to keep [these people]1701-these people from rushing away from [the small villages and country districts of [the South]1-the south]2197-the small villages and country districts of the south up to [the cities]2198-the cities , where [they]1701-these people can not battle with the terrible force of a strange and unusual environment ? Is there no way to prove to [them]1701-these people that woollen - shirted , brown - jeaned simplicity is infinitely better than broad - clothed degradation ? "[1323-some who for an earnest hour] [They]1321-all the club wanted to preach to [these people]1701-these people that good agriculture is better than bad art,--that it was better and nobler for [them]1701-these people to sing to [God]57-god across [the Southern fields]1325-the southern fields than to dance for [rowdies]1326-rowdies in [the Northern halls]1327-the northern halls . [They]1321-all the club wanted to dare to say that [the South]1027-the south has its faults -- [no one]238-no one condones [them]1330-them -- and its disadvantages , but that even what [they]1701-these people suffered from these was better than what awaited [them]1701-these people in [the great alleys of [New York]8-new york]1331-the great alleys of new york . Down there , [the bodies]1332-the bodies were restrained , and [they]1332-the bodies chafed ; but here the soul would fester , and [they]1332-the bodies would be content .

This was but for an hour , for even while [they]1321-all the club exclaimed [they]1321-all the club knew that there was no way , and that the stream of [young negro life]1333-young negro life would continue to flow up from [the South]1-the south , dashing itself against the hard necessities of [the city]609-the city and breaking like waves against a rock,--that , until [the gods]675-the gods grew tired of [their]1321-all the club cruel sport , there must still be sacrifices to false ideals and unreal ambitions .

There was one heart , though , that neither dismissed [Joe]37-joe with gratuitous pity nor sermonised about [him]37-joe . [The mother heart]1336-the mother heart had only room for grief and pain . Already it had borne its share . [It]1336-the mother heart had known sorrow for [a lost husband]1337-a lost husband , tears at the neglect and brutality of [a new companion]1338-a new companion , shame for [a daughter]1339-a daughter 's sake , and it had seemed already filled to overflowing . And yet the fates had put in this one other burden until it seemed it must burst with the weight of it .

To [Fannie Hamilton]35-fannie 's mind now all [[her]35-fannie boy]1340-her boy 's shortcomings became as naught . [He]1340-her boy was not [[her]35-fannie wayward , erring , [criminal son]1342-criminal son]1341-her wayward , erring , criminal son . [She]35-fannie only remembered that [he]1340-her boy was [[her]35-fannie son]968-her son , and wept for [him]1340-her boy as such . [She]35-fannie forgot [his]1340-her boy curses , while [her]35-fannie memory went back to the sweetness of [his]1340-her boy baby prattle and the soft words of [his]1340-her boy tenderer youth . Until the last [she]35-fannie clung to [him]1340-her boy , holding [him]1340-her boy guiltless , and to [her]35-fannie thought [they]1344-they took to [prison]466-prison , not [Joe Hamilton]37-joe , [a convicted criminal]1346-a convicted criminal , but [Joey]37-joe , [Joey]37-joe , [[her]35-fannie boy]1340-her boy , [[her]35-fannie firstborn,--a martyr]1348-her firstborn,--a martyr .

[The pretty Miss Kitty Hamilton]38-kitty was less deeply impressed . The arrest and subsequent conviction of [[her]35-fannie brother]561-her brother was quite a blow . [She]35-fannie felt the shame of it keenly , and some of the grief . To [her]35-fannie , coming as it did just at a time when [the company]1350-the company was being strengthened and [she]35-fannie more importantly featured than ever , it was decidedly inopportune , for [no one]238-no one could help connecting [her]35-fannie name with the affair .

For a long time [she]35-fannie and [[her]35-fannie brother]561-her brother had scarcely been upon speaking terms . During [Joe]37-joe 's frequent lapses from industry [he]37-joe had been prone to " touch "[479-his sister] [[his]37-joe sister]479-his sister for the wherewithal to supply [his]37-joe various wants . When , finally , [she]35-fannie grew tired and refused to be " touched , "[37-joe] [he]37-joe rebuked [her]35-fannie for withholding that which , save for [his]37-joe help , [she]35-fannie would never have been able to make . This went on until [they]1354-they were almost entirely estranged . [He]37-joe was wo nt to say that " now [[his]37-joe sister]479-his sister was up in [the world]1706-the world , [she]479-his sister had got the big head , "[35-fannie] and [she]35-fannie to retort that [[her]35-fannie brother]561-her brother " wanted to use [her]479-his sister for a ' soft thing . ' "[35-fannie]

From the time that [she]35-fannie went on the stage [she]35-fannie had begun to live [her]35-fannie own life , a life in which the chief aim was the possession of good clothes and the ability to attract the attention which [she]35-fannie had learned to crave . The greatest sign of interest [she]35-fannie showed in [[her]35-fannie brother]561-her brother 's affair was , at first , to offer [[her]35-fannie mother]174-her mother money to secure [a lawyer]1358-a lawyer . But when [Joe]37-joe confessed all , [she]35-fannie consoled [herself]35-fannie with the reflection that perhaps it was for the best , and kept [her]35-fannie money in [her]35-fannie pocket with a sense of satisfaction . [She]35-fannie was getting to be so very much more [[Joe]37-joe 's sister]1133-joe 's sister . [She]35-fannie did not go to see [[her]35-fannie brother]561-her brother . [She]35-fannie was afraid it might make [her]35-fannie nervous while [she]35-fannie was in [the city]609-the city , and [she]35-fannie went on [the road]1362-the road with [[her]35-fannie company]1111-her company before [he]561-her brother was taken away .

[Miss Kitty Hamilton]38-kitty had to be very careful about [her]38-kitty nerves and [her]38-kitty health . [She]38-kitty had had experiences , and [her]38-kitty voice was not as good as it used to be , and [her]38-kitty beauty had to be aided by cosmetics . So [she]38-kitty went away from [New York]8-new york , and only read of all that happened when [some one]1642-some one called [her]38-kitty attention to it in the papers .

[Berry Hamilton]34-berry in [[his]34-berry Southern prison]1365-his southern prison knew nothing of all this , for no letters had passed between [him]34-berry and [[his]34-berry family]1199-his family for more than two years . The very cruelty of destiny defeated itself in this and was kind .

[XVI

SKAGGS]124-xvi skaggs 'S THEORY

There was , perhaps , more depth to [Mr. Skaggs]95-skaggs than [most people]1367-most people gave [him]95-skaggs credit for having . However it may be , when [he]95-skaggs got an idea into [his]95-skaggs head , whether it were insane or otherwise , [he]95-skaggs had a decidedly tenacious way of holding to it . [Sadness]90-sadness had been disposed to laugh at [him]95-skaggs when [he]95-skaggs announced that [Joe]37-joe 's drunken story of [[his]37-joe father]180-his father 's troubles had given [him]95-skaggs an idea . But it was , nevertheless , true , and that idea had stayed with [him]95-skaggs clear through the exciting events that followed on that fatal night . [He]95-skaggs thought and dreamed of it until [he]95-skaggs had made a working theory . Then one day , with a boldness that [he]95-skaggs seldom assumed when in the sacred Presence , [he]95-skaggs walked into [the office]1369-the office and laid [his]95-skaggs plans before [the editor]1370-the editor . [They]1371-they talked together for some time , and [the editor]1370-the editor seemed hard to convince .

" It would be a big thing for the paper , "[1370-the editor] [he]1370-the editor said , " if it only panned out ; but it is such a rattle - brained , harum - scarum thing . [No one under the sun]2201-no one under the sun would have thought of it but [you]95-skaggs , [Skaggs]95-skaggs . "[1370-the editor]

" Oh , it 's bound to pan out . [I]1370-the editor see the thing as clear as day . There 's no getting around it . "[1370-the editor]

" Yes , it looks plausible , but so does all fiction . [You]95-skaggs 're taking a chance . [You]95-skaggs 're losing time . If it fails---- "[1370-the editor]

" But if it succeeds ? "[1370-the editor]

" Well , go and bring back a story . If [you]95-skaggs do n't , look out . It 's against [my]1370-the editor better judgment anyway . Remember [I]1370-the editor told [you]95-skaggs that . "[1370-the editor]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs shot out of [the office]1369-the office , and within an hour and a half had boarded [a fast train]1374-a fast train for [the South]1-the south .

It is almost a question whether [Skaggs]95-skaggs had a theory or whether [he]95-skaggs had told [himself]95-skaggs a pretty story and , as usual , believed it . [The editor]1370-the editor was right . [No one else]871-no one else would have thought of the wild thing that was in [the reporter]939-the reporter 's mind . [The detective]311-the detective had not thought of it five years before , nor had [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice and [[his]39-maurice friends]425-his friends had an inkling , and here was one of [the New [York]28-york _ Universe 's _]22-new york _ universe young men going miles to prove [his]95-skaggs idea about something that did not at all concern [him]95-skaggs .

When [Skaggs]95-skaggs reached [the town]172-the town which had been [the home of [the Hamiltons]33-the hamiltons]1381-the home of the hamiltons , [he]95-skaggs went at once to [the Continental Hotel]452-the continental hotel . [He]95-skaggs had as yet formulated no plan of immediate action and with [a fool]539-a fool 's or a genius ' belief in [his]95-skaggs destiny [he]95-skaggs sat down to await the turn of events . [His]95-skaggs first move would be to get acquainted with [some of [[his]95-skaggs neighbours]1385-his neighbours]1384-some of his neighbours . [Thither]125-thither [he]95-skaggs went , and [his]95-skaggs convivial cheerfulness soon placed [him]95-skaggs on terms of equality with many of [[his]95-skaggs kind]1392-his kind .

[He]95-skaggs insinuated that [he]95-skaggs was looking around for business prospects . This proved [his]95-skaggs open - sesame . Five years had not changed [the Continental frequenters]1393-the continental frequenters much , and [Skaggs]95-skaggs 's intention immediately brought [Beachfield Davis]68-beachfield down upon [him]95-skaggs with the remark , " If [a man]1563-a man wants to go into business , business for [a gentleman]2203-a gentleman , suh , Gad , there 's no finer or better paying business in [the world]1706-the world than breeding blooded dogs -- that is , if [you]2205-you get [a man of experience]2206-a man of experience to go in with [you]2205-you . "[68-beachfield]

" Dogs , dogs , "[65-old horace talbot] [drivelled old Horace Talbot]65-old horace talbot , " [Beachfield]68-beachfield 's always talking about dogs . "[457-the colonel]

" Later events ? "[457-the colonel]

" Yes . "[457-the colonel] [The Colonel]457-the colonel leaned across the table and [his]457-the colonel voice fell to a whisper . " Four years ago a great change took place in [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice . It happened in the space of a day , and [no one]238-no one knows the cause of it . From [a social , companionable man]2225-a social , companionable man , [he]39-maurice became [a recluse]2226-a recluse , shunning [visitors and dreading society]2227-visitors and dreading society . "[457-the colonel]

" But what was the beginning of it ? "[457-the colonel]

" It is strange . "[457-the colonel]

It would have been hard to recognise in the Oakley of the present [the man of a few years before]1411-the man of a few years before .
