[He]269-the man was as [a man who trembled on the brink of insanity]1412-a man who trembled on the brink of insanity . [His]269-the man guilty secret had been too much for [him]269-the man , and [Skaggs]95-skaggs 's own fingers twitched as [he]95-skaggs saw [[his]95-skaggs host]1014-his host 's hands seek the breast of [his]95-skaggs jacket every other moment .

" It is there the secret is hidden , "[269-the man] [he]269-the man said to [himself]269-the man , " and whatever it is , [I]269-the man must have it . But how -- how ? [I]269-the man ca n't knock [the man]269-the man down and rob [him]269-the man in [[his]269-the man own house]2272-his own house . "[269-the man] But [Oakley]40-mrs. oakley [himself]40-mrs. oakley proceeded to give [him]95-skaggs [his]269-the man first cue .

" [You]95-skaggs -- [you]95-skaggs -- perhaps have a message from [[my]269-the man brother]1635-my brother -- [[my]269-the man brother who is in [Paris]3-paris]2274-my brother who is in paris . [I]269-the man have not heard from [him]791-the brother for some time . "[269-the man]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs 's mind worked quickly . [He]95-skaggs remembered [the Colonel]457-the colonel 's story . Evidently [the brother]791-the brother had something to do with the secret . " Now or never , "[95-skaggs] [he]95-skaggs thought . So [he]95-skaggs said boldly , " Yes , [I]95-skaggs have a message from [[your]95-skaggs brother]1641-your brother . "[95-skaggs]

[The man]269-the man sprung up , clutching again at [his]269-the man breast . " [You]269-the man have ? [you]269-the man have ? Give it to [me]269-the man . After four years [he]791-the brother sends [me]269-the man a message ! Give it to [me]269-the man ! "[269-the man]

[The reporter]939-the reporter looked steadily at [the man]269-the man . [He]939-the reporter knew that [he]269-the man was in [his]269-the man power , that [his]269-the man very eagerness would prove traitor to [his]269-the man discretion .

" [[Your]95-skaggs brother]1641-your brother bade [me]269-the man to say to [you]95-skaggs that [you]95-skaggs have a terrible secret , that [you]95-skaggs bear it in [your]95-skaggs breast -- there -- there . [I]269-the man am [[his]1641-your brother messenger]2277-his messenger . [He]1641-your brother bids [you]95-skaggs to give it to [me]269-the man . "[269-the man]

[Oakley]40-mrs. oakley had shrunken back as if [he]269-the man had been struck .

" No , no ! "[269-the man] [he]269-the man gasped , " no , no ! [I]269-the man have no secret . "[269-the man]

[The reporter]939-the reporter moved nearer [him]269-the man . [The old man]2177-the old man shrunk against the wall , [his]2177-the old man lips working convulsively and [his]2177-the old man hand tearing at [his]2177-the old man breast as [Skaggs]95-skaggs drew nearer . [He]2177-the old man attempted to shriek , but [his]2177-the old man voice was husky and broke off in a gasping whisper .

" Give it to [me]2177-the old man , as [[your]95-skaggs brother]1641-your brother commands . "[2177-the old man]

" No , no , no ! [It]2279-it is not [his]1641-your brother secret ; it is [mine]2177-the old man . [I]2177-the old man must carry it here always , do [you]2177-the old man hear ? [I]2177-the old man must carry it till [I]2177-the old man die . Go away ! Go away ! "[2177-the old man]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs seized [him]2177-the old man . [Oakley]40-mrs. oakley struggled weakly , but [he]2177-the old man had no strength . [The reporter]939-the reporter 's hand sought the secret pocket . [He]2177-the old man felt a paper beneath [his]2177-the old man fingers . [Oakley]40-mrs. oakley gasped hoarsely as [he]2177-the old man drew it forth . Then raising [his]2177-the old man voice gave one agonised cry , and sank to the floor frothing at the mouth . At the cry rapid footsteps were heard in [the hallway]1422-the hallway , and [Mrs. Oakley]40-mrs. oakley threw open the door .

" What is the matter ? "[40-mrs. oakley] [she]40-mrs. oakley cried .

" [My]2177-the old man message has somewhat upset [[your]40-mrs. oakley husband]2280-your husband , "[2177-the old man] was the cool answer .

" But [his]2280-your husband breast is open . [Your]40-mrs. oakley hand has been in [his]2280-your husband bosom . [You]40-mrs. oakley have taken something from [him]2280-your husband . Give it to [me]40-mrs. oakley , or [I]40-mrs. oakley shall call for help . "[40-mrs. oakley]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs had not reckoned on this , but [his]95-skaggs wits came to the rescue .

" [You]40-mrs. oakley dare not call for help , "[95-skaggs] [he]95-skaggs said , " or [the world]1706-the world will know ! "[95-skaggs]

[She]40-mrs. oakley wrung [her]40-mrs. oakley hands helplessly , crying , " Oh , give it to [me]40-mrs. oakley , give it to [me]40-mrs. oakley . [We]2282-we ' ve never done [you]95-skaggs any harm . "[40-mrs. oakley]

" But [you]40-mrs. oakley ' ve harmed [some one else]859-some one else ; that is enough . "[40-mrs. oakley]

[He]95-skaggs moved towards the door , but [she]40-mrs. oakley sprang in front of [him]95-skaggs with the fierceness of [a tigress protecting [her]40-mrs. oakley young]1423-a tigress protecting her young . [She]40-mrs. oakley attacked [him]95-skaggs with teeth and nails . [She]40-mrs. oakley was pallid with fury , and it was all [he]95-skaggs could do to protect [himself]95-skaggs and yet not injure [her]40-mrs. oakley . Finally , when [her]40-mrs. oakley anger had taken [her]40-mrs. oakley strength , [he]95-skaggs succeeded in getting out . [He]95-skaggs flew down [the hall]287-the hall - way and out of the front door , [the woman]268-the woman 's screams following [him]95-skaggs . [He]95-skaggs did not pause to read the precious letter until [he]95-skaggs was safe in [[his]95-skaggs room]285-his room at [the Continental Hotel]452-the continental hotel . Then [he]95-skaggs sprang to [his]95-skaggs feet , crying , " Thank [God]57-god ! thank [God]57-god ! [I]95-skaggs was right , and [the _ Universe _]2284-the _ universe _ shall have a sensation . [The brother]791-the brother is [the thief]1620-the thief , and [Berry Hamilton]34-berry is [an innocent man]2287-an innocent man . [Hurrah]126-hurrah ! Now , who is it that has come on a wild - goose chase ? Who is it that ought to handle [his]34-berry idea carefully ? Heigho , [Saunders]74-colonel saunders [[my]95-skaggs man]2288-my man , the drinks 'll be on [you]2288-my man , and [old Skaggsy]97-skaggsy will have done some good in [the world]1706-the world . "[95-skaggs]

XVII

A YELLOW JOURNAL

[Mr. Skaggs]95-skaggs had no qualms of conscience about the manner in which [he]95-skaggs had come by the damaging evidence against [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice . It was enough for [him]95-skaggs that [he]95-skaggs had it . [A corporation]1428-a corporation , [he]95-skaggs argued , had no soul , and therefore no conscience . How much less , then , should so small a part of [a great corporation as [himself]95-skaggs]1429-a great corporation as himself be expected to have [them]1430-them ?

[He]95-skaggs had [his]95-skaggs story . It was vivid , interesting , dramatic . It meant the favour of [[his]95-skaggs editor]1431-his editor , a big thing for the _ Universe _ , and a fatter lining for [his]95-skaggs own pocket . [He]95-skaggs sat down to put [his]95-skaggs discovery on paper before [he]95-skaggs attempted anything else , although the impulse to celebrate was very strong within [him]95-skaggs .

[He]95-skaggs told [his]95-skaggs story well , with an eye to every one of its salient points . [He]95-skaggs sent an alleged picture of [Berry Hamilton]34-berry as [he]34-berry had appeared at the time of [his]34-berry arrest . [He]95-skaggs sent a picture of [the [Oakley]39-maurice home]1432-the oakley home and of [the cottage where [the servant]386-the servant and [[his]34-berry family]1199-his family had been so happy]1433-the cottage where the servant and his family had been so happy . There was a strong pen - picture of [the man]269-the man , [Oakley]39-maurice , grown haggard and morose from carrying [his]39-maurice guilty secret , of [his]39-maurice confusion when confronted with the supposed knowledge of it . [The old Southern city]1437-the old southern city was described , and the opinions of [[its]1437-the old southern city residents]1438-its residents in regard to the case given . [It]1439-it was there -- clear , interesting , and strong . [One]1622-one could see it all as if every phase of it were being enacted before one 's eyes . [Skaggs]95-skaggs surpassed [himself]95-skaggs .

When [the editor]1370-the editor first got hold of it [he]1370-the editor said " Huh ! "[1370-the editor] over the opening lines,--a few short sentences that instantly pricked the attention awake . [He]1370-the editor read on with increasing interest . " This is good stuff , "[1370-the editor] [he]1370-the editor said at the last page . " Here 's a chance for the _ Universe _ to look into the methods of Southern court proceedings . Here 's a chance for a spread . "[1370-the editor]

The _ Universe _ had always claimed to be the friend of [all poor and oppressed humanity]1442-all poor and oppressed humanity , and every once in a while [it]1439-it did something to substantiate [its]1439-it claim , whereupon [it]1439-it stood off and said to [the public]1443-the public , " Look [you]1443-the public what [we]2290-we have done , and behold how great [we]2290-we are , [the friend of [the people]617-the people]2291-the friend of the people ! "[1439-it] The _ Universe _ was yellow . [It]1439-it was very so . But it had power and keenness and energy . It never lost an opportunity to crow , and if one was not forthcoming , it made one . In this way it managed to do a considerable amount of good , and its yellowness became forgivable , even commendable . In [Skaggs]95-skaggs 's story [the editor]1370-the editor saw an opportunity for one of [its]1439-it periodical philanthropies . [He]1370-the editor seized upon it . With headlines that took half a page , and with cuts authentic and otherwise , the tale was told , and [the people of [New York]8-new york]1445-the people of new york were greeted next morning with the announcement of--

" A Burning Shame ![95-skaggs]

[A Poor and Innocent Negro]1446-a poor and innocent negro made to Suffer

for [a Rich Man]1447-a rich man 's Crime !

Great Expose by the ' Universe ' !

[A ' Universe ' Reporter To the Rescue]1448-a ' universe ' reporter to the rescue !

The Whole Thing to Be Aired that [the

People]617-the people may Know ! "[617-the people]

Then [Skaggs]95-skaggs received a telegram that made [him]95-skaggs leap for joy . [He]95-skaggs was to do it . [He]95-skaggs was to go to [the capital of [the State]1717-the state]1450-the capital of the state . [He]95-skaggs was to beard [the Governor]1452-the governor in [[his]95-skaggs den]1453-his den , and [he]95-skaggs , with the force of a great paper behind [him]95-skaggs , was to demand for [the people]617-the people the release of [an innocent man]2287-an innocent man . Then there would be another write - up and much glory for [him]95-skaggs and more shekels . In an hour after [he]95-skaggs had received [his]95-skaggs telegram [he]95-skaggs was on [his]95-skaggs way to [the Southern capital]1456-the southern capital .

* * * * *

Meanwhile in [the house of [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice]1457-the house of maurice oakley there were sad times . From the moment that [the master of [the house]1558-the house]314-the master of the house had fallen to the floor in impotent fear and madness there had been no peace within [[his]314-the master of the house doors]1460-his doors . At first [[his]314-the master of the house wife]133-his wife had tried to control [him]314-the master of the house alone , and had humoured the wild babblings with which [he]314-the master of the house woke from [his]314-the master of the house swoon . But these changed to shrieks and cries and curses , and [she]133-his wife was forced to throw open the doors so long closed and call in help . [The neighbours]1462-the neighbours and [[her]133-his wife old friends]1463-her old friends went to [her]133-his wife assistance , and what [the reporter]939-the reporter 's story had not done , the ravings of [the man]269-the man accomplished ; for , with a show of matchless cunning , [he]269-the man continually clutched at [his]269-the man breast , laughed , and babbled [his]269-the man secret openly . Even then [they]1466-they would have smothered it in silence , for the honour of [one of [[their]1466-they best families]1468-their best families]1467-one of their best families ; but too many ears had heard , and then came the yellow journal bearing all the news in emblazoned headlines .

[Colonel Saunders]74-colonel saunders was distinctly hurt to think that [his]314-the master of the house confidence had been imposed on , and that [he]314-the master of the house had been instrumental in bringing shame upon a Southern name .

" To think , [suh]2293-suh , "[74-colonel saunders] [he]74-colonel saunders said generally to [the usual assembly of choice]1469-the usual assembly of choice spirits,--"to think of [that man]1674-that man 's being [a reporter]2295-a reporter , [suh]2293-suh , [a common , ordinary reporter]2297-a common , ordinary reporter , and that [I]74-colonel saunders sat and talked to [him]1674-that man as if [he]1674-that man were [a gentleman]2203-a gentleman ! "[74-colonel saunders]

" [You]65-old horace talbot 're not to be blamed , [Colonel]74-colonel saunders , "[65-old horace talbot] said [old Horace Talbot]65-old horace talbot . " [You]65-old horace talbot ' ve done no more than [any other gentleman]2299-any other gentleman would have done . The trouble is that [the average Northerner]2300-the average northerner has no sense of honour , suh , no sense of honour . If [this particular man]2301-this particular man had had , [he]2301-this particular man would have kept still , and everything would have gone on smooth and quiet . Instead of that , [a distinguished family]2302-a distinguished family is brought to shame , and for what ? To give [a nigger]1722-a nigger a few more years of freedom when , likely as not , [he]1722-a nigger do n't want it ; and [Berry Hamilton]34-berry 's life in [prison]466-prison has proved nearer the ideal reached by slavery than anything [he]34-berry has found since emancipation . Why , [suhs]2305-suhs , [I]65-old horace talbot fancy [I]65-old horace talbot see [him]34-berry leaving [[his]34-berry prison]2306-his prison with tears of regret in [his]34-berry eyes . "[65-old horace talbot]

[Old Horace]73-old horace was inanely eloquent for an hour over [his]73-old horace pet theory . But there were some in [the town]172-the town who thought differently about the matter , and it was [their]1471-their opinions and murmurings that backed up [Skaggs]95-skaggs and made it easier for [him]73-old horace when at [the capital]1472-the capital [he]73-old horace came into contact with the official red tape .

[He]73-old horace was told that there were certain forms of procedure , and certain times for certain things , but [he]73-old horace hammered persistently away , the murmurings behind [him]73-old horace grew louder , while from [[his]73-old horace sanctum]1473-his sanctum [the editor of the _ Universe]1474-the editor of the _ universe _ thundered away against oppression and high - handed tyranny . Other papers took it up and asked why [this man]1709-this man should be despoiled of [his]1709-this man liberty any longer ? And when it was replied that [the man]269-the man had been convicted , and that the wheels of justice could not be stopped or turned back by the letter of [a romantic artist]1477-a romantic artist or the ravings of [a madman]1478-a madman , there was a mighty outcry against the farce of justice that had been played out in [this man]1709-this man 's case .

The trial was reviewed ; the evidence again brought up and examined . The dignity of [the State]1717-the state was threatened . At this time [the State]29-the state did the one thing necessary to save [its]29-the state tottering reputation . [It]29-the state would not surrender , but it capitulated , and [Berry Hamilton]34-berry was pardoned .

[Berry]34-berry heard the news with surprise and a half - bitter joy . [He]34-berry had long ago lost hope that justice would ever be done to [him]34-berry . [He]34-berry marvelled at the word that was brought to [him]34-berry now , and [he]34-berry could not understand the strange cordiality of [the young white man who met [him]34-berry at [[the warden]1482-the warden 's office]1483-the warden 's office]1481-the young white man who met him at the warden 's office . Five years of prison life had made [a different man of]1484-a different man of [him]34-berry . [He]34-berry no longer looked to receive kindness from [[his]34-berry fellows]1485-his fellows , and [he]34-berry blinked at it as [he]34-berry blinked at the unwonted brightness of the sun . The lines about [his]34-berry mouth where the smiles used to gather had changed and grown stern with the hopelessness of years . [His]34-berry lips drooped pathetically , and hard treatment had given [his]34-berry eyes a lowering look . [His]34-berry hair , that had hardly shown a white streak , was as white as [Maurice Oakley]39-maurice 's own . [His]34-berry erstwhile quick wits were dulled and imbruted . [He]34-berry had lived like an ox , working without inspiration or reward , and [he]34-berry came forth like an ox from [[his]34-berry stall]1486-his stall . All the higher part of [him]34-berry [he]34-berry had left behind , dropping it off day after day through the wearisome years . [He]34-berry had put behind [him]34-berry [the Berry Hamilton that laughed and joked and sang and believed , for even [his]34-berry faith]34-berry had become only a numbed fancy .

" This is a very happy occasion , [Mr. Hamilton]93-mr. hamilton , "[95-skaggs] said [Skaggs]95-skaggs , shaking [his]95-skaggs hand heartily .

[Berry]34-berry did not answer . What had [this slim , glib young man]1487-this slim , glib young man to do with [him]34-berry ? What had [any white man]1488-any white man to do with [him]34-berry after what [he]34-berry had suffered at [their]1489-their hands ?

" [You]95-skaggs know [you]95-skaggs are to go [New York]8-new york with [me]34-berry ? "[34-berry]

" To New Yawk ? What fu ' ? "[34-berry]

[Skaggs]95-skaggs did not tell [him]34-berry that , now that the _ Universe _ had done its work , it demanded the right to crow to [its]1490-its heart 's satisfaction . [He]95-skaggs said only , " [You]95-skaggs want to see [[your]95-skaggs wife]2307-your wife , of course ? "[95-skaggs]

[Berry]34-berry had forgotten [Fannie]35-fannie , and for the first time [his]34-berry heart thrilled within [him]34-berry at the thought of seeing [her]35-fannie again .

" [I]35-fannie ai n't hyeahed f'om [[my]35-fannie people]2308-my people fu ' a long time . [I]35-fannie did n't know what had become of 'em . How 's [Kit]38-kitty an ' [Joe]37-joe ? "[35-fannie]

" [They]2308-my people 're all right , "[34-berry] was the reply . [Skaggs]95-skaggs could n't tell [him]34-berry , in this the first hour of [his]34-berry freedom . Let [him]34-berry have time to drink the sweetness of that all in . There would be time afterwards to taste all of the bitterness .

Once in [New York]8-new york , [he]34-berry found that [people]1781-people wished to see [him]34-berry , [some fools]1492-some fools , [some philanthropists]1493-some philanthropists , and [a great many reporters]1494-a great many reporters . [He]34-berry had to be photographed -- all this before [he]34-berry could seek [those whom [he]34-berry longed to see]1495-those whom he longed to see . [They]1781-people printed [his]34-berry picture as [he]34-berry was before [he]34-berry went to [prison]466-prison and as [he]34-berry was now , a sort of before - and - after - taking comment , and in the morning that it all appeared , when the _ Universe _ spread itself to tell [the public]1443-the public what it had done and how it had done it , [they]1781-people gave [him]34-berry [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife 's address .

It would be better , [they]1781-people thought , for [her]133-his wife to tell [him]34-berry [herself]133-his wife all that happened . [No one of [them]1781-people]1499-no one of them was brave enough to stand to look in [his]34-berry eyes when [he]34-berry asked for [[his]34-berry son]135-his son and [daughter]1501-daughter , and [they]1781-people shifted [their]1781-people responsibility by pretending to [themselves]1781-people that [they]1781-people were doing it for [his]34-berry own good : that the blow would fall more gently upon [him]34-berry coming from [her]133-his wife who had been [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife . [Berry]34-berry took the address and inquired [his]34-berry way timidly , hesitatingly , but with a swelling heart , to the door of [the flat where [Fannie]35-fannie lived]1503-the flat where fannie lived .

XVIII

WHAT [BERRY]34-berry FOUND

Had not [Berry]34-berry 's years of prison life made [him]34-berry forget what little [he]34-berry knew of reading , [he]34-berry might have read the name [Gibson]116-gibson on the door - plate where [they]1781-people told [him]34-berry to ring for [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife . But [he]34-berry knew nothing of what awaited [him]34-berry as [he]34-berry confidently pulled the bell . [Fannie]35-fannie [herself]35-fannie came to the door . The news the papers held had not escaped [her]35-fannie , but [she]35-fannie had suffered in silence , hoping that [Berry]34-berry might be spared the pain of finding [her]35-fannie . Now [he]34-berry stood before [her]35-fannie , and [she]35-fannie knew [him]34-berry at a glance , in spite of [his]34-berry haggard countenance .

" [Fannie]35-fannie , "[34-berry] [he]34-berry said , holding out [his]34-berry arms to [her]35-fannie , and all of the pain and pathos of long yearning was in [his]34-berry voice , " do n't [you]35-fannie know [me]34-berry ? "[34-berry]

[She]35-fannie shrank away from [him]34-berry , back in [the hall - way]1505-the hall - way .

" Yes , yes , [Be'y]2309-be'y , [I]34-berry knows [you]34-berry . Come in . "[34-berry]

[She]35-fannie led [him]34-berry through [the passage - way]1506-the passage - way and into [[her]35-fannie room]1305-her room , [he]34-berry following with a sudden sinking at [his]34-berry heart . This was not the reception [he]34-berry had expected from [Fannie]35-fannie .

When [they]1508-they were within [the room]292-the room [he]34-berry turned and held out [his]34-berry arms to [her]35-fannie again , but [she]35-fannie did not notice [them]1508-they . " Why , is [you]35-fannie ' shamed o ' [me]34-berry ? "[34-berry] [he]34-berry asked brokenly .

" ' Shamed ? No ! Oh , Be'y , "[35-fannie] and [she]35-fannie sank into a chair and began rocking to and fro in [her]35-fannie helpless grief .

" What 's de mattah , [Fannie]35-fannie ? Ai n't [you]35-fannie glad to see [me]35-fannie ? "[35-fannie]

" Yes , yes , but [you]35-fannie do n't know nothin' , do [you]35-fannie ? [Dey]35-fannie lef ' [me]35-fannie to tell [you]35-fannie ? "[35-fannie]

" [Lef]2310-lef ' [you]35-fannie to tell [me]35-fannie ? What 's de mattah ? Is [Joe]37-joe or [Kit daid]38-kitty ? Tell [me]35-fannie . "[35-fannie]

" No , not daid . [Kit]38-kitty dances on de stage fu ' a livin ' , an ' , Be'y , [she]38-kitty ai n't de gal [she]38-kitty ust to be . [Joe]37-joe -- [Joe]37-joe -- [Joe]37-joe -- [he]37-joe 's in pen'tentiary fu ' killin ' [a ooman]2311-a ooman . "[35-fannie]

[Berry]34-berry started forward with a cry , " [[My]34-berry Gawd]1680-my gawd ! [[my]34-berry Gawd]1680-my gawd ! [[my]34-berry little gal]2073-my little gal ! [[my]34-berry boy]1867-my boy ! "[34-berry]

" [Dat]2316-dat ai n't all , "[1510-me] [she]1510-me went on dully , as if reciting a rote lesson ; " [I]1510-me ai n't [yo]2317-you ' wife no mo ' . [I]1510-me 's ma'ied ag'in . Oh Be'y , [Be'y]1510-me , do n't look at [me]1510-me lak dat . [I]1510-me could n't he'p it . [Kit]2318-kit an ' [Joe]37-joe lef ' [me]1510-me , an ' [dey]2317-you said [de pen'tentiary]2319-de pen'tentiary divo'ced [you]2317-you an ' [me]1510-me , an ' dat [you]2317-you 'd nevah come out nohow . Do n't look at [me]1510-me lak dat , [Be'y]2309-be'y . "[1510-me]

" [You]1510-me ai n't [[my]1511-he wife]2321-my wife no mo ' ? Hit 's a lie , a damn lie ! [You]2321-my wife is [[my]1511-he wife]2321-my wife . [I]1511-he 's [a innocent man]2323-a innocent man . No pen'tentiay kin tek [you]2321-my wife erway f'om [me]1511-he . Hit 's enough what [dey]1511-he ' ve done to [my]1511-he chillen . "[1511-he] [He]1511-he rushed forward and seized [her]1512-her by the arm . " [Dey]1511-he sha'n't do no mo ' , by [Gawd]59-gawd ! [dey]1511-he sha'n't , [I]1511-he say ! "[1511-he] [His]1511-he voice had risen to a fierce roar , like that of a hurt beast , and [he]1511-he shook [her]1512-her by the arm as [he]1511-he spoke .

" Oh , do n't , Be'y , do n't , [you]1512-her hu't [me]1511-he . [I]1511-he could n't he'p it . "[1511-he]

[He]1511-he glared at [her]1512-her for a moment , and then the real force of the situation came full upon [him]1511-he , and [he]1511-he bowed [his]1511-he head in [his]1511-he hands and wept like [a child]1513-a child . The great sobs came up and stuck in [his]1511-he throat .

[She]1512-her crept up to [him]1511-he fearfully and laid [her]1512-her hand on [his]1511-he head .

" Do n't cry , [Be'y]2309-be'y , "[1512-her] [she]1512-her said ; " [I]1512-her done wrong , but [I]1512-her loves [you]1511-he yit . "[1512-her]

[He]1511-he seized [her]1512-her in [his]1511-he arms and held [her]1512-her tightly until [he]1511-he could control [himself]1511-he . Then [he]1511-he asked weakly , " Well , what am [I]1511-he goin' to do ? "[1511-he]

" [I]1511-he do ' know , [Be'y]2309-be'y , ' ceptin ' dat [you]2309-be'y 'll have to leave [me]1511-he . "[1511-he]

" [I]1511-he wo n't ! [I]1511-he 'll never leave [you]1512-her again , "[1511-he] [he]1511-he replied doggedly .

" But , [Be'y]2309-be'y , [you]1512-her mus ' . [You]2309-be'y 'll only mek it ha'der on [me]1511-he , an ' [Gibson]116-gibson 'll beat [me]1511-he ag'in . "[1511-he]

" Ag'in ! "[1511-he]

[She]1512-her hung [her]1512-her head : " Yes . "[1512-her]

[He]1511-he gripped [himself]1511-he hard .

" Why cain't [you]1512-her come on off wid [me]1511-he , [Fannie]35-fannie ? [You]1512-her was [mine]1511-he fus ' . "[1511-he]

" [I]1511-he could n't . [He]1511-he would fin ' [me]1511-he anywhaih [I]1511-he went to . "[1511-he]

" Let [him]1511-he fin ' [you]1512-her . [You]1512-her 'll be wid [me]1511-he , an ' [we]2325-we 'll settle it , [him]1511-he an ' [me]1511-he . "[1511-he]

" [I]1514-i want to , but oh , [I]1514-i ca n't , [I]1514-i ca n't , "[1514-i] [she]1514-i wailed . " Please go now , [Be'y]35-fannie , befo ' [he]1511-he gits [home]210-home . [He]1511-he 's mad anyhow , 'cause [you]1514-i 're out . "[1514-i]

[Berry]34-berry looked at [her]1514-i hard , and then said in a dry voice , " An ' so [I]34-berry got to go an ' leave [you]1514-i to [him]1511-he ? "[34-berry]

" Yes , [you]1514-i mus ' ; [I]34-berry ' m [his'n]34-berry now . "[34-berry]

[He]34-berry turned to the door , murmuring , " [[My]34-berry wife]2321-my wife gone , [Kit]38-kitty [a nobody]2328-a nobody , an ' [Joe]37-joe , [little Joe]37-joe , [a murderer]2329-a murderer , an ' then [I]34-berry -- [I]34-berry -- ust to pray to Gawd an ' call [him]1511-he ' Ouah Fathah . ' "[34-berry] [He]34-berry laughed hoarsely . It sounded like nothing [Fannie]35-fannie had ever heard before .

" Do n't , [Be'y]35-fannie , do n't say dat . Maybe [we]2330-we do n't un'erstan ' . "[34-berry]

[Her]35-fannie faith still hung by a slender thread , but [his]34-berry had given way in that moment .

" No , [we]2330-we do n't un'erstan ' , "[34-berry] [he]34-berry laughed as [he]34-berry went out of the door . " [We]2330-we do n't un'erstan ' . "[34-berry]

[He]34-berry staggered down the steps , blinded by [his]34-berry emotions , and set [his]34-berry face towards [the little lodging that [he]34-berry had taken temporarily]1515-the little lodging that he had taken temporarily . There seemed nothing left in life for [him]34-berry to do . Yet [he]34-berry knew that [he]34-berry must work to live , although the effort seemed hardly worth while . [He]34-berry remembered now that the _ Universe _ had offered [him]34-berry [the under janitorship in [its building]1517-its building]1516-the under janitorship in its building . [He]34-berry would go and take it , and some day , perhaps -- [He]34-berry was not quite sure what the " perhaps "[34-berry] meant . But as [his]34-berry mind grew clearer [he]34-berry came to know , for a sullen , fierce anger was smouldering in [his]34-berry heart against [the man who through lies had stolen [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife from [him]34-berry]1518-the man who through lies had stolen his wife from him . It was anger that came slowly , but gained in fierceness as it grew .

Yes , that was it , [he]34-berry would kill [Gibson]116-gibson . It was no worse than [his]34-berry present state . Then it would be [father]2181-father and [son murderers]1521-son murderers . [They]1521-son murderers would hang [him]34-berry or send [him]34-berry back to [prison]466-prison . Neither would be hard now . [He]34-berry laughed to [himself]34-berry .

And this was what [they]1521-son murderers had let [him]34-berry out of [prison]466-prison for ? To find out all this . Why had [they]1521-son murderers not left [him]34-berry there to die in ignorance ? What had [he]34-berry to do with [all these people who gave [him]34-berry sympathy]1524-all these people who gave him sympathy ? What did [he]34-berry want of [their]1521-son murderers sympathy ? Could [they]1521-son murderers give [him]34-berry back one tithe of what [he]34-berry had lost ? Could [they]1521-son murderers restore to [him]34-berry [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife or [[his]34-berry son]135-his son or [[his]34-berry daughter]1527-his daughter , [his]34-berry quiet happiness or [his]34-berry simple faith ?

[He]34-berry went to work for the _ Universe _ , but night after night , armed , [he]34-berry patrolled [the sidewalk in front of [[Fannie]35-fannie 's house]1529-fannie 's house]1528-the sidewalk in front of fannie 's house . [He]34-berry did not know [Gibson]116-gibson , but [he]34-berry wanted to see [them]1521-son murderers together . Then [he]34-berry would strike . [His]34-berry vigils kept [him]34-berry from [his]34-berry bed , but [he]34-berry went to the next morning 's work with no weariness . The hope of revenge sustained [him]34-berry , and [he]34-berry took a savage joy in the thought that [he]34-berry should be [the dispenser of justice to at least one of [those who had wounded [him]34-berry]1531-those who had wounded him]1530-the dispenser of justice to at least one of those who had wounded him .

Finally [he]34-berry grew impatient and determined to wait no longer , but to seek [[his]34-berry enemy]1532-his enemy in [[his]34-berry own house]2272-his own house . [He]34-berry approached [the place]357-the place cautiously and went up the steps . [His]34-berry hand touched the bell - pull . [He]34-berry staggered back .

" Oh , [[my]34-berry Gawd]1680-my gawd ! "[34-berry] [he]34-berry said .

There was crape on [Fannie]35-fannie 's bell . [His]34-berry head went round and [he]34-berry held to the door for support . Then [he]34-berry turned the knob and the door opened . [He]34-berry went noiselessly in . At the door of [[Fannie]35-fannie 's room]1535-fannie 's room [he]34-berry halted , sick with fear . [He]34-berry knocked , a step sounded within , and [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife 's face looked out upon [him]34-berry . [He]34-berry could have screamed aloud with relief .

" It ai n't [you]133-his wife ! "[34-berry] [he]34-berry whispered huskily .

" No , it 's [him]34-berry . [He]34-berry was killed in a fight at [the race - track]2332-the race - track . Some o ' [his]34-berry frinds are settin ' up . Come in . "[133-his wife]

[He]34-berry went in , a wild , strange feeling surging at [his]34-berry heart . [She]133-his wife showed [him]34-berry into [the death - chamber]1537-the death - chamber .

As [he]34-berry stood and looked down upon the face of [[his]34-berry enemy]1532-his enemy , still , cold , and terrible in death , the recognition of how near [he]34-berry had come to crime swept over [him]34-berry , and all [his]34-berry dead faith sprang into new life in a glorious resurrection . [He]34-berry stood with clasped hands , and no word passed [his]34-berry lips . But [his]34-berry heart was crying , " Thank [God]57-god ! thank [God]57-god ! [this man]1709-this man 's blood is not on [my]34-berry hands . "[34-berry]

[The gamblers who were sitting up with the dead]1539-the gamblers who were sitting up with the dead wondered who [the old fool]2262-the old fool was who looked at [[their]1539-the gamblers who were sitting up with the dead silent comrade]1541-their silent comrade and then raised [his]2262-the old fool eyes as if in prayer .

* * * * *

When [Gibson]116-gibson was laid away , there were no formalities between [Berry]34-berry and [[his]34-berry wife]133-his wife ; [they]1543-they simply went back to [each other]192-each other . [New York]8-new york held nothing for [them]1543-they now but sad memories . [Kit]38-kitty was on [the road]1362-the road , and [the father]170-the father could not bear to see [[his]170-the father son]135-his son ; so [they]1543-they turned [their]1543-they faces southward , back to [the only place [they]1543-they could call [home]210-home]1548-the only place they could call home . Surely [the people]617-the people could not be cruel to [them]1543-they now , and even if [they]1543-they were , [they]1543-they felt that after what [they]1543-they had endured no wound had power to give [them]1543-they pain .

[Leslie Oakley]127-leslie oakley heard of [their]1543-they coming , and with [her]127-leslie oakley own hands re - opened and refurnished [the little cottage in [the yard]136-the yard for [them]1543-they]1551-the little cottage in the yard for them . There [the white - haired woman]1553-the white - haired woman begged [them]1543-they to spend the rest of [their]1543-they days and be in peace and comfort . It was the only amend [she]1553-the white - haired woman could make . As much to satisfy [her]1553-the white - haired woman as to settle [themselves]1543-they , [they]1543-they took [the cottage]577-the cottage , and many a night thereafter [they]1543-they sat together with clasped hands listening to the shrieks of [the madman]1555-the madman across [the yard]136-the yard and thinking of what [he]1555-the madman had brought to [them]1543-they and to [himself]1555-the madman .

It was not a happy life , but it was all that was left to [them]1543-they , and [they]1543-they took it up without complaint , for [they]1543-they knew [they]1543-they were powerless against some Will infinitely stronger than [their]1543-they own .
